    Rating: 5

    2007-07-31: I love that this headset stays firmly on the head with the band and firmly on the ear with just the ear piece. The sound quality is great, and the ability to mute the mic is the main reason I bought this. The mute switch is in a convenient place and has a nice clip to attach to your shirt. The only reason I give this 4 stars instead of 5 is because I have had a lot of people tell me I sound somewhat distorted when talking on it. Usually I can make it better by adjusting the mic volume (another nice feature) or by moving the mic away from my mouth. Overall good purchase for the money.

    Rating: 4

    2010-03-23: I've been using one of these for years! I replace it with a new one when the old one wears out. The mic is always strong enough to pick up my voice, and I never have complaints about people not being able to hear me. The ear-pad is comfy, and I occasionally forget I have this on. The best part is the adjustable amplifier - if I have distortion from the sound out of my cell phone, I can increase or decrease both the output from the cell phone itself and the amplifier on the headset, and I usually can maximize the sound and minimize distortion. I don't have to hold anything with my hand to get the conversation through.

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-21: Love this type of headset. I use one at work every day, so I got one for home too. I hate things "in" my ear, so this quality over-the-head type keeps everything where it belongs and I can wear it for hours with no pain or irritation. Comfortable and lightweight. Doesn't even mess up hair. It includes a leatherette "cup" for the ear speaker, but I usually don't even use it, finding it comfortable even without it. It converts to an "ear hook" type also, but I don't find that very useful. The inline volume control and mute is nice, although a bit large and heavy. Great sound quality

    Rating: 5

    2012-03-24: This headset works fine, but I expected somewhat better sound quality for the price. Also have not been able to get it to work with my Samsung Galaxy, I'm guess that was an issue with the 2.5 to 3.5 mm plug adapter I got since it works fine with my panasonic cordless phone. Not sure if this would allow you to initiate a call on the cell phone, however, which is what I am really looking for from a headset since bluetooth headset sound quality is so poor.

    Rating: 3

    2006-03-03: I bought this for its durability, but the sound quality was pretty low/poor; volume was low too.

    Rating: 4

    2010-03-03: This is a decent quality headset and sound quality from the ear piece is standard Plantronics quality (i.e. very good). The 2.5mm jack means it won't fit on some mobile phones (this is smaller than a standard headphone jack), but for my Blackberry it's great (both 8820 and Pearl). As a bonus, I also use it with my XBOX 360 controllers (both with the attached messenger keyboard and without) for online gaming. Some people have observed that I sound a little distant with this headset while plugged into the wireless XBOX controller, but repositioning the mic to be as close to my mouth as possible fixes it.There is an adjustable mic sensitivity switch on the plug, but this doesn't seem to make any difference to people at the far end of the conversation.It's held up quite well over the past few years, being stuffed in bags and traveling around. It's not as cool as the wireless headsets (bluetooth etc) but it doesn't take batteries, doesn't have to be recharged and isn't subject to interference. I'll buy it again if/when this one finally dies.

    2014-05-16: Our family is HARD on screen protectors, we've gone through 4 in a month (yeah, I know, right?!) between three different phones. This also helps to eliminate air bubbles and such from under the protector. Be sure to apply this screen protector in the evening before going to bed so it can sit over night unused while the screen protector dries onto the glass.TIP: Grab your cell phone and all supplies. Super clean the bathroom while steaming up the room to prevent dust from becoming air born. Once the room is steamy and clean, go to work installing this screen protector for the absolute best results.

    2014-07-16: Bought this protector to use instead of the one shipped with my OtterBox Commuter case for my Galaxy S5.The installation process is different from the usual "peel and stick" plastic screen protectors. The process requires using the provided liquid spray on the screen protector which then becomes very slippery and a tad cumbersome to align and then to squeegee off the excess liquid. The company did a great job with packaging and instructions and went the extra mile to provide an online video on how to correctly install the protector.With the screen protector being wet and slippery, I found it a bit challenging to see the cut outs and ended up with the camera circle being just a wee bit off. Each time I "squeegeed" the screen protector, it would move just enough to offset the tiny cutout for the camera.Leaving the phone to dry out overnight was a bit unusual as well since I rely on my phone for emergencies. I left the phone powered off.Next morning I was very pleased at what I saw. An almost crystal clear shield with NO bubbles. So what if my camera cut out ended up being a tad off.The clarity of the phone's display is virtually unaffected and the display is easy to read from all angles as if there is no film over it.The sensitivity of the screen protector is unbelievably great. Again, the phone responds as if there is no film over the screen.My apprehensions about applying this screen protector were unfounded.I am very happy with the ArmorSuit military Shield Screen Protector and would definitely recommend it.     Rating: 4

    2013-12-04: So far very pleased. One thing I didn't consider but feel is important is whether the magnetic latch is attached to the front or back cover. In this case it's the front cover which is good. I bought another case where it's attached to the back cover and the problem this creates is that you have to deal with both the latch and front cover separately when you open the case to use the phone. Not a problem with the Cruzerlite case. Fold the magnetic latch behind the front cover so it's sandwiched between the front and back covers and the magnet will hold the front cover in place; folded behind the phone.I have a card in each card slot and a third, with cash, in the larger slot. This does make it a little difficult to close but I'm certain this will improve over time. The rubber case that holds the phone is flexible enough to easily remove the phone which is good for me because my Nexus 5 will not charge on the latest Nexus Qi charger when it's in this case. (I did have success with the last gen "orb-style" Nexus charger). Build quality seems solid. Will post updates if that changes over time. Would definitely recommend.This case does activate wake/sleep state on the phone when you open the front cover.

    2013-11-16: This car charger fits in the cigarette lighter area in your car. For a newer car, that area might be hidden so take a thorough look if you are having trouble finding it. It doesn't have a self-storage clip though, so you will need some sort of rubber band or Velcro when it's not in use.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-16: As a car charger goes, this is effective, and there is nothing particularly notable from it as far as the actual charging goes. I have used it to charge an iPod classic and an Android phone on multiple occasions. It's very convenient to have the capability of having two devices charge at one time, but there are drawbacks. The cord is fairly short, and it doesn't "wind up" or have any tension, as the picture seems to suggest. It will lay completely flat, and it results in a somewhat awkward process when it gets caught somewhere. The problem is further underlined when the second cord, plugged into the free USB port, is significantly longer than the iPod/iPhone cord.Overall conclusion: I would rather invest in a charger with two ports. That would allow me to alternate devices, use only one cord at a time, get two cords with similar lengths, and make it more compact without the cords. If this was used for an iPhone, it would be a more practical purchase, but for me, when I need an Android charged more than any other device, it is not ideal.

    Rating: 4

    2013-10-27: I love the velvety smooth feel of TYLT's flat ribbon car charger. It is just the right length at 2 feet to put on the seat, console, cup holder, or phone holder, but short enough to prevent the user from being able to talk on the phone while driving - and it should be. It fits in the iPhone just snug enough to not fall out, but can easily be removed if needed to make or receive a call. The other end fits in the power outlet/lighter socket with the right amount of strength. I haven't plugged another USB device in the extra charging socket, but that's only because I really don't have anything else to charge. The TYLT ribbon cable charges the iPhone pretty quickly too - more like a quick charger than a trickle charger. Some other reviewers indicate the cable should have an LED to show the phone is charging, and that would be nice, but looking on the phone's display isn't that difficult. The flat ribbon design avoids tangling, especially during storage, I just kind of bunch it up and put it away. Overall it is a nice charger, has nice style, is bright and colorful, but may a little bit over priced.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-05: I was a late comer to the iPhone and iPad. In fact, had I not opted to become a Freshman at Winthrop University shortly after my 78th birthday, I would not have had enough coins in my purse to get them, but for the Pell grant! However I quickly learned that these two devices, particularly the phone, love to gobble up power -- battery stored power, that is. I had invested in a car charger, but its black cords and stuff made it look a lot like the power cord for my GPS, and that was confusing. So when I received this car charger, the first thing that struck me about it was that its bright red color was awesome -- no way to confuse this with the GPS cord. Plugged it in, tried it out and loved it! It is now a permanent resident in my car. No more unexpected flat batteries in the iPhone. Wheeee!

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-11: I love that is doesn't tangle. I really love that I can plug my 4S iPhone into the one end and that there's a USB port on top of the area where it plugs into the adapter/cigarette lighter that allows my wife to plug in her portable iPhone 5 cord and charge her phone simultaneously. Both our phones often need charging at the same time when we are out and about, and that's the best thing about this. Only qualm I would have is that you probably won't have a super easy time using your phone while it's charging if your cigarette lighter is far away from you in the car, and that is because the cord doesn't stretch very far. Other than that, great product worth the extra money.

    2013-11-18: The TYLT Flat Silicone Dual-charging car charger well pretty well with my iphone 4s. Charging time is pretty quick with the added benefit of the dual charging function which allow us to charge two devices simultaneously. The design is fashionable with a variety of color. The flat band helps prevent the cable from getting tangled. The only area of improvement I could think of is that the flat cable is more bulkier than the original slim cable.

    Rating: 4

    2013-11-04: What's the number one problem with the standard Apple charging cords? Over time the think plastic casing around the fiber optics wear out or tear (at least in my experience). TYLT delivers a flat cord that is made of strong silicone that is durable enough to stand up to any type of abuse. Although I've only had it a few weeks, there's not doubt in my mind that this will last. Yes, it is not a lightening style charger, it is meant for older apple devices. However, the included USB port allows for the addition of any other type of USB charger you would have.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-21: This is definitely more rugged than the skinny round wires I usually have hanging out of my car charger. This looks better too.I can plug my Ipod touch or Iphone (not ipads) in and then there is an additional USB slot at the end so I can also charge my gps or a smart phone.I need the TYLT people to make one of these with a 3.5mm jack at both ends. Please.After using this device in more than one car, it seems that the shape of the part that goes into the charger does not allow for a snug fit in all cars. In our Pontiac, we have to hold the cable up for it to make a successful connection.

    Rating: 3

    2013-10-26: Love this bright cord. Great for recharging my iPad 3 in the car. Being flat keeps it tangle free. Also good for recharging my nano. I haven't used the USB outlet yet but am sure I will... maybe for my iPhone 5 with a little extension cord. Good product; could be even better with a lightening connector.

    Rating: 4

    2013-11-21: Works great for an iPhone 4, and the extra USB port works for an iPhone 5S (BYO cord) without error. The TYLT cord is about 1/2 inch wide and 1/8 inch thick. In the car, it is a bit bulky to store, but is certainly easy to find and doesn't get tangled. The extra port is very convenient. It is pretty tight, so removing the extra cord from it is a bit difficult--better than too loose though.

    Rating: 4

    2013-12-01: The key to whether you will use this charging device is how convenient it is to use. After using it on a trip I thought it worked well, but not enough to make me use it rather than the charging device that came with my cell phone. If you recharge two devices this will work fine for you.

    Rating: 4

    2013-10-26: This was just what I was looking forI go through docking cables every 6 months because I charge my phone in my car using a power outlet under the center armrest. This crimps typical cables causing them to short out after a while.This cable is flat and seems very durable. It inserts and comes out of the power outlet easily. It attaches firmly to my iPhone even with a case. The length is just right for me, but may be a little short for some.The USB port is potentially useful, but unfortunately for me it is on the automobile plug and isn't very accessible inside the center console.The only disadvantage is the price, but I think it is worth it.

    Rating: 4

    2013-12-18: I love my red TYLT BAND FLAT DUAL CAR APPLE/USB CAR CHARGER. First of all it is RED, which means it is identifiable a MINE and NOT one of the kids. Otherwise, all my charging cables "mysteriously" disappear. Second, I love that it is wide and flat. It comes right out of the glove box (does anyone actually use the glove box for gloves anymore?) straight, untangled, and ready to use - no attempting to untie knots while driving. Also, it is easy to find by touch, so you are never taking your eyes off the road. Next, it will charge either an ipad (we always need more charging capability on long trips!) by itself, or two smaller devices (iPhone, blackberries, etc) at the same time. That is a really, really nice feature.The only note that I would point out here is that the built in ipad connector is the old style. If you have an ipad mini or an iPhone gen 5, you will need to provide the correct cable and plug it into the USB port. But that would not stop me from buying more TYLT BAND FLAT DUAL CAR APPLE/USB CAR CHARGERs. I find this cable really convenient and easy to use on long trips, and it is definitely well made, sturdy, and reliable.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-13: The bright red color & the thickness of the cord makes it easy to use & find in the center storage area in my car. It doesn't tangle & the connections are secure. This version uses the old Apple connection - NOT the newer "Lightning Connector". But the 30-pin adapter works so I could charge both my new & old iPods.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-14: Length: perfectMaterial: rubber/silicon, perfect.Color: red, perfect, makes it easy to find.Charges two iPhones together or one iPhone one iPad , but can't charge two iPads at the same time.Love the USB add on port for charging a second device. Could be android too.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-21: The color is awesome and the design is cool. You can plug not only a 4S iphone (or below) into it, but you can plug in a second usb device. Or, if you have an iphone 5 or 5C or 5S, then you can plug that cord into the USB port of this cable. The only downside is that the cord is pretty short. It's really not long enough to keep charged while you have the phone to your ear (although I guess you're not supposed to have the phone to your ear while driving!). But that is pretty minor. It's a high-quality cable that seems like it will last longer than the iphone itself.

    Rating: 4

    2013-11-05: This charger is ultimately my favorite! Not only is the design massively cool looking, but it works like a charm! The TYLT band is two feet in length, and is made out of the same stuff most cell phone cases are lined with, a nice smooth silicone material. It's as wide as a ruler, and the material is perfect for non-tangled cables! I, personally, hate trying to drive and wiggle out the knots in my car charger at the same time. It's so easy to plug up when you realize your battery is on the downward slope to oblivion! There is seriously no need to worry about another tangled car charger with this particular style. I also found it to be very, very durable. My niece found the charger, and had fun with it, which included being stepped on, half smashed between a cabinet drawer, and stretched as a bracelet before I saved the day, and there is literally no damage. This cable does only work for an Iphone 4s or later as it has the 30 pin connector, and not the updated lightning pin. BUT...this car charger also includes a USB port right at the front where the charging area pops into your car's cigarette lighter. So technically you can charge an Iphone 5 or 5s, by plugging in an extra cable. I did try this, and it worked totally fine, charging my phone up very quickly!I noticed some reviewers stating that the cable didn't feel secure when plugged in to the cigarette lighter or to their device, but mine felt perfectly fine. There was no wiggle room, and everything fit very securely and snug. And this was plugging up an Iphone 4s, using, of course, the cigarette lighter, and using the USB port by plugging up my Iphone 5s. Again, it was all a very secure fit. I've had no issues with this charger at all! It isn't very long in length, but my charger is very close to me, and I've actually been able to make a call while charging in. But I am a tiny individual who sits close to the wheel as it is. All in all I have to say I love this charger, and it's definitely worth it!As a side note, one of my coworkers saw this charger, and immediately purchased three as Christmas presents for her children! It's just that awesome!

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-26: This is a very convenient, heavy-duty car charger that actually looks good. The flat ribbon design means it doesn't tangle like a lot of less substantial chargers, and it tucks away nicely in the center console. Works with iPhone 3 and 4 and 1st through 4th generation iPod touch, but not the newest iPhone. Nice product!

    Rating: 4

    2013-11-03: What I like about this unit: It's not easy to lose in all the cords in the car these days. It is STURDY. For someone who has crushed, stomped, and run over a fair number of cords in the last 30 years or so, sturdy is a big deal. It seems to work, which I find surprising, given its strange configuration.What I don't like as much: It only fits a very limited range of equipment. It does not fit entirely snugly, nor does it charge steadily. I only used it on an aged Apple i-pod, so that may have a bearing on the performance of the dual charging device. I don't know that it can actually dual charge, as promised, but I'm not willing to say it won't. And, as with the other TYLT products I've reviewed, it has really skimpy documentation. No tips or tricks on how to make it seat better, either into the i-pod, or into the car charger.As is also typical with TYLT products, there's a certain elegance in design, yet there's also an awkward execution. It doesn't quite live up to its potential. But I defy you to misplace this item for long!

    Rating: 4

    2013-12-05: I can charge my iPad 2 & my iPhone5 in the car at the same time with this one piece charger. This cable is durable and bright and easy to spot. Works wonderfully and I'm very pleased with this product.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-25: The material on the cord is much like a TPU product case. It has that smooth plastic feel yet grippy at the same time. Plugged into the rear center console, the kids can't use devices still. In the center console, it doesn't reach the dash. Only the 12v plug on the dash is feasible.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-22: This is an absolutely fantastic solution to charging your Apple products in your car!First, I love the fact that it not only has a charger for an iPhone 4 or iPad in addition to an additional USB port for an additional device to be charged. This has been very helpful for my husband and I to charge both our phones. I charged my iPad with this charger (only one device charging at the same time) and it charged at the same speed my iPad charges with the standard wall charger, so it has a good deal of power and helps your phones charge quickly.In addition I absolutely love the design and the material. It is this strange rubbery material that doesn't get scratched or damaged, so it holds up well in your car (we have stepped on and broken a couple of the harder plastic charger ports already). But the cord itself is the real genius to this charger. It is wide and flat so it NEVER gets tangled either upon itself or with another cord! I absolutely love this charger and will be buying more for stocking stuffers this holiday season!

    2013-08-15: I've been searching for a car charger that charged my S4 at the same rate as the wall charger that came with my phone. Not only does this charger do that it does it with style, I love the flat cable and the connection fits with all of my SPG cases.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-04: This is a surprisingly useful addition to the fleet of iPhone car charger setups in the world! I was prepared to be bored, but it has become a staple in our cars that do not have built in USB charging ports.Pros:1. Both iPhone and USB charging ports that can be used in parallel. I have mine connected to both the iPhone and my battery case in parallel for much faster charging overall.2. The tangle free ribbon actually does not tangle. It is about the right length for all of my four possible applications (1996 Accord, 2006 Honda Van, 2013 Volt, and 2006 Prius).3. The loud color is a plus in the dark upholstered interiors of my cars. I can find the thing.4. The plugs at each end are designed to allow you to use a thumb to press them in vs. having to grab the sides as in most chargers.a. This allows more leverage in a tight power plug.b. The offset design allows you to know top from bottom without looking.5. The cable housing (rubber cover) is molded over both connectors so as to provide strain relief as well as protection. Your chances of pulling this unit apart are therefore greatly reduced by design.6. The voltage converter in the plug does not seem to inject hum or noise the way some cheaper ones do, into the iPhone audio played back via the car speakers.Cons:I can't think of any other than the packaging it arrived in. It was very excessive in its use of materials, I would say. This would not prevent me from buying it, but the enclosure makes a lot of use of plastic and has almost more material it it than the product itself. The biggest example for me was the heavy duty plastic collar around the clear plastic container. The collar and package together made me think that this was supposed to be a permanent case for the charger, but it isn't. It's to be tossed or recycled after opening as it would be very inconvenient to re-use for a number of reasons I won't detail here. What is the point of this? It looked cool, but I bet they could have achieved this without the extra packaging. Keep in mind, I am not a tree hugger, either (e.g. eat meat, vote Republican, don't believe in global warming, etc.). So, this had to be pretty excessive for me to take note.Conclusion:Great little device!

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-08: I used a BlackBerry for several years before I switched to the iPhone. The one thing that I missed was the original BlackBerry brand holster case. It's about a 1/4" wider and 1/4" taller than the iPhone 5, but that isn't a problem for me. I use anelago S5 Slim Fit 2 Case for iPhone 5 - eco friendly Retail Packaging - Soft Feeling Dark Graycase on my iPhone, and the thickness is just right for the Z10 case--there's actually a little extra room.So for those looking for a great holster case, this one works great for an iPhone...or a Z10.

My Mac address book (not icloud, local address book), and calendar entries synced without a glitch.Keypad is still here to stay I guess.Just some thoughts about setting up BIS and for those with $30 Data Unlimited iPhone Plan:I initially had problem setting up the BIS because the device is not recognized by the network as this unit from Amazon is unlocked. I called AT&T; and reported the IMEI and PIN of the device, rebooted and everything went well, including setting up my AOL email account on the BIS from the phone (does not allow you to setup BIS through your Mac or PC browser--very strange). My $30 Data Unlimited iPhone plan which I had since Feb 2009 was converted to same $30 Data Unlimited Blackberry plan. AT&T; rep assured me that I can switch back to same Data Unlimited iPhone plan when it is released.

  • B00DD46UHC

    $B00DD46UHC

    2014-05-13: In a world of numerous phone case options, Diztronic gets it just right. The look and feel in one's hand is superbly minimalistic; It matches my phone; and it does well against drops and bumps.As for longevity: this is the second Diztronic case I've ordered. The last was for my Atrix 2. It held up for all two years of my Atrix 2's lifespan. This new one for my S4 Active seems to be of the exact same quality, which is excellent.If you are looking for a super do-it-all, protect your phone against space, water, asteroids, gamma radiation, and whatever else, don't consider the Diztronic. The bulky Otterbox cases do that. If you need a quality, good looking case for general shock and scratch protection, this case is it.

    2013-08-09: Update 8/11/2013I've updated my rating from 3 to 4 stars based on Diztronic's reply to my review. My primary concern was a possibility of receiving a used product. Clay's explanation of the blemish by the USB port area convinced me that the case I received was new. The finish could still be improved however. Small blemish aside, the case is beautiful and very comfortable to hold, fits perfectly, and very slim. I'd recommend it to anyone looking for a slim case that would still offer some protection to your phone.Original Review:I ordered my case through Diztronnic's eBay store. The case was shipped promptly but I'm not happy with the case's finish. I ordered a Matte Back Charcoal Gray Flexible TPU Case for a Galaxy S4 Active. The case has worn out area right by the charging port where one would normally use a fingernail to open the rubber gasket. Not sure if it's a manufacturing defect but it looks like the rubber coating is worn out from use. The case itself is super slim and doesn't affect the size of the S4 Active too much but the product's finish could be better. Either that or they sent me a used case.The case fits well, feels nice and actually looks nice on the S4; hence, the 3 star rating. But from issue I mentioned above, I'm not too confident it will last too long. For the price, it's not worth the time to return for an exchange or refund. But I'm not sure I would be buying another product from Diztronic.

The matte black is awesome, feels great in my hands its thinner than an otterbox too. It's taken quite a few falls so far and not a scratch dent or crack anywhere. I provides a notch less of protection than n otterbox but the case also adds on less bulk and weight. I think its just the right amount of protection.

  • B002YGYOBY

    $B002YGYOBY

    2010-07-30: I got these because the trackball of my Blackberry 8300 was sticking. And I thought the colors would be cool.This seller got the package to me quickly, and everything was there. I tried out a few of the colors, and the trackballs move nice and smoothly. Maybe not quite as fluid as a trackball on a brand new Blackberry, that is why I took away one star. But I've had no problems so far. And they were easy to install. I've instaled trackballs before, but for someone who has never done this before, you use the included "guitar pick"-like tool they send to gently pry out the silver retaining ring, take out the old trackball, place the new trackball in the slot, and snap a new ring into place. It's realy easy and takes just a couple minutes.For the mechanically disinclined, maybe 5 minutes.This is a good replacement for a good price.

    Rating: 4

    2010-08-06: This is way better than buying an OEM trackball, plus it looks way cooler! I have a blue trackball in my blackberry right now and when the LED behind the trackball lights up the whole trackball glows blue. Lovely. The only thing I don't like is that some of the rings that came in the package were already broken, good thing there is 5!

    Rating: 4

    2010-03-25: This set of 5 replacement trackballs were just what I needed for our Blackberry 8330s (we have 4 of them). My Blackberry is very heavily used and I have already gone through two trackballs and at least one of the other Blackberry devices have begun to act sluggish. Since it seems that this is going to be a regular occurrence, a set of 5 trackballs seemed like a good investment.These are decent quality and the colors are nice for variety. The included "opening tool" (looks like a guitar pick) is just about worthless for removing the silver retaining ring, so I just used a utility knife point to pop it out. Once the retaining ring is off, just pop out the old one, put in the new one, and replace the retaining ring (use the original or one of the included replacements).These are a fairly inexpensive way to self service your Blackberry. I decided to try this first before taking it to the Sprint store to fix, so likely saved a lot by doing it myself.Recommended!CFH

    Rating: 4

    2011-05-16: My CrackBerry trackball suffers from greasy fingers, exposure to elements, and all kinds of crap. I'm surprised it lasted as long as it did. Actually, what did it in was my feeble attempt to clean it. I took it a part, cleaned the little magnetic bits, put it back together and managed to cram it back in place. The ball worked better but was oriented 90 degress off! Argh...Then I looked on Amazon for a replacement was was dismayed to find they were only $2-$3 a piece. After reading the reviews, I noticed that some balls are inferiors. So I ordered this five pack. If one gets clogged, I've got more!Replacing was easier with the little blue tool. It popped out the retaining ring. I replaced the trackball and tried to replace the retaining ring. The "legs" on these retaining rings are a thinner metal. It's hard to line the legs up properly. Fortunately, my original retaining ring still worked fine. I used it.My CrackBerry is now fixed and the trackback glows green! I love cheap replacement parts!

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-24: I got this for someone else who has a constant problem with the trackball on their Blackberry. They tell me it works well, for awhile, then needs to be changed again. I wouldn't buy from this seller again , as they ship from overseas!

  • B00AX49VBW

    $B00AX49VBW

    2013-07-23: When I first got it, I didn't think it was fake. It looked really nice and worked like a charm- for a day. On day two, the "Charging is not supported with this accessory" appeared. I unplugged and plugged it back in. Still no go. I had no choice but to take it off and return it. Upon visiting mophie.com, I realized that even Amazon is not an authorized dealer, not to mention "Fulfill by Amazon". Buy this from your wireless carrier. From Bestbuy. Even from Gamestop! You will sleep much better knowing you get a real one with a year warrantee.EDIT: Now I have had this case for 2 weeks now, I can say...1. I ordered it when it said it was sold by Fireball. When it was shipped, it said it was from MobileCityOnline, which was an authorized dealer. After comparing it to another one from the Verizon store under a magnified glass, it was real.2. Even the Verizon store one gave me the "Charging is not supported with this accessory". As it turned out, if your phone got charged way ahead of the battery case, this message will show up. Not every time but very likely. If you just leave it alone, it will still charge both regardless.3. It still won't sync with your iTunes with the case on.4. I decided to keep it and returned the one I got from Verizon for comparison.

    Rating: 4

    2014-02-27: I had the Mophie Helium when it first came out for the iPhone 5, and it worked pretty well; however, it's main feature is that it was super-light, and you could get almost a full charge out of it. I use my phone for my job, so I'd kill the Helium every day, and come home running on fumes - generally at about 4% of the battery life. If I had a dinner or something after work, I was dead in the water.The Plus pack is *exactly* what I needed. It's heavier than the Helium, but I don't mind that in the slightest. It's pretty slim-line for the amount of backup battery it provides - I can generally get almost 2 full recharges out of it through the day. The case is a matte silvery red color (I know this sounds weird - just trust me on this), and it's attractive without being gaudy.The only complaint I have is the rubberized border around my case has started to wiggle a little bit. It doesn't affect the functionality of the case at all, but I have this sneaking suspicion it's going to eventually fall off. I didn't ding the case in my rating for this, as it just might be my case only - Mophie generally makes a pretty good product.Bottom line: if you need a single charge for a backup, go with the Helium. If you need something heavy-duty that looks good at the same time, go with the Plus. I'm a fan.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-25: I had heard everyone raving about Mophie but being a bit of a pennypincher on some things, I decided to test 5 cases head to head to see if a less expensive one could be just as good. Final result was - Mophie won!Pros:Volume, ringer and sleep buttons - THESE ARE AWESOME! This case has a design that matches the iPhone buttons very well. Doesn't have plastic buttons covering your metal iPhone controls or a cutout that you need to reach into - this design is fantastic!Rubbery feeling case - doesn't slip in my hand or get fingerprints on itOn/off button - I like that I decide when the battery pack is charging my phone back upBattery level button - With one tap, you can easily see how much battery is left (in 25% increments)Lip protects screen - many of the other cases I tested didn't have enough of a lip to protect the screen in case of a fall. I'm clumsy, so the Mophie had the best design for me by farGreat speaker design - not sure if it just redirects the sound, but I much prefer having my sound in the front of the phone, and it also seems louderCons:It's only a 2100 mAh instead of 2400 like others I testedPrice is higher, but it is totally worth the extra investment.That's pretty much it. I can't think of any other cons!

    2013-11-21: As a note, I did not buy this from Amazon. I travel, and my company supplied to me along with my iPhone.First, it does add some weight and girth to your phone. If you enjoy the lightness of the iPhone, this is going to be disconcerting. If you use a holder, it's going to be a big issue. I tend to keep my phone in my pocket, and it does not bother me at all.Another big potential deal breaker. It takes a micro-USB to charge. If you need to dock with the lighting plug, you can't use it while the external case is on. If you're like me and have a bunch of micro USB chargers laying around and don't need the dock, you'll actually appreciate this.This case does allow another full charge and is invaluable when traveling. And it offers quite a bit of protection while doing so. If your power needs aren't that big, it's probably unnecessary.

    2014-05-10: I did not buy this from Amazon, but rather got it from an Apple store. Apparently many of the bad reviews are because people are getting counterfeit products, but, since I got mine from the Apple store, it's the real thing. As far as I'm concerned, this is the best case you can get for your iphone. It offers several advantages. First, of course, it provides the protection of a case. The one thing I wish it had was a screen protector, this case will not help to protect the screen. Second, it really extends your phone's run time. Obviously, your results may not be the same as mine, but I have been running it for 2 days, and still have 2 of the 4 lights showing on the case, and of course, my iphone battery itself has not been used at all. That is amazing. It will make your phone a bit bigger, but that's a small price to pay for the protection and extra battery life you get. Another advantage to this case is that you can charge both the case and the iphone using a standard micro USB cable. Since Apple insists on using proprietary USB cables for no good reason, this can make things much easier if you happen to be out and don't have your lightning cable with you. This will allow you to use the same USB cable that just about every other mobile device uses. So, there you have it, you may want to purchase directly from the mophie web site, to be sure you don't get a fake product. If you get the real thing, it's a great product for sure.

    2014-02-14: So far, so good. Just got it. easy to install phone.     Rating: 5

    2014-03-15: Of course one of the great things about the iPhone is how sleek and thin it is. It's a great balance between practicality and size. The mophie juice pack throws this out the door. It adds a significant amount of size to the phone. It's not a game ender though. The phone is still small, but it's now twice as thick and slightly longer and wider.As for charging, I did some tests. I completely drained the juice pack plus to zero. I then charged the juice pack up to 100%. While the juice pack was charging, I ran my phone down to 10% battery. I then put the phone and mophie back together and started charging.After 1 hour I was up to 68%. After 2.25 hours I was up to 99%. At this point I stopped the charging process and turned off the mophie. The light indicator was showing 1 light left on the mophie battery. Once my phone got down to 70%, I turned the mophie back on to see how much charge I would have left, and it charged me back up to 86% before running out of juice.Also, it takes about 3 hours to fully charge the juice pack.Although the size bothers me, I think the design is the best they could do. It's a high quality case. The buttons on the side and top are very nice and accurate, and much better than having cut-outs there. The speaker and mic redirectors at the bottom of the phone work just fine, and although the headphone extension cable is one more thing to keep track up, it does work well.I used a bose docking station at my office, so during a normal week, my phone is always charged. However, when traveling, or over a busy weekend of high phone usage, I have encountered not having enough battery. My plans for this case are to not have it on the phone at all times (I have to disconnect the bottom part of the case to dock it to my bose speaker anyway). I will just use this during times when I think I'll need more battery than what the phone can give me. It will be a handy accessory, but I won't have to deal with the large case all the time. Mophie did a good job with this and it's a very high quality product. It's more expensive than it's competitors, but I think the quality justifies this. Also I have a ZAGG invisible shield on the front and back of my phone and the case still goes on my phone with no problems.Just a small side note, those who complain that it's a micro USB on the bottom and not a lightning connector, this is not Mophie's fault. Of course they would have used lightning if they could have. This is a restriction that Apple puts on 3rd party hardware makers. They can access the lightning port on the phone (i.e. bose sound dock, mophie juice pack for charging), but they are not allowed to then replicate the lightning connector on the outside of the case. So Mophie had to use the micro USB. At lease they used a universal connector so it's easy to find cable for this if you lose yours.

    Rating: 4

    2014-03-23: I wish I could give this case more than 5 stars...it is that good. Initially I had purchased the Mophie Air. It looks almost identical to the Plus. I used the the Air for a few days before taking it back to BestBuy. It was killing my reception and I was very frustrated with it. I listen to podcasts and online sports talk radio on my phone while at work. Let me state for the record, I do not get the best reception at work, HOWEVER, as soon as I began using the Air my reception got even worse! I was constantly getting "no service" and "text didn't send" indications. My tunein, iheart and Sirius radio apps were constantly dropping and trying to reconnect. I got extremly tired of seeing that spinning ball while I waiting for my favorite sports talk show to reconnect!! I was just about to give up on Mophie's and charging cases all together. I then decided to exchange the Air. My intention was to get another Air, in hopes that the first one was just defective. Well, I changed my mind and got the Plus. I even bought a completely different color too. To make a long story short, the Plus works like a charm! It is almost like night and day. Reception is no longer an issue. I listened to the NCAA tournament on tunein all day and rarely did I lose my connection. Now to discuss the performance of the Plus. I let my phone's battery run down to 19% and then flipped the switch on the Mophie Plus. It charged my phone back up to 100% in probably an hour or so. Not only that, the Mophie still had some juice left in it. After my phone hit 100% I left the Mophie on for over 3 more hours. My phone never dropped below 100% I then recharged the Mophie...but even then it still was not completely dead. It still had one light lit! I was blown away. This case is awesome.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-16: This is my third Mophie Juice Pack, currently the Juice Pack Plus for my iPhone 5 and now on my iPhone 5s. It works great for a few months, then the connection for charging the phone begins to cycle back and forth. I am an engineer and troubleshot that it is either the pin connections between the two halves of the case or the switch connection itself. I have to pull the case bottom off and reset it, and also sometimes I have to turn the charging switch on to off and back to on again. The connections are clean, no bends. The cycling is annoying because your phone starts to beep every 5 seconds, going from charge to not charging. You have to pull the phone from your pocket and pull and reconnect the base. Also, when you push the charge level button the LED lights do not light up when this happens. This is my third Mophie Juice Pack to do this.Also, the back of the case scratches very easily, and it is pretty marred up from simply carrying it in my pocket.On a previous unit the micro USB connector went bad, and no matter what connector I used, it would not keep a good charging connection.If the cycling keeps up, I will try to get a warranty replacement.

  • B008EOXKXI

    $B008EOXKXI

    2013-05-13: OK, I got this screen protector (and a case) because I'm not interested in pampering my phone at all.Installation was as easy as that of any other flexible screen protector. Its instructions tell you to wet the surface with water or some proprietary fluid but I just stuck it on after wiping the screen with lens cleaning fluid, making sure there was no dust also. Any bubbles are easily worked out with the cloth and plastic card provided.As far as protection, I don't know. I put it on so it would take the damage from hard materials like sand. The screen itself is pretty impervious to softer things like most metals. Just note that it doesn't even cover all of the non-curved parts of the screen. It's just wide enough to cover the display (so you have to be precise in placement) and goes up to the top of the earpiece and down to the bottom of the home button. That means the touch buttons on either side are kinda-sorta covered. It would have been better if they extended down a bit more to at least cover the touch button lights.Once it's installed, it provides a matte surface that resists visible fingerprints and softens reflections. Instead of reflecting like a mirror, some rays will be scattered slightly off. However, there is still a visible reflection if you happen to have a bright light source on the other side of a coplanar normal from you. Still, it's beneficial to have on as blurry objects aren't as distracting.However, this matte surface is achieved by making it bumpy on a microscopic level. This is what makes what people are calling a "pixelation" effect. This is actually an inaccurate term. What is really happening is that because the surface is bumpy, the screen protector turns into a convex lens in some places and a concave lens in others, resulting in a slight magnification of certain subpixels and diminution of others. Yes, I know that MediaDevil said this would happen and I know that when I bought it. MediaDevil says this can't be avoided but I don't quite believe it. There is no such effect on most desktop monitors with a matte surface, which uses the same strategy. The difference is that the bumps on desktop monitors are on a significantly smaller scale than the subpixels, so they don't really get bigger or smaller than their neighboring subpixels. On the Galaxy S III, with 306 pixels per inch, the bumps are too similar in scale. Why is it so impossible to decrease the scale? Is the surface lose durability if the bumps are smaller? I don't know. It isn't an issue of wavelength. If the deepest red is 740nm, one would have to get to at least 5000ppi (with equal RGB subpixels) to have a wavelength problem.Knocking one star off for not advancing science.

    Rating: 4

    2013-06-01: This is great! I can see the screen clearly now while in the sun. This is definitely worth the money! Some people have said that it makes the screen a little pixelated, but honestly I can't even tell, I am just so pleased with this product! It fits the screen nicely, no it does not extend to the outer left and right sides of the phone (beyond the ends of the screen) but I think that is perfect because if you have a case on the phone the case will not peel off the screen protector. Bottom line this is a great screen protector!

    Rating: 5

    2012-11-04: A lot of people dont like matte screen protectors because they decrease the screen quality.     2014-03-19: I agree with the company that in order for it to stick well, it can't cover the whole front glass surface because of those curved edges. However, mine doesn't stick on some edges.     2013-08-04: Good idea....butI really can't tell if there is a differencebetween this horn and the volume of the cell phone...

    Rating: 2

    2012-08-21: Firstly, this is not an amplifier. There are not batteries, amplification circuitry, or, (for that matter) speakers.What this is, is a cleverly designed megaphone and iPhone stand. It takes the sound produced by your iPhone speakers and focuses is like a... megaphone. The result is decent quality, room filling sound.The "device" is light and flexible, yet rigid enough to securely support my phone. I toss it in my suitcase without worrying about it being broken. There are no batteries or cables to worry about. And, for the price it can be replaced easily if I should misplace it.This has become a staple in my carry-on (usually all I take when I travel) since it provides a lot of functionality with almost no additional bulk or bother.Please feel free to let Amazon and me know whether this was helpful to you or not, since it helps me improve my reviews.

    Rating: 5

    2013-03-04: I think people expect too much out of this little guy. It is a basic amplifier that will give you a little extra boost in volume without have to "plug in" to anything. I like to use is when I am watching videos - it amplies the volume enough to I can still hear my iPod in different rooms if I am multi-tasking.

    Rating: 4

    2012-04-25: Okay, they got me. I bought this 'amplifier' in an attempt to run on a treadmill without headphones. Unfortunately, the only thing this product did, was amplify the worst tinny notes from the tiny cellphone speaker, making your listening experience, incredibly annoying. Did it make my iPhone louder? No, not in any significant way. This is most definitely not an alternative to a powered speaker. It shouldn't even be considered an accessory at all. It fits nicely in the trash can, though!!!

    2014-03-03: Love this!! I use this on my phone at night because I have shard time hearing my alarm in the mornings.. I'm just a very deep sleeper. It has definitely helped me out, works great!

    Rating: 5

    2011-10-25: It's cute. It's flexible and easy to pack. The packaging it comes in is pretty. It amplifies the sound a bit, but don't expect miracles. Also, be aware that only the right speaker at the base of the iPhone actually gets channeled into the horn. The sound from the left speaker shoots out a little hole in the bottom, unaltered. It shipped directly from China, so you get to receive a box with interesting Chinese postage markings.** edit ** It's been pointed out that there is only one speaker, so the horn is actually capturing all of the sound output from the one mono speaker. The other opening -- the microphone -- is left exposed via a hole/tunnel in the silicone structure.

  • B008IOQ3K6

    $B008IOQ3K6

    2014-07-19: My wife is an iphone person - I am an andoid person. This has always caused problems when finding a good quality phone dock for our cars. The iMagnet is compatible with all phones. This means the dock in her car works with my phone, and dock in my car works with her phone.Never again will we fuss with clasps, clips, or snaps. The iMagnet is so easy you just put your phone up to the magnet and let go.The magnet is strong enough that even my Galaxy Note 3 is held up with no problem. The suction cup and sticky surface have lasted for almost a year now and we have not had any problems with the dock slipping. Even in 100 degree + weather the docks have held firm.PROS:Cross platform compatibleEasy to installEven easier to useHolds even the largest phones (I have a Galaxy Note 3)Doesn't lose grip or suctionCONS:If you have an iPhone you will also need to be using a case to use this dock (the metal disc needs to go between your phone and your case.) Alternatively you can use the adhesive disk to stick the disc to the back of your phone (if you don't use an iphone case.)

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-12: This is a coolest little device. I was very skeptical when I pulled it out of the box -- so skeptical, that I still have the box and all the accoutrement on the passenger seat, just in case I changed my mind. It's been three days since I've been using it, and it works perfectly. Easy to install, stays in place, and is surprisingly sturdy.Pros:- Small, doesn't block view- Rubberized, so your phone stays at the orientation you suggest- Metal plate you add to your phone case is very slim. I have a hard plastic case that is very snug, and the stick-on plate still worked great- Simple to use -- this is not brain science. Some other bracketed mounts make you feel like you need to be an engineer just to get the right angle!Cons:- my only complaint -- and it's minor -- is that I can't press the button of my iPhone without bracing the phone against my hand first. Not a big deal, though it could hinder quick adjustments when driving. I think it is worth the sacrifice for this fabulous mountEnjoy!

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-01: I bought the iMagnet for my new iP5, and my work phone, a Samsung GS3. I am a delivery driver. This is by far hands down the best, if you are a in-and-out-of-the car alot driver. The ease of installation and removal is unsurpassable, by far. Get the device near the iMag, and zap! Done.The kit came with three metal thin plates to attach to the device of your choice, so it will cover two smartphones and a GPS easy. Two of the discs are self adhesive, the other one is made to put behind the back of the phone between the case and the phone.I dont intend to carry it around to stick on the walls of my kitchen, bathroom, whatever, but the design of the holder makes it much easier to carry around with you, as opposed to large crab like holders. It is VERY small compared to, well anything else.The suction cup held overnight with temps dropping from the high 60s' to the the high 20s'.Now the only negative I can see is having more than three devices, but Im preety sure if you contact these guys, thell send you some more plates. I dont know, but..iMagnet420 Dewey BlvdSan FranciscoCA 94116They also have one for iPad too.Great idea.So get one already.[...]

    Rating: 5

    2014-07-08: I was a little worried about buying this because of the magnets and considering I have a very expensive phone (the Note 3), but all my worries were unfounded. This dashboard mount is the best I've ever used. I thought my last one was the best, but this one is great. I have the note 3 with the Otter box defender series case (a very heavy and substantial case) and I had no problem using this mount. I live on a very bumpy road and the only problem I have is when I'm going down my road the phone tilts a little on the mount by the time I get to the end of my road. (it doesn't fall off just tilts a little) My road is the only road I've ever noticed a problem on and when I say it's bumpy, it's really tore up. I use the large magnet cause the small round one was too small to keep my phone on the mount because of the weight. (both magnets are included with the mount) I've used this mount for about 6 months and it's still great. One time I did notice that it messed up my gps directions (I use gps a lot) and I had to restart my gps. This could've been an error with the google maps app though but it was moving my location the wrong way and when I restarted the app it was fine again. All in all a great mount that's very easy to use. Just put your phone to it and it sticks and then it's very easy to get your phone back off again. I used to use the IOttie one touch extra large phone mount which I loved also but it wouldn't fit my note 3 when I got the defender series case by Otter Box so I gave it to my husband and I love this one now. Give it a try to you won't be disappointed. I will say that when I first tried sticking the dashboard mount to my dash it wouldn't stick, but I found out it was my fault cause I was playing with the switch that makes it stick when I first got it and when you flick the switch that makes it stick to your dash, it makes the sticker that's stuck to the bottom suction cup suck in and it doesn't cover it all the way and I got like 2 specs of dust on the bottom. I went inside and ran the suction cup under hot water and shook the excess water off and went back outside and it stuck on the very first time and has not moved since. It has a strong suction cup once you click the switch down. I think that should be all that I know about the mount. I hope this helps someone that it wondering weather they should get this or not.

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-25: I was stoked to get this mount because my Galaxy s4 has a case that I don't want to remove just to dock it. The mount sticks great to the windshield and any flat surface in my vehicles. The magnet is not so great. It has enough strength to hold the phone on the dock but sometimes my phone will get bumped to the side or flipped upside down, especially on hard turns or bumpy roads. If the rubber on the mount gets dusty, it is even less effective.I suppose that if I were able to center the metal plate on the back of my S4 it would have those problems but if I don't have the metal plate towards the bottom half of my phone, it will activate the S-cover sensor on my phone, the screen will turn black and I can't do anything but check the time.Another issue is that my phone's wireless Qi charger properly with the metal plate stuck to the back of my phone unless I put the plate under the battery cover which severely weakens the magnet to the point of where my phone will go flying off the dock if I hit a bump in the road. Taking the case off fixes that problem, but leaves my phone vulnerable which isn't an option for me.In my situation, this dock is not worth it, should have kept the packaging and returned it.

    2014-02-17: The magnet is very strong, securely holding my phone, even with the metal disk placed between my case and the mount. I've tried several different docks/cradles/mounts over the years to hold my phone, this is by far the best one. You can use it for any phone out there, as well as GPS systems, MP3 players, etc. I am curious to know if the metal plate in my case will interfere with wireless charging, since my phone is a Qi enabled device (Nexus 4), however I don't currently have a wireless charger to test with.

    Rating: 4

    2013-06-18: I've had my phone riding on the passenger seat for years, just plugged into my car's charge socket. Not so good for nav, but I always used my Garmin for that because better voice nav on the iPhone didn't exist. Now that voice nav is enabled on Google Maps, the iPhone is a credible navigation device in the car. Sorry Garmin, I love your products but I'm not spending $200 twice. When my fifth battery finally gave out on my trusty widescreen Garmin, rather than take it apart again and put another battery in it, I got rid of it on Craigslist and now just use my iPhone 5 when I need nav.Now to this particular mount, a couple of things:First, the suction cup material is the best I've seen. It sucks on to the textured dash of my car and stays for weeks at a time in summer heat. Not bad. I'd never seen a suction cup that could adhere to a textured dash. Big points for this mount.Next, the magnet head: the rubberized finish provides enough friction to keep my device still under almost all circumstances. The magnet is powerful and the included metal inserts work wonderfully on my inexpensive slim cases--they give you a little thin round one you just drop in between your phone and the case that is so thin you don't even notice it, but it sticks tight right through the case. I used one of the adhesive ones on the outside of an extra Ringke Slim case because it is black and the colors match. Now THAT one holds tight even when you hit a crashing pothole.Finally the swivel mount: the screw-tight ball and socket mechanism of this head is a cut above the loose ball and socket of the Garmin mounts. Get the angle where you like it and lock it down. As a plus, you can loosen the head all the way and pop it off the base--and use any number of standard sized ball and socket mounts, right up to the fancy permanent-installation mounts that use the same size ball. Many people have one of those with a charging plug integrated for iPhone 4 etc. and are not happy about the lightning cable obsoleting their car mounts. If you pop the old mount off the ball and pop this one on, you can run a lightning cable where the old power cord used to run and there you go--no-tool install as long as the cord you had can be accessed easily.A word about powerful magnets and the iPhone's function and reception: I have noticed no effect on either reception or the basic function of the iPhone. Apple confirms their product was designed to be impervious to magnetic interference--they even use magnets to do tricky things on the iPad. I think you have nothing to worry about with regards to the iMagnet in this regard.So if you are looking for the simplest possible no-tool installation of a nice phone mount in your car, this one is as awesome as the reviews here indicate. Most of us have tried multiple mounting systems with varying degrees of fail before we found this. Maybe you have too.If I could make one suggestion to iMagnet, it would be to market a line of slim cases with the steel mounting surface molded in, to provide positive magnetic lock without sticking a magnet plate onto a case. I use the little insert most of the time, but I have to say, having the plate on the outside really gives a positive mount that a lot of iMagnet users favor. Make cases that look just like everybody else's slim cases out there, for the most popular devices. Market cases and mounts as a bundle, and make a bundle.I'd be a buyer.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-12: With my old phone I paid around $30 to get a car dock, but once I upgraded it didn't work. Also iPhone docks will not let you spin the phone on it's side. (I prefer the sideways phone for GPS) This works with any phone (and maybe tablets) and allows you to position it any direction you want. Good strong magnets. No problems holding my phone on bumpy roads. Phones having wireless charging systems may not even require a metal plate, but the plates are small and not even noticed inside protective case. This even works with a thick Otterbox case.Pros:Works with any phone in any positionStrong holdCons:Suction base with tape is not my favorite, but can be switched with other GPS/car dock bases having a swivel ball.

Unfortunately, the plug for my phone is on the bottom, which causes the phone to push up on the mount. This caused the phone to become a little wobbly when I go over bumps. I just tilt my mount back a bit before I plug my phone in (shich I only do when I'm using it as a GPS).     Rating: 5

    2013-08-22: The good:1) The magnet holds well and is very convenient, even on my Note 2 with an extended battery and case.2) The suction cup holds well on a perfectly flat and clean surface.The bad:1) The arm is very short which makes placement difficult to find in my car to keep it visible and in reach. I might have to find a flat surface round metal surface to stick onto my car with double sides tape to stick this mount onto to place it in a more visible location. A longer arm would have also solved this problem, or an extension that could be added.2) Because it requires a perfectly flat, porous free surface to stick to my car offers very few places to put this mount as most the surfaces are porous.3) It prefers to keep the phone in a portrait view, my preference is landscape (of course part of this problem may be due to the extended battery.4) Because it's a magnet the phone move in position and may not stay in the same position you put it as you make turns or hit bumps, though it doesn't fall off.Overall, I had better hopes for this I'm sure for the right phones with the right car with better mounting locations this would be a better mount for those people. So check your car to make sure you have a flat, non-porous, area to mount the cradle where you want to actually mount it in your car.

    Rating: 3

    2014-02-17: This magnetic connection is just right for my setup. I have a Subaru Forester and an iPhone 4S. Most importantly, I have a case for the iPhone that I like a lot and which has just enough play in the case to let me slip in one of the slim magnetic panels supplied with the iMagnet cradle-less phone mount. A bit of duct tape holds the magnetic panel inside the back of my iPhone case. So ... presto! ... when I hold the iPhone 4s to the mount, it snaps to connect with a small THUNK. I can rotate the phone, or even adjust the mount. The mount is fastened securely to the top of the center storage compartment door on my Forester's dashboard.Most of the time, I use GPS maps in my phone: mostly the terrific "Waze" app now owned by Google, or Google Maps, or occasionally Apple Maps. But there are times when I still like to use my Garmin GPS unit ... but it weighs too much to attach to the iMagnet mount, so I have to install the Garmin's own suction-cup mount to my windshield on these occasions. (I often use the Garmin if I'm in rural areas with poor cellular connections, which makes the iPhone's GPS apps non-functional; the phone uses GPS top identify its location but needs cellular connections to bring in the mapping imagery.)If I purchase another iMagnet mount, I'd buy one large enough to handle my large GS unit. If you're thinking of using a full-size GPS unit, or maybe a small tablet such as an iPad Mini or even a full-sized iPad, you might want to find a larger mount.

    2013-03-03: I love this thing. So simple and convenient.     Rating: 5

    2013-07-19: I don't use the suction base that came with this, because the arm is very short, which doesn't work well with my setup (I suction my mount right next to my rear-view mirror, requiring an arm long enough to reach down below the mirror), so my review will focus on the magnetic portion of the product. I was able to unscrew the plastic nut and remove the magnet from this mount and put it on another with a longer arm.The magnet works great. It's seemingly rather powerful, pulling in the metal plates with a good bit of force, but not so much that you have trouble dislodging from the magnet. The magnet also has a bit of a smooth, silky, rubberized coating, so there's not a loud snap or a worry of scratching.To get your phone to stick to the magnet, you have two options. The first, which I use, is a round metal disk that you place between your phone and your case (thus, this method requires a case). The disk is about the thickness of maybe 5 sheets of paper. The second option is a pair of rectangular metal pieces with rounded corners that have adhesive pads on the back. You can place these between a phone and case or adhere them to the back of a phone or case. All of the metal is nicely machined and has no rough or sharp edges.In my case, I use this mount with a Galaxy S4 in an Urban Armor Gear case. I have the round disk between my phone and case, which does interfere somewhat with NFC, but there's enough of the battery exposed that I definitely still can use NFC. I just have to be aware of where NFC works on my phone.The case I have is relatively slick, being hard plastic, and it does allow my phone to rotate very easily on the magnet. This can be mildly annoying, but is also kind of nice at times.The bottom line, though, is that the convenience of just stepping into my car, popping the phone on and then popping it off as I get out is magnificent. Pairing this mount with Bluetooth in your car gives the absolute best experience.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-18: Simply amazing. This sticks firmly on my truck dashboard and the phone stays on it even driving on washboard dirt roads. I didn't expect it to be this good. Getting one for all the vehicles

    2014-02-13: After 3 months, this will not remain stuck to my dash. Last Sunday, it simply fell over, dropping my iPhone to the floor. I cleaned the suction cup with soap and water and let it air dry like the instructions state. I also cleaned my dash and used rubbing alcohol to remove any residue and let it dry. After all was dry, I attached it to my dash and left it overnight. By the next morning, it had fallen over without anything attached to it. So I went through the process again two more times with the result being the same - after a few minutes, it falls over even with nothing attached to the magnet. It hasn't even warmed up here so I know it isn't from the heat and my truck is kept in the employee parking garage during the day. I give them credit for a great idea with the magnet, but it's no good if it doesn't remain stuck to your dash.

    2014-06-08: I put a small round metal disc about the size of a quarter between my iphone and it's rubber case that I use. The magnet is in the mount head. The suction cup has a sticky surface that seems to stick to most surfaces in a car. I mounted it on windshield, radio screen, and even a textured dash. The head doesn't pivot as much as I would like causing less than optimal positioning when the suction cup is mounted on a completely flat vertical surface. But otherwise great. I would recommend this to a friend.

    2013-01-20: This is the kind of genius product that you didn't know you were even looking for until you found it.     2013-10-31: I use this magnetic holder in conjunction with another bean bag base. The magnet power is quite strong and I have not had any issues with it falling. However, because the phone is quite large, the phone tends to rotate while it is attached to the stand.     Rating: 4

    2013-08-03: I use the Samsung 3 and use it on the dash for commuting information. I had used the kind of device that you slide into a bracket, but they were cheap looking, clumsy and were hard to get and out with one hand.So, this device looked good. The problem is you have to attach a metal plate to the cover or slip one in the back of the phone to get it to work.With my Samsung S3 there is no room between the battery and the cover for the plate.And, the phone cover I used is slim and squeezing the plate into the back of the cover made it impossible to get the phone in the cover.So, stumped.Then, I took the round metal plate that comes without sticky. It is small and I simply super glued it to my phone cover. It is black, matches the cover, and still allows me to use the little flip out stand to sit the phone upright.The phone sticks to this device like glue. It never slips. It is one hand on and off.And, it doesn't look like crap.So, five stars.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-09: This is an amazing product for my truck. sticks on very well and i go over quite a few bumps on my drives. great for GPS and watching movies in your car without having to hold it. totally worth every penny.

    Rating: 5

    2014-05-07: I was unsure about this initially.I have a Galaxy S3, a fairly hefty phone. I did watch the video review by a dude with a similar phone (might have been an S4, not sure). But he used it without a case, placing the steel plate between the battery and the phone back. I use a case and holster. So I wasn't sure if the magnet would have enough gumption to hold the phone with the plate between the phone and the case (my case has a built in kickstand on the back, which I never use). I figured if it didn't hold I'd just attach the adhesive side to the back of the case. Not an optimal solution, but it would have been worth a try.As it turns out, the magnet held just fine with the plate between the phone and case. I tried it in my work van yesterday afternoon and the morning. No movement at all with the phone on the magnet at highway speeds and on bumpy secondary roads. I was impressed.I removed one star due to the lack of movement of the ball mount. in my ford van the dash slopes away fairly sharply, and I couldn't quite get the phone at the angle I wanted when mounted to the dash as far forward as possible. Mounting on the windshield would put the phone too far away. I think of the ball mount collar was slightly lower profile it would have been fine.I'll probably end up getting another one so I have one in my car and one in my work van.Update: I used this in my car yesterday evening, a Toyota Matrix. The dash doesn't have a lot of flat spaces, but my current cradle sticks fine to the dashboard (it's a similar style silicon suction cup, the sticky kind). I had trouble getting the iMagnet suction cup to stick to the dash. Fell off in the middle of driving. The problem is, I have to have the suction cup fairly close to the front edge of the dashboard so I can plug in the phone charger when the phone is in portrait mode. I'm still fiddling with it to get it to work. I'll probably have to attach a plastic plate to the dash with adhesive-backed Velcro so the suction cup will have a flat surface to attach to.My suggestions to the manufacturer:1) Give the ball mount more freedom of movement, as mentioned above.2) Make the neck stem longer, and adjustable, so the suction cup can be place away from the edge of the dashboard, but the phone can still be mounted forward of the edge of the dash (Hopefully that makes sense). For the price, one would expect more adjustability.

    Rating: 4

    2014-01-11: Maybe it is just my car but it did not fit any where lose so it was far way for me to reach and view it. I am 5'1'' but still it could have been my car style too. I liked the magnet idea though, just needed a better way to bring closer to me in a bigger car.

    2013-05-25: This is actually the second one of these I ordered. After receiving the first one and finding it perfect, I went back to order another one for my wife's phone, but there weren't any available and the listing said that they didn't know when it would be back in stock, if ever. Disappointed, I ordered a different one, which was poor by comparison. Then, suddenly, this one was available again, so I ordered another one (this one). Both are perfect. The suction cup is great. The first one has been in my car for almost 3 weeks and is still holding strong. The thin metal disk fits beautifully between my phone and the minimalist snap-on case I use. It holds the phone to the mount quite firmly. It is definitely a one-handed operation. This unquestionably the perfect iPhone holder.

    2014-07-11: Great great greatVery practical and safe

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-06: I bought this because it seemed like I was always tossing my cell in the car and it typically falls or is a pain to get to when needed. The timing was also perfect because we were about to start almost a 2k mile road trip visiting family for the holidays.So testing it out before leaving, on my otterbox defender encased Galaxy S3 - I tried using the circular metal piece and it worked, however using the longer rectangular one provided a more stable connection to the mount. I was able to successfully use the phone both horizontally and vertically on the mount with no issues of falling off.My wife has an iphone 5s with an otterbox commuter case. At first I tried the circular metal plate, and it worked however the phone wasn't centered on the mount - even though I put the metal plate in the center of the case. So when I rotated the phone horizontally, it would fall off the mount. Looking into the issue, it seems the otterbox case wasnt quite tight enough to hold the circular metal plate in place centered on the phone. A quick, little piece of scotch tape on the metal peice on the back of the silicone inner layer of the case, and now the phone sits perfect on the mount.After traveling close to 2k miles, neither phone fell off ever. Not only interstate travel, but also dirt / mountainous roads proved to be no issues at all. The mount stayed on securely as well, I have not had to adjust / touch it since originally mounting it to the dash. I used the phones' GPS / mapping almost exclusively the entire trip and even when touching the screen was no issue, neither phone fell, moved or shifted.

    2013-05-04: This is my best car accessory purchase EVER! This unit hold my phone with the included plate installed on the inside of my 1mm thick case. Not only does it hold the phone extremely tightly but even hold while I was off-roading last month. its simple to push your phone onto when you enter the car and just grab it off when leaving. No complicated levers or adjustments to make, simply hold it up to the magnet and let the imagnet do the rest. Causes no degradation of signal GPS or Cellular. It does not mess with the memory of the phone either and doesn't effect my credit cards when they are in my pocket with the phone.
