    2013-11-29: This is soo easy. I actually put a glass upside down in my cup holder and attached it to it to give me the height to make it perfect. Good suction cup and I have recommended this product to friends.

    Rating: 5

    2013-06-12: First, the magnet is brilliant. They provide a few steel plates to attach to your phone or its case. The large rectangular plate's strong adhesive bonded it securely to the exterior of my iPhone 5's hard-rubber Splash case. (Don't try putting the plate inside your case: the magnetic attraction will not be sufficient to hold the phone securely.)The mount's circular magnet is surprisingly powerful. When attached, my iPhone isn't going anywhere under braking, turning, or acceleration. And tapping, swiping or other touch-screen shenanigans don't fluster the phone's magnetic anchoring either.I continue to be skeptical about the "3M Silicon" dashboard suction cup/adhesive attachment solution. They claim that if removed the surface will regain its stickiness with only a quick wash, but when I peeled back the cover, I perceived a layer of adhesive over top of that silicon, and when that's gone it's never coming back. Maybe that's why they make a big deal out of installing it correctly the first time.The weasel wording the manufacturer uses to cover their butts in the instructions did not enhance my confidence. They caution against installing the mount on uneven surfaces (like my dashboard's pebbled dash, perhaps?). And, the surface you install it on should never be exposed to hot sun! Like, uh, my dashboard? Where else am I going to install the thing? (Windshield mounting is illegal in California.)In my cool underground parking area I gave a section of my dashboard a good scrub and a thorough dry, then installed the mount exactly as instructed. Perfection. Under optimal conditions, using the original adhesive, the mount is solidly planted on my dash. Now instead of fumbling with my phone to see Google Maps, the securely mounted (vertically or horizontally) iPhone now displays my route in a far safer manner. Looks cool, too!SEVERAL MONTHS LATER: The adhesive failed only once, while I was driving in California's Central Valley on a hot (100+) summer day. The weight of the phone was pulling the gradually-unsticking mount from its moorings. So I removed the phone and re-planted the mount. By the next morning it was as solid as when I first installed it.And since then it's been a fixture in my elderly Jaguar sedan. But sadly, after ordering a second iMagnet for my partner's BMW, I was to discover its sensitivity to surfaces. For some reason, the new iMagnet never "took" to the BMW's dashboard surface, and so it could not be relied upon to hold its assigned iPhone4.Make of it what you will. Perhaps one of those disc-shaped mounting plates will secure the iMagnet to the BMW. The thing is so convenient and functional, going to the trouble will probably be worth the effort.Time will tell. Stay tuned.

    Rating: 4

    2014-06-11: wish this just came with the magnet and doublesided tape, then I could really put it anywhere in the care. Very limited on places to suction it. I had a feeling after reading the reviews when I bought it though. Magnet works great!

    Rating: 3

    2013-06-07: I love this product. Form, function, fabulous. The "Sticky" suction cup works great up to about 20+ sticks, then the coating begins to wear off, leave residue, etc. I got around this by using it as a semi-permanent fixture, suctioned to the back of my Nexus 7, using the magnets to stick the device to whatever I need. I stuck one of the 3M adhesive metal plates on my desk just in front of the keyboard and it works great. It also sticks very nicely to the top of the convection oven in the kitchen for use while cooking and as a bonus, the magnet allows me to stick it to the arm rest on my metal-frame patio furniture on the pool deck for easy use while sitting outside watching the 42' on the pool deck. Using the suction cup on the device also gives me a nice handle while holding the device, resting comfortably, securely in my finger-webbing (for lack of a better term) where my pointer and middle fingers meet. I can even join the magnet end(s) to stick to the wife's iMagnet which is used as designed in her car, magnet up/out. The unit also props itself up as a conventional tablet stand would when resting on the coffee table, night stand, etc. Worth mention, when using as a prop the most ideal side of the Nexus 7 (landscape) only allows for a slightly less than 90 degree angle when mounted at plumb-center. In this case I usually will stick the magnet to the back of my Galaxy S4 and use that as the stand base (with screen protector and clean surface). This also has the added effect of allowing me to pick up the magnetically connected devices and view / use the phone by simply flipping the contraption over. Amazing.Cons: The item would be near perfect, in my view, if:1- The magnet section was slightly smaller. This would affect the stability of the system when in use with a larger product such as the Nexus 7 I use it with, but if possible, perhaps with a stronger magnet, this would allow the tablet to decrease the near-90-degree angle when using it to prop up the tablet as I use it. Flipping the Nexus 7 over does work and place it at a more comfortable angle, closer to 45 degrees, but then often depresses the power button if fiddled with.2- The ball joint allowed for slightly more flexibility with a section notched out of one side @ 90 degrees. This would allow the magnet to be mounted flush (think, top of metal chair arm) while allowing the suction arm attachment to pivot 90 into the notched section for portrait view while hanging off of the side of the chair arm (or similar application).I love this product overall and my "Cons" amount to hair-splitting. When combined with my LG Bluetooth headset the combo is unstoppable! Buy this product. You too will love it!

    2014-06-27: I don't use it. Wasted purchase for me. It kept falling off my dashboard and it just doesn't work for me.

    Rating: 2

    2013-11-19: The magnet is plenty strong and so is the suction cup. Unfortunately I have had 2 issues - one on the device itself and one with it's compatibility with my phone case - so I have not yet been able to actually use the mount in my car. I have, however, played with it and *attempted* to mount it in my car. (see update)The head is actually very easy to move. Some of the reviews said that it was difficult - I wonder if they noticed the collar that you twist to loosen the head and allow it to move? That collar allows articulation while making sure the whole thing is very secure (I know, personally, that a mount that's always falling over is particularly annoying.)Unlike what another review mentioned, the suction cup was NOT able to stick to the textured dash of my vehicle - it stuck for about an hour and then fell off (and it was neither a particularly hot nor cold day). The texture is that lightly wrinkled faux leather-looking plastic. Attaching to the glass is not an option - not only is the slope of my windshield dramatic enough to require me to stick this thing dead center, but it is actually illegal in my state to mount anything to the windshield and block line-of-sight of the driver. So while this *does* stick to glass very well, I can't use it there! :( I have bought a console disk to put on my dash, theArkon AP036 70 mm Console Attachment Diskwhich fits the iMagnet perfectly and has had no adhesion issues thus far (it's been a few months, but granted it's the middle of what's turned out to be a very cold winter).The other issue was the metal plates. They are not totally compatible with the 2-part Otterbox Commuter case. Why? Otterbox designed the outer hard shell with a circle of raised plastic dead center, so I can't fit either the square or circle plates toward the top without either being off-center or covering the camera. I could put them on the bottom, and simply turn on screen rotation when I mount the phone... but that's a tad obnoxious. I could also put the plate between the soft part of the case and the phone itself, but that makes the connection between magnet and plate weaker. This *is* more of an issue with the case than the mount, but I think it's worth mentioning so that others are aware of the possible issue with their cases.Update: I did end up placing the plate under both layers of the Commuter case - didn't want to do that originally since I was afraid of scratches and it weakens the magnetic connection a bit - and orienting the plate vertically. The phone still attaches just fine but the slightly weaker connection means that it does start rotating from the road vibration if it's not centered absolutely perfectly - whereas in a thinner case the connection was plenty strong to prevent that. If it's allowed to bounce too far, my phone has fallen off a couple of times. Again, this is more a case issue than the mount itself.

    Rating: 5

The thin metal disc slides into my iPhone case with no problems, and it always stays well on the mount. I use it daily, and it has worked better than I had expected.

    2013-11-17: I can't believe how well this holds my Samsung Galaxy S4. I used the supplied plates behind my case (I used a tiny piece of tape to keep it in place on my phone). If you have never driven in a MINI let me tell you it's nothing compared to any other cars suspension.     Rating: 5

    2012-12-19: I've been through 3 dashboard smartphone mounts and so far I like this concept the best. The less moving parts, the less chance of something failing or breaking. I haven't had it more than a day so I can't speak to it's longevity but the iMagnet company includes a website where you can register the product for a 1 year warranty. That's, IMO, a hidden plus; A company willing to stand by their product.What I didn't see in previous reviews (although I admittedly didn't go through all of them) is a better description on the selection of metallic plates that they provide. There are 2 rectangular ones with 3M adhesive and a smaller, thinner circular disk which has no adhesive which is PERFECT for ultra slim/minimalist cases that have little tolerance for fitting anything between the case and the phone. I've got an iPhone 4 with the eLago SF slim case and I'm still able to get a snap-tight fit AND it still doesn't compromise the magnetic strength of the system itself. It's possible it might vary based on the material the case is made out of but with how strong the magnet is as long as the material is thin enough it shouldn't be an issue.What would have made this product a full 5 stars was if they provided a smooth disk similar to what's provided with the Arkon product ( http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B003ELOOZO/ref=oh_details_o09_s00_i01 ). $25 is a bit steep but worth it for a good product that will last, especially when it comes to smartphone accessories.

    2014-02-10: really love how i dont need to mess around with a bulky cell car mount when needing to take the phone out of the holding unit on most all other car mounts... this one really is amazingly well designed. the sticky bottom suction cup is great, i wasnt expecting it to be so strong and resuable. the circle magnet that comes with the pack (along with 2 big square magnets for a case) is really sweet. what i did was put it inside my Galaxy 3 back cover, i just placed it on the battery and closed it up... no extra case required. i know they dont tell you to do so but if you have an S3 I suggest you try it out. hands down the best car mount on the market to date, plus you cant beat amazons prices

    2013-05-01: Love, love, love this mount! It's fiddle-free; you just bring the phone close enough and you feel the pull of the magnet. I use a Moshi iGlaze case for my iPhone 5; the metal disc (that comes with the mount) you insert between the phone and the case makes the case fit slightly less than perfect--but it's worth the incredible ease of using the mount. So note that while there's a trade-off, considering all the different pain-in-the-neck configurations of mounts and cases, this one works perfectly for me.Also note that I use this in my convertible and attach the mount to my windshield; I have not had any issues with the mount coming unattached from the windshield or the phone being demagnetised as a I drive at freeway speeds. And with the car-mount attached to the windshield almost always with the top-down, I have not had any issues with it being removed by a would-be thief (yet). I would HIGHLY recommend this mount for anyone looking for something to holster their phone on the dash.

    2013-05-09: I have been using this product for several months, over 12.. I still like it a lot. I still use a thin case and I have glued the metal plate to the inside of my case. It is so easy to use, it holds my phone extremely well. I really like this holder. The sticky paste stays with the rubber suction cup and time and time again when I change from rental car to rental the holder has not failed. It is so nice to place and remove the phone with only one hand. Why only four stars? I do not like the suction cup as much. I travel a lot, so I need to always move the mount from rental car to rental car. Mounts I have used in the past use a silicone clear rubber suction pad that works well. This company uses a black silicone with a sticky surface. I place it on the windshield and it holds very well. When I go to remove the mount it is a bit of a challenge. It is very sticky. I was able to remove it, I hope the sticky paste does not come off too soon. I did notice some did come off while I was attempting to remove the mount. I did keep the wax tape so I can place it back on the suction cup in between rentals. It did not leave any marks on the window. This may not be a big deal, only time will tell.

    2013-07-15: Works with my Note 2 and standard Samsung case.What a freakin' great concept!! MAGNETS!Worked right out of the box. I bought this to replace one that was a "clip" style, and had a couple moving parts.Pros:- no moving parts.- has 2 other metal pieces, with adhesive, to help if the "coin" one doesn't work.- VERY strong magnet. I was surprised at how strong it is.Cons:- there's a sticky rubber material on the bottom of the suction cup. While this increases the grip, it makes it really hard to remove the set-up. Basically, you should have a spot already picked. Once it's on you won't be able to move it easily.- If I didn't have a case on the phone I couldn't use the product. No way in high hell I'm sticking some metal to my phone.I'm happy with this purchase, and will update if anything changes.

    2014-03-25: iMagnet definitely does it's job well.     Rating: 4

    2013-07-18: This is a pleasure to use! My previous phone car mount was designed to physically snap onto my old iphone and hold it in place by friction. I was always concerned that the friction points would scuff, which they eventually did. It was also awkward to snap the phone in and out of the cradle, having to use one hand to hold the phone and one to release the catch. The soft rubber covered magnetic mount design of this one is terrific! It's so elegant to simply put your phone near the mount and it magically snaps in place. The magnet is fairly strong, no worries running over bumps. My town has some atrocious railroad tracks crossings and this mount passed with flying colors. The magnet doesn't hold so tight where you feel like you'll destroy your dash trying to disengage the phone however. One decent tug and the phone pops right off. Ingenious. Works perfectly for me. The mount requires a metal disc or panel (included) to be either inserted or stuck with adhesive between the phone and a case (not included). I preferred not to use a phone case so I unscrewed the back cover of my iPhone 4S and placed the metal disc between the battery and the back cover. Works great and does not seem to degrade the signal strength of the phone or GPS signal.The real amazing feature for me is the mount that attaches to your dash. It is super-duper solid! There are two methods of attachment, by adhesive and mechanical suction cup. The mounting disc is super-sticky. It's not an adhesive glue coating, but appears to be made of an adhesive rubbery material that holds firmly to a surface, but won't separate and pull apart like a glued surface would. It reminds me of those sticky rubber elastic hands I used to get out of the gumball machines as a kid only much, much stickier. The second aspect of the mounting device is a mechanical suction cup that locks the mount into place. Once you have stuck the mount into place you push down a lever which engages the suction cup. You hear a satisfying "snap" and the mount is firmly locked down. When mounted to a fairly smooth surface this thing simply does not move. My old mount actually was fastened under the dash with screws and this one feels as solid without having to find a hidden spot under the dash or worrying about damaging the dash if it is used in an open location.Although the attachment to the dash feels super solid, it does enable you to easily disengage the mount and move it to another location. Simply pull up the lever to disengage the suction and peel up the adhesive base to remove it from the dash. It's cool to think this could outlast my current car, that I can take it wherever I go and also use it with multiple devices.Awesome, awesome, awesome.

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-07: I was looking for something that wouldn't fall off my dash ever few days and would actually hold my phone and this works perfect. Since I didn't want to mount the metal magnet piece directly to my iPhone, I attached it to my carrying case instead and it hold nice and secure without me worrying that if I hit a good bump it would fall off, it doesn't. Love it and would recommend this one to anybody.

    Rating: 5

    2012-11-27: I use a LifeProof case on my iPhone. I use my iPhone as my GPS. I bought a LifeProof adapter so I could use my GoPro mounts to mount my iPhone to the dashboard. The problem with the LifeProof adapter is you can not have the power adapter while in the LifeProof clip. Problem was solved by this iMagnet. I have had the iMagnet attached to my dashboard for 2 weeks with no problems. Placing the metal plate on the pack of my LifeProof case holds firmly. Now I can have a secure GPS on my dash and have it charging at the same time. It is also great using it with more phones. I just slipped a metal disk between the case and back of phone for my wife and it holds equally as well.

    Rating: 5

    2012-12-13: I purchased this for using my iPhone's GPS in rental cars. I know that sounds crazy specific, but when navigating around NYC and NJ without local knowlegde, you don't want your GPS/phone floating around on the passenger seat or dash board. When not in the car, I use it mounted to my home office desk.I was most skeptical about the quality of the magnet and thus, the hold. This unit is rock solid, and the on/off tension of the magnet is perfect - not too strong, not too weak. The silicone suction is much better than any other mount I've used from Garmin and others. It also works well on more than just glass or glass-like smooth surfaces. You just place one of the paper thin metal pieces between your phone and case (I don't use the 3M peel/stick provided), and it works like a charm. A real bargain at $20-25.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-05: Regardless of what they say, the suction did not stick on the leather dash board. It comes with a double stick smooth plate to mount on the dash. But that will eventually ruin the leather. I returned it.

    Rating: 2

    2014-03-20: Bought this in January and it worked great for three months, but as soon as it warmed up in March of this year it fell off the dash, I reattached it but it fell of within hours, maybe it might stay on the windshield longer but I never tried it.I got some epoxy glue and stuck the base permanently to my dash, as I drive a semi as I was not worried about trying to remove it as I will just leave it there when I sell the truck.Its a great idea if only they can get it to adhere to the dash.

    2014-01-19: When I mounted this in a minivan I thought I found the perfect spot - except that that the head doesn't articulate enough to have the screen face the driver. Other than that disappointment it does work well. Be sure to clean surfaces well to remove any residue from cleaners or protectant sprays.

    Rating: 4

    2014-03-03: The suction cup on this is a combination of very stick material (think of those sticky hand toys in gumball machines from the 90s) and a suction cup. The combination of these 2 methods allow this mount to hold very securely to a number of surfaces. I mounted this to the faux wood trim in my 2014 VW Passat, just to the right of nav screen. It's doing very well there, out of the way of the radio operation but still extremely available for screen interactions with the phone.This mount provides a ball mounted head that allows a reasonable range of movement for either the top of the dashboard or the windshield. The short arm doesn't move so it may not be ideal for all locations you might prefer. I stuck the mount sideways on the dash trim so it provided proper viewing of my Samsung Note 3 from the driver's seat and that is working out well for me. It's mounted on a vertical surface, as opposed to a horizontal surface or the windshield.There are many similar designs of this magnetic mount phone holder from different companies, although all of them seem extremely similar. We got a CD slot mount for my wife, which she really likes for her Samsung S3. In my Passat that same CD mount works, but blocks the dashboard clock, so this worked better since I could find a better location for the phone.So far I'm very happy with the mount.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-22: i was looking for a cradle mount for my dash and i was turned off by the idea of having to use two hands to dock my phone or docks not working with cases. i finally found this. you will not regret buying this thing. the person who invented this is a genius. in the package you get the mount itself, as shown in the items main picture. with it comes three magnets that you attach to your phone or case. one is a circular one without adhesive on either side. the other two are larger and rectangular with adhesive on one side so you can stick it to your phone/case. i use the circular one and keep it in between my phone and my case so that no one can tell its there and when i get in the car i just slap it on the mount and drive. the magnet is stronger than most would assume but if you have a thick case and put the magnet inside it, i think you will be disappointed.overall i just have two minor complaints:1. i think they should sell magnets of different shapes and colors that way they aren't as ugly on your case.2. the mount does not adjust height wise.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-02: Stability ratio wonderful for the first timeRaw material is good and beautiful probably priced a little high because the idea is simple, but the goods excellent and I intend to buy another one for my friend .. Thanks to the seller Amazon Thanks :)

    Rating: 5

    2013-09-11: I like this thing; only complaint is that with larger phones, particularly the Samsung models, if you turn them sideways sometimes they slip down a little bit on the mount if you don't center the magnets exactly.

    Rating: 4

    2013-09-27: I was very skeptical about ordering this device. I mean, a magnet next to your phone? Didn't it used to be that any magnet within like 10 feet of a computer would wreck and erase its hard drive?! So needless to say, I was a bit nervous.Secondly, I was nervous that the magnet itself wouldn't be strong enough, and my HTC One would constantly be falling off.Well, I'm very happy to say that this has outperformed my expectations, and I am so pleasantly surprised with how easy it is to use. I only used the round no adhesive magnet (stuck between the case and the phone), and it keeps my rather large HTC One on with no problem whatsoever. I have a sort of old stick shift, and at high speeds or when quick shifting it isn't exactly a smooth ride...but this mount has stayed on both the dash, and kept my phone attached to it, with no problems at all.It's only been a week with it, but I have to tell you, every time I simply reach up and let my phone get sucked to the mount or I quickly grab it off to use it in my hand...I feel an intense level of satisfaction. The magnet mounting is just simply brilliant. I can't believe it. Why would anyone ever want anything else? Who wants to clip things in?I will update in a month or so to see where things are.I also got the Tech Armor Anti-Glare screens, and the mediabridge 3.5mm aux cable to augment my car driving experience, and so far I am very pleased with both of those. Updates as things develop!**Update**It's only been a few days or maybe a week, but I just wanted to update the situation because I did run into a problem. Not with the dock exactly, but with a car charger I purchased. I didn't realize the car charger I ordered had a curly slinky cable, and so when I used it with this dock, the cord pulled too much and my phone would spin until it was lopsided. I tried stretching the cable, I tried attempting to hook the cable onto something higher up so that it wouldn't pull as much, and while I got some improvements...the phone still moved. As far as I'm concerned, the dock is still incredible. I returned the charger and I'm waiting on a charger that has a straight cable which I know won't be a problem. My aux cable has no affect on the phone at all (cause it is held quite solidly).**Update 6/6/14**Well, at this point it has been about 3/4 of a year, and man this thing is still going strong. It lasted me a cross country trip, where it FINALLY became unstuck only twice, but my girlfriend grabbed it and stuck it right back in place and it was solid. The second time it fell off was over two months ago now. We now live in Las Vegas, where the temperatures regularly get up to 100 and over, and this little guy hasn't fallen off at all here. I got a different phone (Switched back to iPhone), and I put the magnet in my new case, and use that phone with it no problem! I love this thing, and when it fails, I'll buy it again!

    2014-06-04: At first I was skeptical about the product, but after buying it, I realized that the added stickiness on the suction cup makes the mount hold really strong on to any surface. I would recommend this product to anyone because it is really great when going from one car to another that has the exact same mount. Unlike the CD mount that blocks off part of the media control, this can go on the window without blocking my vision or controls. I would recommend getting one for every car. The metal plates that it comes with holds really strong too. I would recommend using the circle metal plate on phones that have removable batteries because it is thinner. When using it with a double or triple layered case, put it on the out most layer. The mount did not work with my Trident case because of the back design, which creates a large gap between the magnet and metal plate.     Rating: 5

    2014-06-17: Suction to glass and some other smooth counter tops or dashboards is strong, you won't have a problem there. If you use this with a phone that is not encased with an extra shell or a cover, it works pretty well. Unfortunately, if you have a bumper or case or shell (I use a Spigen case), that little extra thickness may increase the distance between a plate inside and the magnet and weaken the strength enough to let the phone slip, especially if you have a heavy phone like a Note 3. You may need to mount the plate on the outside of your extra case (making for an ugly protrusion) for a direct contact between the plate and the magnet. The neck is also very short so if you have a large phone, like a Note 3 you may need to position it closer to the bottom or top to avoid hitting the surface or angle it away. The plate also adds a bit of weight to your phone.If you are using a phone as is, without an extra case, and it is not a large phone, it should work well. It works sufficiently for a Note3 but I would not recommend it for a Note3.

    Rating: 3

It doesn't interfere with my phones(Galaxy S3) radio, GPS, bluetooth, or wifi.The suction cup is strong and applies easily to my somewhat rounded dash.There are different metal strips included depending on the size of your phone.It's sleek.

    2014-01-20: I can't imagine the anger that the people who paid $60 for this case must feel. It is a beautiful design and idea, but that is where the admiration for this product ends. On top of that additional investment you will need to purchase a high quality GLASS screen protector in order to absorb the constant abuse that the transistion area on the inside flap of this case (the leather material running into the plastic window) will cause to the devices screen. This wear and tear WILL result in permanent degradation of the oleophobic coating and create PERMENANT lines on the Note 3s screen. For this product to be a Samsung genuine product THIS IS TOTALLY UNACCEPTABLE!!!! Insult to injury with this product is that you will have to BEG Samsung to make repairs to the device once the damage caused by their OEM product causes to your device. Completely UNACCEPTABLE!!!!I planned on using a glass screen protector with my device anyway, and wanted the Spigen magnetic closure to add a bit of flash to this case anyway, so that being said, I am happy with my setup, but buyer beware of this additional purchases that will be needed in order to maintain the prestine condition of your device.If only Samsung put as much thought and effort into the design of this product as they did with the Note 3 this may well have been a home run, unfortunately this is a FOUL BALL!     2014-05-03: I've debated over getting this case ever since I put the order in for a Galaxy Note 3. I'm glad I finally decided to bite the bullet and order this case. Real functionality and Style. Couple that with the discount you can get this case for on Amazon and it's a done deal. What are you waiting for? You won't regret it. I've gone through several different cases, looking for "the one". Heh. Almost every case I've tried adds too much bulk to the phone, even the "slim/super slim" ones. This case, however, cheats... somewhat. LOL. It's technically not a "case", but a replacement battery cover that has the front cover attached to it. When you open the cover, the phone wakes up. When you close it, it goes to sleep. Simple, right? So simple, but oh so convenient. Never again will you fumble to unlock your screen to receive a call. Actually, you don't even need to open the cover. Just swipe the call button on the outer window. Viola! Call answered. No need to open the cover to continue your phone call either, due to the PERFECTLY aligned earpiece cutout. The stitching around the edges of this item are real. It's actually stitched leather.. wow. (Maybe it's just really, really good imitation leather...But, nonetheless... real stitching!) One thing I suggest is to get an unused screen protector, cut it out to the dimensions of the outer window, and apply. Saves you the worry of thinking about scratching the outer window. If this one breaks/falls apart, I'd definitely get another one.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-02: I have tried many different cases for my Note 3 and this is the best!     Rating: 5

    2014-04-12: Pros- Very attractive form- Leather material is pretty smooth and feels great- The window is incredibly convenient and easy to use- Provides protection from scratches and small falls- Very thin profile because it replaces the back plate of the phoneCons- White color doesn't last long and it's hard to keep clean- The leather like material will scratch pretty easily- The window picks up fingerprints easily- It's hard (almost impossible) to use the phone with one hand with the cover open because folding over the cover will leave wrinkles on the spine and will most likely reduce the lifespan of the case- No way to secure the coverOverall, this case looks and feels great while providing some minimal protection. The case does have a lot of minor downsides that make the case less convenient/functional. If you're looking for a good looking case, I would highly recommend this case. If you're looking for something more functional, you may want to look elsewhere.Note: Some reviews say that the cover doesn't stay closed after opening it, but if you lave the phone flat, the case will close all the way within a few seconds.

    2011-09-23: I knew I wanted a cover, but was kinda bummed that I knew it would cover the signature design cue of the HTC Sensation: the back cover. It really is what makes the phone distinctive and attractive, in my mind. So, I tried one of those clear back covers, but the colored silicone edge of it separated from the clear back. Just didn't work. So, now what? Well, this case was, in my mind, an excellent compromise. It at least hints at the design cue with the two tone angle back. The photos that user Brian has posted are excellent and invaluable if you have any questions about how it fits and looks. I agree with Brian and other reviewers that the top part just above the earpiece is a bit odd, and it probably should cup over the top a little better to reach closer to the earpiece. But perhaps the thinking was that it would better to leave that area a little more clear of plastic so that when you held it up to your ear, the case wouldn't touch your ear so much? Just a theory. The fit of this case is excellent, as is the quality, especially for the price. The phone still feel sleek and slim and light. It really doesn't add a lot of bulk. The cloth, although a bonus, really isn't anything special, and does, as others have noted, give off fuzz.

    Rating: 5

It has a ridge on the screen side in case you drop or place your phone with the screen facing down.Obviously it doesn't have a screen protector, I made my own out of an iPad protector from Power Support USA (Best available screen protectors) so make sure you get one if you want full protection.Just keep in mind, the screen on the HTC Sensation 4G is slightly curved along the edges which makes it VERY difficult to get the screen protectors to sit perfectly flat on the edges unless they are slightly smaller than the actual viewable screen size.

    Rating: 4

    2014-01-18: Well I was very surprised when I received this very high quality stand for many reasons. What I like best is it will hold portrait and landscape many different size and types of devices. Most all of these were tested in this stand with their TPU thick covers on the device. And I tested this with several phones and also I tested this on several sixes of tablets: a 7 inch tablet, 8 inch tablet and 10 inch.Below I list in the PROS my actual test findings and more info on this stand as to the features of it:PROS:+ Phones and MP3 players (large and small) I tested and how this stand performed - First I tested my large Samsung Galaxy 5 MP3 Player with the TPU Cover on. Even at 1/2 inch thickness, this stand held my player in portrait and landscape SECURELY!Samsung Galaxy S4 with a thick silicone cover on it - fits fine. Samsung Galaxy Grand with TPU cover fits fine in portrait and landscape.+ Tablets - So I tested 3 Samsung Galaxy tablets: 1) Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 7.0 with TPU cover (thickness of 1/2 inch). This fit perfectly both landscape and portrait. Note that this particular tablet is very heavy (compared to Tab 3 line or iPads), and it fit very securely. 2) Samsung Galaxy Tab 3 8.0 with TPU cover (not as heavy or thick as the Tab 2 7.0), this tablet fit beautifully in the stand for portrait or landscape. 3) Samsung Galaxy Tab 2 10.1 (this is a very heavy and thick tablet). I do not have a TPU cover for this, so I placed it into the stand with no cover and it fit perfectly in portrait and in landscape. **If it can fit this bulky and heavy tablet, it can fit most any device with ease!+ Adjustments - There are FOUR total adjustments on this stand once you open it from the folded mode.1) Upright (tall) mode (for leaning the device more upright) - this is the top adjustment on the back of the stand -- be sure that you press this in the top groove to LOCK the stand's back for security.2) More flat mode (Lounge-chair mode for leaning the device at more of an angle backwards- This is when you want more of a backward angle when say you are watching a video, movie, this kind of thing. Be sure to lock in this on the bottom groove in the stand to make sure it is secure and stays in place.3) Device stand standard mode - This is where you stand your phone or tablet. So in the regular mode you can really fit a thicker device in this stand and sometimes I use this. But when I have a thinner device such as a thin phone, I go to locking stand mode (below).4) Locking stand mode - I advise this one for phones! To secure this mode for your phone do this: Pull down the bottom part of the stand (the part where you place your phone) until you hear it make a snapping sound. Then place your phone into the stand. You will see right away if you look on the side view that this seems to hug the table better on the bottom and it grabs onto the phone better making it more secure. *Suggestion: Use this if you have a thinner phone. For me, I use this stand for my Galaxy Player 5 which is thick at 1/2 inch deep and so I use the standard mode on that.** Front standing modes: May I suggest that you try each one of the front device stand modes and see which one you prefer and which one works better on your phone.+ Charging my devices in this stand (and using them at the same time) - For me I can easily charge my phones in portrait mode while in this stand (the Samsung phones and Samsung MP3 player). The 7 and 8 inch tablets I can also charge and use at the same time in this stand if they are in landscape mode. Yes, I was also able to charge my Tab 2 10.1 (in portrait mode) wonderfully and even got it to charge in landscape (turning it upside down). Although this is not a docking station, I use it almost like it is because of the charging ability (it has a large open part at the bottom in which to insert your charging cable into the stand/device).+ Overall quality, design and portability- The quality I found very good. The design I love because of all the adjustments and best of all all the many types and sizes this stand will accommodate!The fact that it folds makes this stand easy to fold and go and use at work, at home, anywhere! Yet for me, I have one on my bedside table and one I keep in my purse for when I am on the go!Highly recommend this stand!

    2013-07-08: So I recently upgraded to the SGS4 and put an Outterbox Commuter case on it. All the stock Samsung docks for my phone, required me to remove my case. (Which I didn't want to do for various reasons.) After doing some research, I came across this stand/holder and thought to try it out. Well, this thing is great. I can place my phone in it secure, in both landscape and portrait view. I can adjust the viewing angle and its really sturdy, although light in weight. I use my phone as an alarm clock. I needed to install a dock alarm clock app on my phone. So whenever I plug in the USB charger, the dock alarm clock would start up. (Just like it would if it was docked.)Pros1) Easy to use and fits most phones with a 5 inch. screen.2) Inexpensive.3) Folds up nice to fit in pocket and carry with you.4) Very sturdy and adjustable viewing angles.5) No need to by an expensive dock that only works for your phone.6) Light weight.7) Can charge phone in both landscape and portrait position.     2013-06-01: Ordered this case along with the tablet.Reason I went for this1) To watch movies, keeping it landscape mode2) To read books, keep it in portrait mode (and not have to hold it).It does what it's supposed to:1) The swivel thing, is made of plastic. Doesn't seem too sturdy (as in if you make an attempt to break it, it will). But it should last you for a while, on day to day usage. It's quite free swiveling, and I thought it would have more resistance. that's just from seeing the pics, so if anyone also thought the same, the above is my response.That doesn't take away from the functionality, which it provides well.2) The sleep-awake feature works too.3) Except for the micro SD port (on the left side of the tablet), all other ports have cut outs. So if you swap micro SD cards often, you'll have to remove your tablet from the case every time.4) One thing to note in portrait mode, the tablet lean angle is about 45 and goes less. So if you're expecting an almost standing portrait case, it won't happen.5) small cut in the case, when I recieved it.However, for $11 shipped, I won't argue that it's a good case.Attached a few pics.

The case feels sturdy and the elastic goes around the case to keep my tablet secure so I really like that. It's a great case for the price. I've had it for almost a year already and there are no rips, tears, or breaking.The 1 and only thing I can say, which really is not that big of a deal, is the tablet sometimes falls flat because the slot that suppose to hold it up to stand straight is not deep enough so at times it slides forward and I have to stand it up again. On a flat surface it won't happen unless you are hitting the screen hard enough but when I'm sitting in bed and just move an inch it slides. If the slot was a bit deeper it would have been perfect but again it's not really much of a big deal just wanted you to know 1 down side of it, if you consider that a down side at all.All-in-all it's a great case and protects my tablet exactly the way it should.

    2013-11-27: I originally chose this cover because of the versatility of the rotation feature, which I also enjoyed on a similar cover that I had for my Samsung Galaxy Note 10.1. This cover does work as advertised, holding the tablet in either portrait or landscape mode, but as other reviewers have noted, the stability as a stand leaves a little bit to be desired for the smaller 8" tablets, particularly when trying to touch the tablet while it is in the stand mode. Also, I utilize this cover with the international version of the Galaxy Note 8, and for that version, the magnetic auto sleep/wake feature does not appear to function properly. Additionally, there is no cutout for either the SD card or the SIM card, so you will need to remove the tablet from the case entirely if you want to access those compartments.

  • B00GJH5M42

    $B00GJH5M42

    2014-01-20: I picked this up because of the pass through capability it allows to users who want wireless charging and S View features, and this receiver didn't fail to meet everyone of my expectations. As a rooted user of my Note 3 I wasn't capable of using NFC to make payment with my mobile device using ISIS, because the application does not work on rooted devices, and was not upset to lose the NFC ability due to using this Qi receiver. However once I discovered the RootCloak modification, which allows rooted users to disguise the rooted status of the device to any target application installed on the phone, I very quickly decided to push the limit of this product and make modifications to this Qi receiver to get NFC functional again. I was successful in my endeavor, reducing this product down to the 1/3 of its original size and thickness, enabling NFC and retaining wireless charging and S view functions. PERFECT! This is the only option you have if you desire to keep all of these functions on your device, without buying the very expensive OEM wireless charging battery door cover (which doesn't allow you to use ANY cases, expect TPU, for your device because of the added thickness in the OEM wireless charging battery door, so that's a definite FAIL IMO)

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-09: Very slim, doesn't create any bulge through the battery door and charges well. Only issue is NFC doesn't work.Tried multiple times with different tags and could only get the NFC to work a few times. I've yet to find anything that's slim and provides working NFC.

    2014-02-26: I own a Samsung Galaxy note3 and did not like plugging the new style plug in for charging. I ordered the Mudder receiver and the RAVPower charger to solve this problem and am 100% satisfied. When low I position the phone and go to bed, in the morning I am good to go for a couple of days of normal use. What more could you ask for?     2011-04-16: These headphones are not worth the money. Even with a bass-boosting EQ, the low-end is thinner than the new iPad. They certainly sound no better than the stock Apple headphones, but cost many times more. It is nice that there are no less than 5 different-size tips that can be used, but none of them improved the very weak low-end. Even music that is supposed to have a thump ended up with nothing more than a flabby slap. It's a shame, too, because the midrange and high-end is actually pretty good.IF you are a jazz or acoustic music listener, than this may not be an issue, but rock, funk, and soul listeners will need to go elsewhere. As for this pair, they are going right back for a refund.If anyone can suggest a decent-sounding pair of earbuds that will actually hold up under use, than I would really like to know what they are.

    Rating: 2

    2014-02-12: These headphones sound great and come with 3 sizes of ear pieces. The construction of the cable and control are first rate. The flat no-tangle cable is great--almost impossible to tangle in a knot, unlike almost every other set of headphones I've used. But the cable is much heavier than conventional earphones and it transmits the noise of friction as the cable brushes against your clothing, jacket, or whatever. I have to use a clip to secure the cable to my lapel, but I still get the noise.

    Rating: 4

    2011-02-12: These are the best headphones I ever bought for a portable device and for the price they compare to headphones that cost well over 100 dollars. I would recommend these for andbody that has a iphone or ipod or for that mater all smartphones

    Rating: 5

    2012-01-31: These reasonably priced ear buds do the job. They have decent sound, and better yet, they don't get tangled. I was so sick of using earbuds that magically got tangled in the worst possible gordian knots no matter how carefully I stowed them in their little case. Never mind stuffing them in your pocket.These have rubber coated, "ribbon-like" cables which refuse to get tangled up. The control on the right earbud side works fine. I have no complaints about these earbuds at all.

    2011-10-10: Compared to screen protectors (possibly from the same company) that I have used in the past, they are pretty cut and dry as far as how to install them. I actually went through 4 of these before I could get one installed correctly because I'm a moron I guess. The fit is good and they adhere to the screen really well. I just couldn't seem to make them fit at first and once I got them to fit perfectly I couldn't work all the bubbles out. Because of my cat, I couldn't seem to get out all the hair or bubbles out. So I realize that these issues aren't because of a bad product or a low rating.What I didn't like about the protectors was the fact that the more I used my phone, and using the swype function for the virtual keyboard, and the more I swyped words, the more the protector formed minute scratches in the same patterns of my finger presses and the more dull the screen seemed to appear, especially in these areas. So, since attempting to use the protectors, I find that over time with constant use, the seem to scratch and really make the screen look cheap. So, I removed it once again and probably won't attempt to add a screen protector as the original screen of the phone seems to do a pretty good job at being able to clean up finger prints and NEVER scratches or becomes dull looking. With the other screen protectors that I have purchased before as I mentioned above about being from the same company because of the way they install, didn't seem to scratch up over time and didn't seem to rob the device of the screen sensativety like these do. I liked those ones.Not sure at this point if I recommend these to anyone else. I guess I could say...try them at your own risk. I will probably not buy them again.

They are dry-apply (No soap and water needed) so you may find you get dust under them -- just use a piece of scotch tape to pick them off the bottom of the screen and drop it again! It does come with three protectors, so if you mess it up completely, you have another chance at it right away. Shipping was reasonably priced, and arrived quickly.

    $B0045LHHCY

    2011-04-07: I was pleasantly surprised - some reviews indicated there were problems with this product but I had none. I was very careful to follow the instructions, including leaving my beloved phone at home for 36 hours (instructions say 24, but I figured another night wouldn't hurt it). After that time, there were a few very small bubbles still - the instructions said these would go away, and THEY DID! I was worried about them and thought maybe I'd need to reapply the protector, or use the card to try to smooth the bubbles out, but I let them come out on their own, and after a day or two they were completely gone.My only disappointment with this product is that about 1/3 of the screen on the left side now has a "rainbow effect" and I haven't discovered how to get this to go away. Otherwise, the protector has adhered marvelously for the past 2-3 months, it's like it's not even there.Don't waste time with a cheap screen protector - been there, done that. Get this one, it's awesome.

    2011-01-18: Ive installed skins on other phones before, so I knew what to expect when installing this skin on my TMobile G2. But still I followed the directions. The "spreader" they give you in the box isnt the best I've used, but it works. As others have said, FOLLOW THE DIRECTIONS! The most important thing to do is to let the skin sit on the phone at least 12 hours before using the phone. It took 2 whole days for all of the bubbles to come out, but they are completely gone. Every square millimeter of the screen is protected!I am very happy with the skin and love the way it feels. My only complaint, and its extremely minor, and Ive seen other skins do this too, so its really not a big deal, but if you use your fingernail to tap the screen (my girlfriend cant break herself of this habit), it leaves a little indentation in the skin which will eventually go away, but its slightly visible when you see reflected light on the screen. But this, in no way, impacts the usability of the phone. You cant even see it when looking straight on.Update - 6/14/11Its been over 6 months since Ive installed the Skinomi on my G2 and am happy to report that I still have no scratches, edge peels, or any other signs of wear. I have have many people ask me what type of screen protector I have as many people paid a lot more for other types from retail stores and havent been as happy as I have. Since buying my Skinomi, Ive recommended them to several of my friends and Ive even installed a couple for people and they have all been unanimously happy!

    Rating: 5

    2011-10-17: I bought this to replace the ORIGINAL screen protector that my G2 shipped with about a year before. I'm already disappointed.If you are a habitual nail biter/have no protruding nails left, don't play any games or use the onscreen keyboard on your phone this is probably for you. Otherwise, stay away.The actual material is rather soft and very susceptible to gouging. I have found that the gouges do tend to heal themselves - after a a week or more. But if you use the screen regularly, that ain't gonna cut it. Being in a well lit environment makes the gouges and other marks (striations) show up annoyingly well; if you're in a low light environment you hardly notice them.After reading about the warranty in the reviews here - save your money and buy a different, cheaper one.The only positive things I find are:1) it is indeed incredibly clear2) its easy to apply and no bubbles/particles etc

    2012-01-16: I like this case, super thin and looks and feels nice.     Rating: 4

    2012-09-20: Its not easy to find that "perfect" case for my nexus. I love the way my nexus is without a case, but since I sometimes drop my phone and don't trust other peoples clumsiness either, I know I need some protection for it. I had one of the cruzerlite cases for my nexus, but as cute as that android was on the back, I felt the case was a bit more bulky than I'd like. After reading review after review, I came across this feather case. The main downside, as others have pointed out, is the lack of protection on the top and bottom of the phone, and the tiny gap between the phone and case from the pad inside. I've had this case for about a week now, and though it isn't "perfect", its lightweight, stylish and gives me better access to my charging port.

    Rating: 4

    2013-01-30: I have bought at least 15 cases for the galaxy nexus and this is without a doubt the worst one yet. I assume it is a defective unit. The sides are so loose it falls off in my pocket. I did a test drop onto carpet from about 18 inches and the case flew across the room. In addition, it offers no protection to the top or bottom of the device. I wasn't concerned after looking at the pictures because I assumed there was at least enough lip on the case to offer some protection but there isn't. If you are looking for a super thin case then I would recommend the ringke slim. It is actually thinner than this case and offers protection to both the top and bottom. This case is really a poor design. They claim it is only a millimeter thin but it adds as much girth as a TPU case while offering none of the protection. I strongly recommend looking elsewhere. As I said earlier, if you want a phone that feels naked, go with the ringke. It is a much better case in both looks and protection. Actually, this case is worse than all of the $2 Chinese cases I've bought. In my experience and opinion if you want protection and excellent fit go with the cruzerlite case. If you want sexy and a nearly naked phone go with the ringke.

    Rating: 5

    2012-09-25: I have always liked Incipio products. I ordered this Feather case (in black) on 9/23 for my white Galaxy Nexus and received it today, 9/25. The case looks and fits great. I am familiar with Incipio's rubberized finish on this case and know that it should hold out well. It comes with a screen cloth and screen protector as well. The cutouts for power and volume rocker are just fine for me. Do not hesitate to order yours!

    Rating: 5

    2012-01-24: This is a quality product. I have the Verizon Nexus with standard battery. The Feather case is easy to put on and take off, an important consideration for anyone planning on using the Samsung OEM car dock and/or OEM desktop dock that utilize the charging pins on the right side of the phone. The case is grippy as well and fits the phone perfectly. It has wide open cutouts that allow direct access to the phone's volume and on/off buttons without interference. The case wraps around the back and sides and edges of the phone but leaves the top and bottom edge exposed. While it doesn't cover the entire phone like the Incipio NGP, the trade off is that it is extremely light and adds very little to the phone's girth.I've seen other reviews in which people complain that the Feather doesn't provide sufficient protection. I guess these folks didn't bother to read the advertising first, or didn't pick up on the fact that the very name ("Feather") implies light protection. This case is for people looking to enhance grip and protect the phone from scratches. If you're a brick mason, a heavy machine operator or are just rough on your phones, get something else, like the Incipio Silicrylic. I have also read elsewhere that some people felt the need to modify their cutouts, but this must have been for an earlier version of the Feather case than the one I have. It needs no modification as the cutouts are well designed and large.Another nice thing is that the Incipio Feather case comes with a high quality dry screen protector.If you are looking for a very lightweight and thin cover that protects the Verizon version of the phone (with std. battery) from light scratches and bumps, this is a great choice.

    Rating: 5

    2013-04-13: Ok so I just got this case and the first thing you notice is that it looks really good. However, the fit isn't as flush and perfect as I expected, the cut outs are perfect but what I notice is that it is slightly raised in the back as if they didn't accommodate enough for the curve that the galaxy nexus has. It isn't really obvious to be bothered about but that little issue is still there. Other than that its a really nice case...

    Rating: 4

    2012-08-23: The feel and fit of this cover for the Galaxy Nexus (GN) is perfect for me. Easily and quickly snaps into place. The outside has a rubbery texture that gives the phone good grip. The edges fill out just enough to protect the screen if it's dropped face down but also doesn't interfere with normal operation of the screen. All of the buttons are accessible and the cutouts for the camera, mic, and speakerphone are perfect. The inside of the case has a rubber padding which helps with some shock absorption (or so we'll see).I prefer a thin case to keep with the sleek slim design while also adding some extra grip. I've also used an Otterbox Commuter; and while both are great cases the Otterbox felt a little too big for my taste. (Yes I know the Commuter series is not that big.) The case includes a screen protector and I'm still trying to decide my feelings on it. The cut out is close to perfect and only a few bubbles remain. However, the bottom edges are slightly lifting, it does slightly reduce the sensitivity of the touch screen, and adds some glare.I gave it 4 stars, instead of 5, because the bottom and top corners are only partially covered. The top and bottom are entirely exposed. Obviously on the bottom there was a need to have access to the microphone, USB plug, and earphone jack. But I still felt there could have been a little more coverage to protect the areas around it. Also, I do find a lot of dust, lint, and dirt build up in the sides and behind the case; most likely from being in a pocket most of the day. Not a huge deal, just means I weekly take off the case and wipe it and the phone down.Overall, I'm very satisfied with this case. I believe it gives good coverage and protection without adding unnecessary size to the phone. I will be looking to Incipio for future cases the next time I upgrade my phone.

    Rating: 4

    2013-02-08: This case does exactly what I was looking for. Gives my phone just a little more protection that no case while still maintaining a slim profile. It goes in and out of my pocket with ease and feels almost as good as having a phone with no case. This does leave the top and bottom somewhat exposed, which should be obvious from the photo. If you're looking for full protection look elsewhere, this case is not designed for that. In another review someone mentioned the power button being more difficult to press and they are right. This is the only grip I have, and was the only reason I didn't rate at 5 stars. I'm sure they need the case to be a little thicker there to maintain structural integrity but it interferes with functionality. Nothing too major, I got used to this within the first day. Overall I'd say great case if your looking for something slim buy this!

    Rating: 4

    2012-10-14: The Incipio Feather is my go-to case for every smartphone I've owned.It's durable and fits like a glove.This thing is really, really thin! That's great because this phone is not the smallest/thinnest to begin with.The matte finish adds the perfect amount of texture to keep it from slipping out of your hand.Two caveats:If you're looking for a case that fits the phone with the extended battery in, this ain't it. Doesn't fit.And if you're looking for a case that will provide fall protection, look elsewhere. There's no rubber cushion here.What it does provide is a durable matte covering for your phone to keep it from flying out of your hand, without being big and bulky and making you look like you're holding a palm pilot.

    2012-01-01: I can't say enough how much I love this case. If you don't really want a case on your Nexus but at the same time do not want to scratch or ding it, this is the case.     Rating: 5

    2012-08-22: This is the second Incipio case I have owned. I have one for the Motorola Atrix. I love the minimal thickness of the case which allows its use in docks, however, the case does not fit the curved shape of the Nexus. As a result, the case rattles when the vibrate notification goes off. However, the case does provide some protection for the case itself and after removing it a couple of times the case has not shown any signs of stress cracks that other Incipio models have shown. However, Incipio does offer a very good replacement service that I have used for the Atrix case and as such I do recommend them for people that use a dock with their phones. I have since stopped using this case due to the vibration noise issue and have switched to a TPU soft gel case. This has a much better fit and eliminates the noise issue. It shoudl also provide a little more protection than the this case.

    2013-02-07: This case has honestly worked out better for my HTC One V phone than I really expected. I started looking at it originally because the JKase cases everyone seemed to be buying were a combination of overpriced and out of stock. So I got this instead.I had three major objectives in buying this case: spend as little as possible, be unobtrusive, and protect the phone. This case accomplishes those objectives. It is an entirely dull piece of molded gel that has holes in the right places. It feels nice, with a pleasant nonslip grip. I haven't trying testing it by dropping the phone, but the skin is thick enough to protect the phone from waist high drops. Shipping is fast. It must be working well in general because I don't notice it.Would I buy this again? Yes. Is it a style statement? I hope not. Are there better forms of protection? Probably, but the phone didn't cost enough to justify them. The only thing I regret is that I forget to tell my girlfriend to get one for her phone. Oh well.

    2011-06-03: I ordered this six-foot USB cable to use with my iPhone and iPad. The first picture on the amazon product page for this cable has what looks like a generic connector that you plug into the iPhone/iPad. That's the type of connector that looks bigger (fatter?) than the slimmer connector that you see on the current real Apple cables. I was pleasantly surprised to see that the cable that I actually received had the connector that was just like the ones you see on the more current real Apple cables. See the picture that I posted at the top of this product's amazon page for the cable that I received.I bought this cable from amazon marketplace seller 'The OEM Shop' for under three dollars with free S&H.; I received the cable very quickly in five days. I do NOT work for 'The OEM Shop' or for Amazon, but I mention the name of the seller because very few people seem to mention the name of the amazon marketplace seller who they bought a product from in their reviews. These cables are "generic" and it is often difficult to tell which seller sold the product that the buyer is either complaining about or praising in a product review. Also, a lot of buyers don't seem to realize that they can select a particular seller and not just take whoever is the seller who may be appearing as the "default" seller on an amazon product page. I don't know what determines who is the "default" seller, but I'm guessing that Amazon comes first if Amazon has the product in their warehouse(s), but if not, then maybe the other sellers are possibly rotated as the "default" seller on the page, and so on and so forth. Anyways, I think it is worth mentioning who is the particular amazon marketplace seller is in a review - especially if the product is generic like this cable and if there are a lot of sellers who are selling the product via the one single amazon product page.Anyways, the cable that I bought is indeed a nice long six-foot cable. It looks like the real thing. And it was new. I was able to charge my iPhone and iPad by using this cable when connected to a charger plugged into the wall. And I was able to sync my iPhone and iPad with iTunes on my macbook. The cable was also able to charge my iPhone via the USB on my macbook. For my iPhone, I've tried charging with both a real official apple power adapter and also a generic power adapter - and both worked. (Of course, for my iPad, I had to use the 10w charger that came with my iPad because you can't use anything else when charging from an electrical outlet in the wall.) I will be using this nice long six-foot cable for whenever I want to charge my iPhone or iPad for like when I want to use my iPhone or iPad when I'm in bed or if I'm sitting elsewhere like at the kitchen table and if I want to save the battery for later. (I would be keeping the shorter original cable that came with my iPhone/iPad for use with my macbook for syncing the iPhone/iPad.) I'm happy with this purchase and with this cable.

    Rating: 5

  • B00CO665MA

    $B00CO665MA

    2013-07-16: I ordered this phone (G840G) to replace my 800g which had problems with the virtual keyboard. The keyboard in this phone is really great; wider spaced keys (on the android keybd) and much less 'touchy' than the 800g was. Now it is a pleasure to text again. I also like the feature to shut off the 'phone lock' if I wish to and I use that a lot; being home most days there is no need for me to have the phone constantly lock up. Volume on this phone is very good as I have some hearing loss and many phones I've tried I just could not get them loud enough. The touchscreen is smooth with no glitches and scrolling (as thru contacts) is a breeze with this phone. One problem I am having is a friend sent me 3 photos I want to save (to my sd card) and when I call up the photo, there is no option to save it that I have found. Will have to work on that I guess. My main complaint and the reason for 4 stars is that I cannot use the wifi on this phone. I have a Netgear router and went to their site to verify my password; but the only way I can connect this phone to my wifi is to choose "WAP" on Netgear's site. And then, I cannot use my notebook or my tablet, because they are currently under a stronger security setting. From what I have seen (and might be wrong here), the WAP setting is a very weak security setting and not recommended. I bought this phone specifically because it had wifi and would save me some minutes when I'm at home, but I cannot connect to it. Other than the wifi, I think it is a pretty stable phone.UPDATE: 7/30/13 - I felt I had to add one additional feature of this phone (LG840G) at this time and that is the virtual qwerty keyboard is only available while you are texting. It will not come up while searching online or at any other time that I have found (even though I have it set for default). For me, this was a big disappointment because I've never had a phone that operates like this. I love the qwerty keyboard and simply cannot stand using the std number keypad. Bad idea LG; very bad idea for a so-called phone of today.

    Rating: 4

    2013-10-24: If all you need is a phone with an easy interface, this is a great value. But currently with Virgin Mobile I get 1,500 minutes of talk time AND text messaging for $30 per month! That's a much better value than this. PLUS....this phone is ULTRA sensitive when you need to change screens ... I struggled to keep it on the window I wanted. Btw, the e-mail feature didn't work.

    2013-09-05: I decided to upgrade from a double minute phone to a triple minute phone. This phone is a lot easier to use than my old cell phone. This phone has a lot of really nice features. I like that the volume on this phone is really loud. I can hear my phone ringing when I have it in my desk at work. I like that I can change fonts from small to very large. I have mine set on large. I use the tip calculator and notepad quite frequently. I like that the phone automatically shuts off after a couple of minutes so that way I don't accidentally dial a phone number and use my minutes. I have found that I only have to charge phone every couple of days. I prefer to use my Kindle Fire instead of phone when I want to use wifi or email. I have found reception to be good when I make and receive calls on phone.

    2013-09-14: Decent enough phone if you don't expect too much. It's better than a non-smart phone, but it's also not quite what some people might be used to. It's missing a lot of little things I enjoyed on my droid, but for the price you can't really complain. But it's really nice looking. Great battery life as well. It works for calls, internet, text and that's good enough. Camera is poor, but I don't really use it much. Otherwise, no real complaints. One thing I will complain about is the spam phone calls I get since I signed up for Tracfone. Nobody knows my number and I have yet to ever give it to anyone, but I get calls all the time from various numbers. I won't blame the phone for that, but something to think about if you decide to go with Tracfone since the phone is unusable if you don't use their service.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-06: I wanted to up grade to a smart phone but couldn't justify the cost and contract of a Verizon phone/plan since I may be moving to a part of the world in the near future where it may be expensive or impossible to use. Since I already had a Tracfone this seemed to be a good solution in the mean time.I was pleasantly surprised by the intuitiveness of this phone's functions and the ease of transferring my old number, minutes & service to the new phone, which I did thru my online account. Being able to browse online using the WI-Fi capability without using minutes (as long as you have access to a network) is a big plus, and of course you still have the option to burn some minutes to browse if a network isn't available and you have a cell signal, which doesn't seem to be all that bad since Tracfone has some data to minutes formula rather than charging for the time you actually spend online. Another plus is this phone came with Triple Minutes For Life verses my old phone's Double Minutes For Life, adding more justification for the upgrade.As other folks have mentioned in their reviews, there are some compromises when it comes to the operating system, other software, & availability of the virtual keyboard, but I think there may be apps that can be added and tweaks to be sniffed out as workarounds for the encountered deficiencies, which I've yet to have the chance to fully explore. This phone has already easily met my expectations and can only get better as I learn more about it.

    Rating: 4

    2013-07-21: This is a good starter phone that would have any rug-rat convinced they can mimic Mom on her iPhone.There are a lot of reports about the 840's problematic Wi-Fi provision, and I am somewhat disappointed that mine also arrived with that same defect.I had more plans for this little phone that is just one step short of being an Android, and certainly the many comments and YouTube videos tell a different story of success for the many avid enthusiasts happily using this phone.But attempts to upgrade my old Tracfone began a chain of problems that finalized with a realization that its Wi-Fi would not be working for me, and ironically any further attempt to return this phone would result in a loss of remaining service time. Tracfone has more control over their phones than what they would readily reveal, but it's hardly worth the time involved in getting everything corrected when I would never consider using it in place of an Android anyway. The 840's Web browser is very basic.LG also made an attempt to provide a suitable clipboard memory in this 840, but unfortunately that fell short of expectations as well, so it's one and only success remains in its Bluetooth provision that received some improvement over its LG800G predecessor. Bluetooth remains as its one shining ability other than being a truly reliable text/voice phone that is made even less costly by allowing triple minutes.We can hope that the successor of this phone will be better provisioned and include reliable components, so if not yet decided about this phone, then I would suggest passing this one up for now in favor of the much more extensive and rewarding abilities provided in a variety of other smartphones that sell for about the same price as this mere toy.UPDATE: July 29, 2013I made corrections above regarding this smartphone and should also state that a fair appraisal of this little phone would also include some features I neglected to cover previously. In fact it has a couple more rather welcome and significant improvements over its LG800G predecessor, the first being its ability to be connected to a PC as a mass storage device. This allows data files, videos, music, pics, etc. to be copied or moved from your PC directly to the phone's internal memory so they can be viewed, played, or sent by this phone. Secondly, it shows a superb ability to play recorded movies or video and sound podcasts and mp3 music. Videos must be converted first and conform to sizing specifications, and the directions for doing all of this can be found with a search of the Web.

    Rating: 4

    2013-08-29: I am really enjoying my phone. I wish I had a manual to use it better, but I am getting better all the time. Thanks!

    Rating: 5

    2014-02-19: Purchased for my 12 year old. I want her to have a phone for safety but am not ready to put her on my Verizon plan. This phone was a good compromise. She has been pleased with it. It's not advanced by any means, but its a little "fancier" than a simple flip phone.

    Rating: 4

    2013-06-23: had 2 phones 1st was shared plan(I only use a phone for where,when and how.not long chit chat). was paying biggest company 60$ a month 25$ was my share. when I cancelled I really had over 3k mins left.   • B0040X39EM

    $B0040X39EM

    2010-11-14: I bought this case with the expectation that I would get something better than a $3 case I might get on ebay. Needless to say I'm disappointed. I wrote the manufacturer in hopes that the product I received might be defective, but after endless promises that someone would contact me I have given up. Here are some things to consider...1.) The case does fit the phone, but no better than a generic case. My specific case has extra space and visibly wiggles around the phone loosely.2.) The rubber around the case (the material that gives the case the rubberized feel) wears off with easy rubbing.3.) The case will scratch the sides of your phone. Had I known this I would have simply gone with a ghost shield or zagg.If you're buying this case with the expectation that you're buying something premium, you'll be disappointed. There are a lot of positive reviews about this product, but notice that almost all are from people who 'just bought' the product. There are several similar cases that can be found on Amazon for under $1, this case offers no more protection than one of those.

    Rating: 4

    2010-12-29: Bought this based on the positive reviews and lack of options (at the time) for my Epic 4G. So far this case has lived up to its stellar reviews. Perfect fit on both sides and is very easy to install or uninstall as needed. "Rubberized" finish feels great and provides the perfect amount of grip without feeling sticky, especially when taking your phone in and out of pockets. I've already dropped my phone more than a few times and this case has done its job to perfection. It does add a little more bulk to an already bulky phone but that's to be expected for those of us who choose a slide out keyboard. Having said that, this product has been the most functionally elegant hard case that I've come across over the past several years. Highly recommended.
