  • B00JAOFPZW

    $B00JAOFPZW

    2014-06-29: I don't even know where to start with this review.Do you love your iPhone? I mean, do you reeeeeeally love your iPhone? So much that you wouldn't dare put it in your pocket, purse or bag like 99% of everyone else out there, but only do because you don't have any other options aside from maybe a belt clip? Well, you're in luck, as now you can wear it around your neck with the iHangy!The iHangy is a cheaply made lanyard for your iPhone that does two things: makes it easily accessible for you so you don't have to go through pockets to get your phone, and it makes you look like a complete tool. This is the kind of thing where, when people see you with it around your neck in public, you -will- get looks, and not the kind that are envious. I don't even see people wearing their work IDs on lanyards around their necks, so what are the chances you'll see anyone wearing this for more than a few minutes?Divided into two main parts, the iHangy tries to offer protection for your iPhone. First there's the incredibly thin silicone skin that you put your phone into. Then you slide it into the equally incredibly thin plastic hanger that the lanyard connects to. There is nothing to keep the silicone case secure inside the plastic case- the sides are both open. Even the elastic lanyard piece doesn't seem to be all that stable when you connect it to the case. We wore the iHangy for about 30 minutes, walking around, climbing stairs and all kinds of normal things, and it was coming loose when we finally checked on it. Using your phone while in the iHangy isn't that fun either. The sides of the silicone and plastic case make touching whatever you need to on the screen a little hard.The product's box also needs some attention. This is the most boring box for a product aimed at something that's trying to be fashionable (more on that in a second). It has orange and white stripes going around the whole thing, and the iHangy only takes up around 35% of the whole box. There's also this horrendous summary of the product on the back, which mentions that this is where function meets fashion. As if that weren't bad enough, they use such words and phrases as "your expensive iPhone 5c" and "investment" when referring to the iPhone. Good lord people, iPhone owners aren't kings or anything. Enough of this already.I will be nice and give it an extra star for two reasons. One being that I had fun making a video for it, and the other reason is that the iPhone's buttons aren't obscured with the covering. You can adjust the volume, hit the Home button and all that just fine.

    Rating: 2

    2014-05-19: Not to be sexist, but when I saw this product I immediately thought of my two teenage daughters. They wear skinny jeans (with teeny tiny pockets) and refuse to carry purses. Even though they are fashionistas, they insist on stuffing their iPhones into these tiny pockets which is not only unfashionable it's risky. The phones sometimes slide right out of their pockets. We had gotten my younger daughter a lanyard wallet to carry her money, etc. in. A lanyard for her iPhone was something we were willing to try.Let's start with the case. It's a two part case with a flexible silicone sleeve you put over your phone. You then slide that into a had outer shell. The phone is completely protected on three sides like most decent cases. Even the home button is covered. The port cut outs are where you'd expect them. My only beef is the bottom part of the case, where the headphone jacks is, extends out beyond the bottom of the phone. That isn't a problem as long as you have head phones with narrow and straight in 3.5mm jacks. If you have headphones with a 90 bend on the jack, as some of mine have, they are not going to fit into the jack anymore without an extension.One concern I had was the sturdiness of the clip that attaches the case to the lanyard. The phone is most definitely not going to slip out of the case, but if the connector isn't secure, the whole case could become detached from the lanyard, leading to a disaster when you phone drops from around your neck. The clip seems to be secure enough. You just want to make sure you have it clipped in securely. I caught my daughter nervously slinging the phone around a couple of times (and it never came off). She also tosses her phone into the air for fun. That's one reason we like having a sturdy case for her.The clip comes with a very short and stubby stylus. The stylus is pretty much worthless, IMO. They could have left that off. The case is available in multiple color combinations if you purchase it separately, but it appears the combo I got - with the lanyard necklace, only comes in blue and white. My daughter didn't really care for the color at first since she has a yellow phone, but it grew on her.Another issue my daughter has with the device is the cord is pretty long. Even on the illustration on the packaging, it shows the phone hanging down so the top of it is about mid-way down your stomach. She would like it a few nches higher. We figured out a way to adjust the strap to move it higher with the included sliding clip, but it creates a second loop behind your neck that is a bit awkward. My daughter is 5'10" tall, so, this would be really long on a shorter person.Pros:* Decent case- the case alone is worth the price* Keeps your phone available and secure* Great for when you don't have pockets or have shallow or tight pocketsCons:* Headphone port might be inaccessible depending on your headphones (works fine with Apple headphones)* Lanyard is a few inches too long causing phone to hang too low

    Rating: 5

    2014-07-14: I had trouble getting around this review because I did not see many uses for this. That is until I was talking to a friend, who is in construction and was on a ladder, trying to make notes into his iPhone and butt-dialing and texting at the same time. It was perfect for him.First off, this is not a fashionable case, but it can be useful. It is definitely not for me. But, it can be useful to others.The case is pretty flimsy. It is a skin really, not a case. It is made from a rubberized plastic and it fits the iPhone but it is not a perfect fit. There is no screen cover so you have to be careful about scratches. The skin is not going to really protect your phone against falls.What would protect it is that the lanyard attaches to your phone through the charging port. The secure fit definitely keeps the phone with you and not in the floor.So, fashionable? No. Useful? Yes, for some. Protective of your phone? Only for minor scratches.*Sample provided for review.

    Rating: 3

    2014-05-20: I received this in the mail today, fortunately as I was working in my vegetable garden this afternoon and I like to listen to music from my Iphone. However, I didn't have a pocket! So, this product arrived on a good day.It was nicely packaged and very easy to put together. Overall, I think it's a pretty cool concept. Thankfully, it's not cheapy. The materials are well made, although I feel that the white outer case will probably stay white, while the silicone lanyard will probably discolor...I see yellow grime coming on.Nonetheless...on to the pros -vs- cons:Pros...* Lanyard is adjustable (and stays)* The inner silicone case (blue) is soft and stretches over the phone very easily and the buttons/connections line up well* The outer UV plastic, fits pretty snug with the phone once you slide it in and the buttons/connections also line up well* It looks pretty fashionable* The phone is well protectedCons...* The stylus connector piece will be my biggest gripe. Absolutely pointless to have a mini stylus in this design...firstly...no one uses them??? Secondly...it's the lanyard connector you have to squeeze the stylus tip and the other end together (pretty hard) to get the piece to fit into the center (bottom) connection, where the power charger connection cutout is. NOW...here's my gripe - depending on which way you put it in - the stupid stylus piece sticking off the end of this design (see pics) covers either the auxiliary connection or the microphone/speaker (?). I have to say this is the portion that needs working on. I would remove the stylus so that both end connections are clear. You would however, still have to disconnect the lanyard to charge your phone.* Inner silicone cover (blue) is so soft that it is not tight enough fit and sit flush against the sides of the phone. Meaning, once you slide it into the outer UV cover, the sides (blue silicone) that are loose stick out from the white.FYI...I received this product from the manufacturer in lieu of a fair consumer review.6/12/14 - UPDATE:I wanted to note that the outer case that the phone slides into WILL EASILY crack if you drop it. The phone will still be protected, however you will lose the ability to "hang" the phone properly. Mine fell off of my nightstand and completely shattered the top along the molding seam. Just an FYI:)

    Rating: 3

    2014-06-02: Disclaimer: I received a review sample from the manufacturer.There's no doubt that the case is sturdy and well-made, and fits the phone in a nice, snug manner. The cutouts are carefully arranged to expose jacks, controls, microphone, etc. This immediately became a replacement for the "factory" case that I bought with the iPhone. One drawback, though: the inner edges lap a little into the touchscreen area. This could be an issue if you need to touch at the very extreme edge of the screen (and hence one star off the rating).Now, the add-ons. I know some people like the lanyard, and if you do, this is a good choice for you without doubt. I didn't care for it. I didn't like the sensation of the phone around my neck flopping around when moving or turning quickly. Your mileage may vary; you'll love it or hate it depending on your usage. It's nice to have the phone readily and quickly available to, say, take a photo quickly, but in the end I ended up not using the lanyard.The capacitive stylus is certainly useful for some things, but I can't say it's exactly necessary and with the attachment system the way it is, it is a portability nuisance. I would say if you need the stylus, and you won't for the vast majority of apps, carry it separately in a briefcase or similar. Otherwise leave it home for the most part.All in all, a well-made protective case with add-ons that you can take or leave as you wish.

    Rating: 4

    2014-05-29: Over the past couple of weeks I've really come to appreciate the hands free, immediate accessibility that iHangy's lanyard style necklace casing has come to offer. Having the device dangling from your neck ready to go in a jiff is a blessed convenience once you experience it for yourself. For instance...+used this on a couple of new hikes where we frequently needed to checks maps/gps for navigation+used it at the park to have the camera ready to take pictures of the kids+listening to podcasts (via speaker) while cooking and doing household chores+used it to listen to music on a flight rather than keeping the device in my pants pocketGetting the device into the case is really easy and takes less than a minute thanks to the very handy instructions provided. The lanyard necklace strap has a soft rubberized feel and doesn't irritate my skin even after many hours of contact. The strap is also adjustable so you can extend it to fully where your phone will drop near your belly button or you can raise it higher if preferred. I have the white/blue casing and my main nitpick is the cheapish look and feel of the white plastic. Still, in this case functionality wins over form. Good case overall.note: I was provided a sample of this product for review purposes.

    Rating: 4

    2014-06-02: This was different enough from other iPhone cases I've tried out, so I thought it would be interesting to review... the iHangy case. I never thought about how hanging my iPhone around my neck might work out, but it was better than I expected.The iHangy case has two parts. The inner case is a silicon-based sleeve that fits snugly over the phone. You could leave this on full-time, and it would do a reasonably good job in keeping your phone safe from minor scratches. The outer case is a hard plastic shell with open sides, and the inner case (and iPhone) slides in from either side. The plastic case gives you more of the drop protection that you expect from a shell-style cover. The openings for the front button, photo lens, and all other controls are positioned well, and it's a good case at this base level.What the iHangy does differently is give you the option to attach a lanyard to the case. The rubber cord has a locking mechanism that fits into the charging slot on the phone. When you put that on the phone, you adjust the length of the lanyard, slip it around your neck, and you're off. The locking mechanism also has a small stylus on it, so that's a bonus if you prefer to use a stylus but don't want to carry one around all the time.I was a little concerned at first that it might not be as secure as I'd like, but I couldn't get the lock to fail. It's not coming off the phone until you push the side buttons to unlock and remove it. The inner silicon case grips the outer shell very well, so it's not going to slide out inadvertently. I used it for a walk, and it was nice to not have to stick the phone in a pocket (for the activity tracker) or always have to carry it in my hand. Like most lanyard tags, the momentum of your body can get the phone bouncing back and forth in time to your walking. I found it worked best if I tucked it into my jacket so that it was held in place by the fabric.I won't be using this as my everyday case, as I don't want to have my iPhone around my neck all the time. But depending on my activity or attire, I can imagine that this would be a great option to have available.Disclosure:Obtained From: ManufacturerPayment: Free

    Rating: 5

With the iHangy I have my phone hanging around my neck reducing the likelihood of leaving it on the counter somewhere.I don't see the point for the stylus - I don't know anyone who uses these for iPhones. It's not that inconvenient but just adds unnecessary bulk.

    2012-07-26: I am very upset that I am writing this review right now.I was a few days away from writing a pretty positive review until tonight when my charger has stopped working.I've had these batteries for around two weeks and have been using them exclusively. One of the charging pins seems to have gotten pushed into the charger itself and can not make contact with the battery. When I shake the charger I can hear something small shaking inside. So now I am back to using my OEM battery with a wire like a before, and it sucks more then ever.Also just an FYI the charger does not charge the OEM battery at all, even from the start but these batteries worked so well that I had no need for the OEM at all.I have sent qcell customer service my story and am hoping that they do the right thing and help their customers. I will report back once I hear back from them, and hopefully be able to give them a five star rating.*UPDATE*Completely forgot about this.     2012-08-19: Highly recommend for Samsung galaxy s3. Performs as well as original battery and can charge phone and spare battery at same time.

    Rating: 5

    2012-05-01: After charging the battery for 9 hours (their web site recommends at least 8 hours), I installed it into my Samsung Galaxy S2.For the past 14 hours, I have talked several hours, with the GPS, Wi-Fi and GPS turned on at all times and Bluetooth for about an hour in total. The battery reports that it has 74% of its capacity left.I do not usually leave all of the wireless and GPS services on, but I wanted to stress the battery and see the results.I have cruised the internet, checked maps and location, checked several dozen emails and texted several messages, while my email synchronized every 30 minutes for 5 different email accounts.Bottom line: this battery works as advertised. My standard battery would have had less than 20% capacity by this time, under a similar load/use.For those folks who report that the battery does not work as advertised, I would offer two suggestions:1. Check the Task Manager several times during the day (if one is not pre-installed on your phone, get one from the Google Play Store). I ordered this battery because I thought my original battery was failing. By checking Task Manager, I discovered that I had 3 emails in my outbox that the phone kept trying to send, but couldn't because the videos attached to them were too big for the standard email client to send. So, the phone was burning up juice constantly trying to send emails. Other apps can cause similar problems and the best way to catch them is to check the task manager and identify which apps are running and using what resources.2. Or....assume you got a "bad battery". It happens. Return the battery for an exchange and try again. If it still won't work, there is a possibility that your charger is bad. If you have another charger....try that.One other note: QCell's web site is so-so. Whenever I see text boxes with "Lorem Ipsum...." in them, it means the manufacturer has used a template to build their web site, but has not fully populated it with information. Nonetheless, it does have some useful information.

    Rating: 5

    2013-04-15: The batteries were identical to the OEM Samsung and the charger is a perfect fit for all of the same type batteries. I have another brand that the charger is slightly too large and the contacts do not stay connected during charging. QCell's charger is awesome solution to OEM chargers or batteries.

    Rating: 5

    2013-04-23: This product charges my phone and extra battery at the same time. I haven't noticed any faster charging but that is fine. both my phone and the extra battery fit perfectly.

    Rating: 5

    2012-12-27: These batteries work really well and hold a charge on par with the original battery. I have never tried to use NFC so I can't speak to that. The battery charger that comes with the batteries works great too.

    Rating: 5

    2013-03-31: After about a week of use I unplugged the main power cable from the rear of the docking unit for travel.     2013-05-17: I do like this battery. It lasts 2 days before having to recharge. Follow the provided instructions for the initial charging. There are multiple inserts in the packaging with those instructions so you definitely get the idea that it is important to do. I have 3XL hands so the added size and weight associated with the extended battery and case actually made the S3 better for me.My gripe is the cheap back cover. Since the extended battery is larger, there ends up that there is a void between the cover and the bottom portion of the phone. The cover should be more robust or there should be some sort of internal cross section to offer more rigidity. My cover cracked at the opening for the charger. I have seen that in reviews of other types of extended batteries.The seller is less than responsive. I find it frustrating that the original order arrived in two days but I have to wait 2 plus weeks for a replacement. The TPU case was poor quality. I ordered the YESOO case and it fits and feel much better.

    Rating: 3

    2013-02-28: 2 nfc capable batteries and a wall charger. decent price. wall charger is slow compared to the GSIII's charger. It works great. For the price, it's a nice package.

    2012-08-08: Not sure if this happens to others but the two batteries I received gets hot in my Samsung Galaxy S3. I'm not sure if I have a defective unit or ???     Rating: 5

    2012-06-29: As we all know, Android devices vary greatly when it comes to battery life and the Galaxy S II Skyrocket is no exception! With moderate use throughout any given day, I noticed that my stock battery would be almost dead by the end of the day. I was going to buy an extended battery some time ago, but I could never find one with a white back panel, so I was happy to locate this item!The items themselves are great for the price! The white back panel almost matches perfectly. I say almost because the texture of the phone is different than the panel and the white coloring is off just a tiny bit. These two factors are NOT reasons to skip this item, but I thought I'd mention it. The instructions for using this battery say that you should charge it fully and dis-charge fully 5 to 6 times so you can get the most out of it. I did just that and everything is working fine. I went from having to charging my phone throughout the day to being able to almost go 2 full days without a single charge!! I charge my phone every night while I'm sleeping anyway, so I was never too concerned with having a dead phone, but having this extra life allows me to use my 4G service all day long without worrying about how much power I have left.As you would imagine, the one downside with having an extended battery is that it sticks out quite a bit. This item retains 5 stars in my opinion because this extra weight and size is just a reality. While I love that the Samsung Galaxy S II is a very thin phone, I actually like the extra thickness because it adds some more grip to the phone. The extra weight is not even noticeable after a couple of days use.

    Rating: 5

    2012-11-02: 1 of the batteries lasts almost as long as the stock one. The other battery doesn't last as long but it is decent. The charger is nice but is only 350ma. Which is way less than even the low power USB standard of 500ma. A wall charger should be 1amp and it would fully charge in 3 hours vs 9-10 as it is now.

    Rating: 3

    2013-09-17: I ordered this battery based on the recommendation of others on the XDA forums.I followed the charging instructions and used the battery for about 2 weeks.When the battery initially arrived I did notice a significant battery life increase, however I have decided most of that increase was because my stock battery was dying.I was never able to get the battery stats to get anywhere near the 3600mAh that this battery claims. The best I ever got after self calibration was about 2600mAh. Over the last week I have seen that drop a little each day. I am now down to 1950 mAh.The replacement battery cover plate fits well. The bulge is not something that bothers me much. The weight increase is minimal.I ended up returning this battery. Once the mAh dropped under 2000 I just could not justify having the bulge out the back and not getting the additional 1600 (almost another full stock battery) with of life that I should be. Its a shame.

    Rating: 2

    2012-08-01: Amazon needs to crack down on the fake reviewing.The price is what lured me in to buy these and I must admit - so far so good. I have charged and used both batteries that came with the charging unit twice now. And I honestly cannot tell the difference between the OEM battery that came with the S3. The batteries appear to be well made and fit perfectly in the phone. I am unable to test the NFC capabilities at this point, so I cannot comment on NFC. My small beef comes with the charger - it takes forever to charge the batteries. I started charging a battery this morning around 8:30AM and it didn't finish until 2:00-2:30 PM. The charger will start out with a pink glow, telling you that that battery is charging. As it gets closer to a full charge, the charger will turn purple and finally blue. Blue means that the battery has fully charged. It can take a good 6 hours to charge your battery, so be prepared to wait. But the good thing is that you will receive two batteries, which should give you a total of 3 batteries (including the OEM). I will never run out of power for my cell phone. The only thing I really want to test is the longevity of these batteries. Will they last 3 months? A whole year? I am hoping to get 2 years worth of use out of them, but we shall see. Perhaps I will update my review in a couple more months to let everyone know how they are still holding up. I am removing one star because the charger is pretty basic and takes forever to charge. I also kind of wish that the charger light were a bit dimmer. I feel like I am raving in my office cube.***UPDATE***The charger has just broken. The charger is very cheap and one of the charging pins has fallen into the device. It no longer can charge batteries.

    2012-08-04: I bought the Q-cell 2 battery/charger package about 2 weeks ago, it shipped quickly. The batteries do indeed have NFC just as the OEM batteries, and I use NFC daily. They fit exactly as the OEM batteries and seem to have similar battery life. I can't quantify it, but I don't notice a difference on battery life whether using the original battery or the Qcell, in fact, I usually don't know/remember which battery I have in the phone unless I look. I would say 2300mAh is probably not accurate, I would say they are probably 2100mAh, same as the stock battery.The charger does take a long time to charge the batteries, about 8 hours from 10% to 100%, but it does charge the batteries completely. There are no instructions in the package, and they are just in plain boxes. I did find the the charger LED is purple while charging, and turns blue when the battery is fully charged. The wall charger has a USB out to allow you to use a usb/micro-usb to charge your phone directly, however based on how long it takes to charge the spare battery in the charger, I haven't tried to charge a phone directly, seems like it would take forever.Overall, I think this is a great value for $25.

    Rating: 5

    2012-08-04: The charger and 2 batteries arrived in about a 2x2x3 box. The batteries fit perfectly in the S3 and I've had no issues in the 3 days I've owned them. The charger is nice and has a folding plug so if you travel it will pack without poking 2 little slots in the side of your bag. The batteries slide in securely to charge (one at a time). The light on the front is a pinkish color when charging and blue when charged (instead of the typical green for ready-to-go). The charging lights are bright and easy to see, but if you are charging in your bedroom and you are sensitive to light, the little charger may bug you. An unexpected plus (which I may have just breezed over in the product description) to the charger is it also has a USB connection; though I haven't tried it, it seems you can charge your phone off this port without using another AC outlet. Nothing about this product has been bothersome.

    Rating: 4

    2012-07-11: Bought this battery for my girlfriend a few weeks ago and she loves it. Where she lives and works she had poor reception which caused her phone to signal search and thus suck the battey dead in the matter of 6 - 8 hours. With the original battery she had to charge the phone every night and it would often still die before bed time. Now her batter easily lasts all day, and if she forgets to charge it one night it will usually last until the next night. The battery does make the phone fatter, and doesnt work with most phone covers, which is the only down side. The phone still fits in your pocket, but it is much less comfortable than before. Highly recommend this battery to anyone who want longer life, and if you do not carry your phone in your pocket this is a perfect product.

    2012-12-12: It seems to discharge at about the same rate as the stock 3100 mAh battery. The battery monitor widget states 3100 mAh. So I need to test it more.Pros: The backcover fits very tight. I still have around 40% at night time. With the standard battery, I would be at 10% around 6:00 pm. Good job QCell. It does take a few cycles of recharge to take advantage of the longer batter life.

    2013-05-26: This battery came ready to work it doubles my phone time the new back works like it came from samsung

    Rating: 5

    2012-11-16: I've tested a number of batteries for the GS3 and now starting with the GN2 with a CBA-III/CBA-IV battery analyzer. It's become a personal project of mine since the last QCell battery I got had plastic spacers inside where other batteries had battery. I'm glad to report that this battery appears to be legitimate.I'm kind of surprised and concerned to see that I'm the first verified reviewer for this battery. All the other reviewers came out of the woodwork making their first reviews on amazon for a product they got elsewhere...I've included a chart from my test results comparing the Hyperion and QCell batteries in my first comment - and they're practically equal. QCell delivers about 3200mAh per battery with a 500mA load. With a higher load of 2000mA, the rating would be about 3125mAh capacity.The included charger has a usb charging port and is no worse or better than any other brand's included charger -- or any of the GS3's chargers. It appears to be the same as the GS3 charger, but with the prongs rotated counter-clockwise 90 degrees so the battery sticks out to the right. This means that it's slow as ever - and will take longer to charge than a GS3 battery because the battery has higher capacity.This battery delivers what it promises, but I'm concerned about the number of first time reviewers that just had to comment on how great the battery is. Based on battery capacity alone, I would recommend it.Based on the practices of QCell I have seen: small cells in batteries and filling the space with plastic, campaign downvoting of negative reviews and revealing customer pictures, spamming the customer images to hide revealing photos, putting sockpuppet 1-star first-review reviews on competitors products, putting positive sockpuppet 5-star first-review reviews on their products, I would never recommend a QCell product.

    Rating: 5

    2013-02-28: When I first got this unit I charged the two batteries that came with it and it took over 8 hours each.When I placed the Samsung battery that came with my phone in it, it was a very tight fit and broke one of the plastic tabs on the unit.These batteries caused my phone to re-boot randomly, so I no longer use them.I do not recommend this unit. I later purchased a Samsung OEM stand alone charger with a spare battery and am very happy with that unit.

    Rating: 1

    2013-11-24: It is back up for my kid cell phone. She likes it & help her alot. It is very good too!! Thank you so so much & have a nice day!!

    Rating: 5

    2012-09-05: I was tired of constantly charging & replacing batteries in my cell. A local tech recommended that I try the QCell as he said it would solve my problem. Boy was he right!!! It is a thicker more heavy duty battery & it comes with a compatible dark charcoal grey battery cover that looks attractive with my black phone.I'm on the phone a lot & I have numerous games that I like to play. In place of charging my phone 3-4 times a day, I charge it once at night while I'm sleeping. I've been impressed with how durable this battery is. With the smaller battery, I was seeing a rapid discharge rate by now. The QCell just keeps on going & going on one overnight charge!!! With the additional thickness, it doesn't fit in a regular leather case; however, it does still fit in my holster. It doesn't fit in my wall charger, but charges well with my wall micro charger. So the 2 little drawbacks do NOT outweigh the benefits I've received from this battery. I found the price to be more than reasonable & YES, once this battery looses its zip, I will be buying another as it is economical & convenient!!!

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-04: This is a preliminary review as I have only been using the batteries for two days. So far the batteries perform at the OEM level and last me the entire day with easily 60-70% of the battery remaining at the end of the night. I would say that I'm a pretty heavy user, playing games and downloading files throughout the day. The battery fits perfectly into the back of the phone, so there is no need for a different back plate. I love the fact that it came with a battery charger. The great part about the charger is that it also has a USB female connector so that you can put your micro-usb cord and charge your phone directly.One thing I like about the Qcell brand is that they are a Canadian company. I wish I knew of an American company that produce quality after market batteries, but there are none, so I will stick with them until then.

    2013-06-18: To be honest I didn’t use the battery that much until the last few months and now I’m starting to discover its flaws. The end cover opposite of the charging side of the battery is loosely glued on there. It came lose and broke off within weeks of me using it. I didn’t think much of it but than after using it for a while I noticed that my phone would shut off for no reason when it was in my pocket. I notice that this only happens when I have the Qcell battery in but no issues with the Samsung batteries. I discover that without that end cover there was too much play room for the battery to slide forward therefore not maintaining the contact with the electrical connection ports. I found that if I put something thin and solid on the opposite end that would be enough for the battery to maintain contact with the terminal of the phone. But this is bad quality and I hope maybe the manufacturer will read this and FIX it and maybe send me a better one.

    Rating: 2

    2013-04-07: Update 4/16/13:After 10 days of battery conditioning and 2 extra days of battery discharge monitoring, I find that daily battery life has improved since my last post on day 5, 4/16/13. Not by much though, but it will do. A full charge lasts me 13-16 hours, granted I leave the battery charged for about 3 hours after 100% is reached. The following are my daily monitoring results...Day 1 = 16 hrsDay 2 = 14 hrsDay 3 = 12 hrsDay 4 = 12 hrsDay 5 = 14 hrsDay 6 = 14 hrsDay 7 = 14 hrsDay 8 = 13.5 hrsDay 9 = 14 hrsDay 10 = 15.5 hrsDay 11 = 13 hrsDay 12 = 16 hrsFrom the results I got on this little test, I found that the hype made by other consumers on this product, is not quite as I hoped it would turn out to be for me. But, hey, knowing the security of going all day without having to charge my cell phone, is a-ok in my books. I am upgrading my rating to 5 stars (from 3 stars on last post).Just an addendum, I believe that the longer you leave it charged after 100% is reached the longer the battery life will be.4/7/13:I am currently on day 5 of "battery conditioning" since initial charge of 9 hours, as per box instruction.After the initial charge, day 1, I got about 16 hours of use (data/mobile) to full discharge. Day 2, 14 hours. Day 3, 12 hours. Day 4, almost 12 hours. It appears to be holding up less and less as days go by.Someone had mention in one of the customer reviews that he/she had a problem with the Qcell battery only holding charge as long as the stock (original) battery after 3 days of conditioning, but that he/she had "stuck with it". And within about a week, it was discharging about as he/she was expecting it to, and had no issues since. I am going through the same phase now. I will update once I finish the recommended 6x (or on rare occasion 8-10) of full recharge/discharge on the new battery to achieve maximum capacity. 3 stars for now.

This isn't an issue with the QCell battery so I already like it more. The external charger is kind of cheap but works great so I have no complaints. Keep in mind that most external chargers charge very slowly but that helps extend the life of the battery so that's fine with me. I'm considering returning the Ankers and buying another one of these.     2013-02-02: Seriously. I don't get why a few people did not like this product. Maybe (as someone else suggested) they got a defective battery or didn't follow the directions, I don't know. What I do know, is that I followed the DIRECTIONS, which are VERY VERY important.Here's my experience/input.Put the battery in and let it charge 9 hours WITHOUT interruption. That means no disconnecting the cable, etc. You don't have to do this every time you charge your phone, but you do want to for the INITIAL charge.So then after it was fully charged I disconnected my phone and used my phone as normal.As a trial run, I wanted to see how it would last on a full charge so I avoiding charging my phone.It lasted 2 days and 20 hours before it got down to 2% battery. If that isn't amazing...I HIGHLY recommend this battery. It does make the phone a little heavier/bulkier, but I'm not that obsessive about how my phone looks and I really don't think it's that noticeable anyway. Besides you could probably turn on every feature of your phone and still make it a day or two.

    2012-03-27: DO NOT purchase this if you have the Verizon version of the Galaxy Nexus - Samsung in their infinite wisdom made separate accessories for the GSM version and the CDMA/LTE version.On my GSM Galaxy Nexus, I just reached 24 hours of non stop use using this battery. I have not experiences any issues, charging obviously takes about twice as long, so be sure to use the included charger or a full power car charger (like the Motorola $5.50 charger here on Amazon). Charging over USB on most PC's will take about 10 hours, but a full charge with a 1A charger takes around 3 1/2 hours.

    2013-10-17: I have a two year old Galaxy S2 and the battery was getting so weak that I would only get maybe 3 hours before I was in the red. It was never that good to start with. Now that I have this battery, I can go two days or more without charging if I have to, and this is with bluetooth and wifi turned on and doing some moderate email, facebook and web. I don't use my GPS unless plugged in because I have found the GPS on the S2 to be the most power hungry function of the whole phone. In the car I have watched the battery drain with the GPS turned on even with the phone plugged into a .5 amp car charger. I had to upgrade to a 2 amp charger so I could use my phone for GPS navigation while in the car. So, I don't know how long the battery would last with the GPS turned on while not plugged in, but I would hope you might get 4 to 5 hours if you turned bluetooth and wifi off. Just a guess here.The only thing that I don't like about having this battery is that I can no longer use a protective case for the phone and the new back that comes with this battery is slippery as cat snot and my phone falls out a lot (I keep it in my shirt pocket). I wish it came with one of those non slip backs, but that is just me.

  • B00EN73M4C

    $B00EN73M4C

    2013-10-29: I received this item as part of Ankers power user program for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest. So now onto the review.Like a lot of people I upgraded from the Galaxy S3 to the Galaxy S4 and love the extra battery life that the S4 offers. But it didn't take long for me to wish that I had even more life before needing to charge my phone. I tried the Anker 2600 with NFC, and it ended up being the battery I use the most, but there is only so much MAH capacity that can be squeezed into a slim battery. So this is where the super 7600 Anker battery combo comes in. This 7600 is close to 3 times the mah of the standard 2600, and it shows in the times it lasts. I'll get to the tests I ran a little later, but I wanted to start with the packaging.If you have ordered other Anker products of this size the packaging will look familiar. It comes in a black box with Chrome writing, with features and Ankers contact info on the bottom. After opening it you will see the 5000mah case and battery combo in whatever color you ordered. I received the white one to match my White S4, but it also comes in black.Anker 7600mAh Extended Battery Case for Samsung Galaxy S4, GT-I9505, SGH-I337(AT&T;), SGH-M919(T-Mobile), not NFC capable [18-Month Warranty]. The 5000mah battery is actually built into the case/ battery door. It has a nice felt layer on the inside with 2 gold plated pins that connect to the included 2600mah batteries gold contacts. These 2 together is where you get the 7600mah capacity. You can use the included 2600mah battery by itself, but Anker doesn't recommend it because it might speed up oxidation of the batteries contacts if used without the 5000mah case. Also in the box is the instruction manual, and other various Anker papers. I have added several pics to the customer images section for reference. There are new pics added by Anker also that illustrate how the 2 batteries/ case connect.Now the install is very easy. You just put the 2600mah battery in like you would your stock battery, and the the 5000mah case goes on by putting the side of the phone with the volume rocker in first at an angle, and then pressing the side with the power button down until it clicks into place. The fitment of the case is perfect. I've noticed no gaps, or issues with covering ports or buttons. Charging is the same method as charging your stock battery, and to my surprise it doesn't take that much longer. After charging my stock Samsung battery and the Anker 7600 to full I ran some head to head tests just to see how much longer it lasts, and it didn't disappoint.I set up my test as follows. I set full 100% brightness on the device, and then I used an older version of the MX player app that has the option to repeat a movie once it finishes. I also set the app itself to 100% brightness, with the "keep screen on" option ticked. I then run a full HD movie (think tall blue aliens) in repeat and then record how long each battery lasts. Here are the results:Stock Samsung 2600mah Battery: Ran 6 hours and 38 minutes.Anker 7600mah Battery Combo: Ran 14 hours and 9 minutes.If my math is correct that's a difference of 7 hours and 31 minutes. That's more than double the time the stock Samsung battery lasts. Now I know this isn't how most people are using their phones, but it was just a test I wanted to do out of curiosity, and to show that it definitely lasts a lot longer. You will notice a huge jump in how long it lasts. With even heavy use I doubt you would need to charge after a full days use. Now of course it adds bulk, but that's just unavoidable if you want to add a significant amount of battery life.If you are looking to get a huge bump in your Galaxy S4's battery life I highly recommend the Anker 7600mah Battery combo. And to end the review Ive said it before and Ill say it again, Anker has some of the best customer service I have ever experienced.

    Rating: 5

    2013-10-28: Battery life will last a little over 2 days with heavy usage.Sacrifices size and nfc but well worth the battery life.Very comfortable designed very well to fit in hand.Phone fits securely inside battery case.Easily accessible volume power buttons.Clearance for IR and speaker is great.Durable plastic. (wasn't used to the size and accidentally dropped down the stairs not a nick on the phone or case)Recommend this battery for excellent life and comfort.Just one thing i can recommend is a better grip on the plastic rather than gloss.

    Rating: 5

    2013-11-04: When I got this case, I was a little worried that it was going to be too bulky for me, but over the next couple of days, it grew on me. The fact that the battery case makes my phone a little bit heavier makes me feel more secure about holding it. It makes me feel like the phone is sturdier and won't slip out of my hand. Also, when people looked at my phone, they couldn't tell that there was an extended battery case on it either. That's how slick it looks on my phone.The performance on this case is great. I can use my phone for at least a day and a half and still have batter life on it. This includes listening to pandora, using the GPS, texting, Instagram, and using Snapchat. This was all done on one charge. Now, I don't have to worry about bringing my outlet charger wherever I go. this case has really made my phone more reliable on long days.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-09: I have a Samsung S4 AT&T; I337. Received my Anker S-View flip and Anker 7600mah extended battery case a day early. I noticed when I put the S4 into the case, it felt as if I was going to crack the sides of the phone. I noticed when removing the phone that it marks the sides due to its tight fit. It is definitely secure and big, but what do you expect for hours of battery life. After holding it for awhile its not as heavy and bulky as anticipated. Biggest issue that others have mentioned is that the back housing is notorious for fingerprint and smudging. It also looks like it will scratch easily. Hope Anker will provide replacement batteries for this case as well as the Anker S-View I purchased since they have the special pin set on the back.All in all I will test the battery and see how well it holds. Will update my review then.

    Rating: 3

    2013-10-29: It's midday Tuesday and I've been running on battery since Saturday morning at 7am. Currently I'm at 40% battery remaining. Normally after the end of a single work day I'm at 38-40%. This is GREAT, and on those nights when work extends much later than expected this is going to be a lifesaver, since that's when I'm stuck somewhere troubleshooting something and my phone is essential.This unit consists of a replacement battery and a replacement back that contains another battery. The replacement internal battery has two contacts on it that mate with the replacement back cover to provide the 7600ma total capacity. It does substantially increase the thickness of the phone, but for me it feels good. I like the additional thickness especially for single handed hand use. At this time of year I'm putting my phone in my coat pocket rather than pants pocket anyway. The rounded and beveled edges of the case feel good in the palm.This will vary by user, but the only thing I would change is to add a couple of small strips of rubber grippy material to the side edges, as the case is really slick and smooth. I'm planning on doing that soon.Addendum: By the end of day Tuesday I was at 36 percent battery, and that was after letting the OTA 4.3 upgrade happen from Verizon then tweaking, downloading app upgrades etc. So, pretty heavy usage over the afternoon. I'm even more impressed by the battery life now.Addendum 2: I used this:B00ATH0KEAand put some strips at strategic points on the case according to how I hold it. Feels really good now.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-16: Product exterior - adds quite significant thickness. Overall 11/16" thick at thickest point with the phone compared to 7/16" of myAcase Samsung Galaxy S4 case - Superleggera PRO Dual Layer Protection case for AT&T;, Sprint, T-Mobile and Verizon Galaxy S IV Galaxy SIV i9500 (Black/Grey)(Galaxy S4, Black). Makes phone feel solid, psychologically makes one less likely to drop phone. Black glossy plastic finish gets fingerprints too easily. Deep hole for speaker on back makes it quite noticeable but I was pleasantly surprised that even if blocked it was designed to still allow music through somehow nicely. Battery is 2 parts, a detachable battery (without NFC) that is required because of the customized pins in front that attach to the second nondetachable battery (it is built into the case and almost impossible to charge by itself unless you wire it yourself, so stick with using this case and charging traditionally with cable). Inside of this nondetachable battery case is a nice cloth fabric that is soft and doesn't get dirty. Both the Volume buttons and Power button are very easy to get to.Description of use - easy to install, simply turn off phone, take off battery cover and battery and keep them somewhere safe, put on first battery, then clip on the extended battery. Charge it for a few hours over 100% the first time. Battery life is significantly better. I have done quite a few tests, here are the main results.First, let me state my parameters: I am using stock rooted Touchwiz and if you drag the Notification bar down with two fingers you'll see all the settings. Wi-Fi, GPS, Mobile data, Sound, Sync, Air gesture, Air view, Smart stay and Screen Rotation - these were All On the entire period. Bluetooth was on sometimes for several hours. All others were off. Also keep in mind I have a few apps tweaking battery usage here, the most notable are SnapDragon's BatteryGuru app, Backitude (which is a very smart GPS controlling battery efficiency app so GPS is 'off' when on Wifi), and also Voltage Control with OnDemand mode.After charging to 100% and leaving it in 1900mA Charger for a few hours. I managed to get 9h 14m from 100% to 87%. I then got a total of 19h 12m when I was at 75%. I eventually reach 1% at 2days 3hours 22minutes and 44seconds. I then immediately put it in 1900mAh stock Charger and monitored charging time from 1% to 75% to be 108minutes, continuing there from 75% to 94% taking 78minutes and from 94% to 100% taking 26 minutes.Keep in Mind - Stock Charger and Cable are preferred for fastest charging times. The last 10% usually takes longer. In Summary I got 2 Days 3 Hours 22 Minutes of Battery from 100% to 1%. And it took 212 Minutes (about 3.5 Hours) to charge from 1% to 100%.Also if you're curious on my most heavily used Apps in battery consumption in order of most to least are: Google Services, Screen, Device Idle, Clash of Clans, Android OS, SleepBot, Voice Calls.There is one noticeable con and that is the delay in Battery response to the phone. So sometimes if playing a game you'll notice battery life dropping and then increasing spontaneously as it doesn't expect you to have such a large battery. Luckily it still reports fairly accurately (just delayed) but you will notice this on my Battery Screenshots.Ideal users - if you don't mind a thicker build and do Not want to carry any extra batteries with you for those emergencies, then this case is for you.Overall quite satisfied with this product for worry-free battery survival on a great device.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-19: Ok, let me start off by saying it's a great battery. It is however WAY TOO Slippery. I could easily drop the phone. I will try a few fixes. Sticky tape or sticky spray. I have not used it yet because of the slippery issue, except to test. Hard plastic and big (to be expected), but I could easily see a disaster coming if dropped.     2012-03-26: I purchased this pack for my husband who is an avid Ipad and Iphone user and he absolutely loves this stylus pack. The different sizes and colors make this a great choice for both devices and the eraser/bubble type head works smoothly across the screen without the need for any pressure to be applied while using. The writing ability is pretty sharp, but you're not going to get the feel of pinpoint precision with so much of the stylus surface touching the screen, however, it takes only a couple of minutes to get used to it.The short stylus is about an inch and a half long and has grooves in the stem to make the grip easier. It also has an attachment string that can be inserted into the headset hole for convenience. The longer stylus is a smooth metallic finish and can be slippery when writing. What would make these perfect, is if the longer stylus had some sort of grip to give it more of a pen feel. Other than that, the value simply cannot be beat and you don't have to worry about losing one since there's plenty to spare.

I brought them to a gathering with a few friends and everyone got the color (and style, small with the plug that goes into the headphone slot, or the larger type with the clip) that they wanted. As a bonus, you get a cleaning cloth (yes, it actually works!), and lanyards! The whole set comes well packaged in a resealable case. When I change my iPad mini (or iPhone 5) cases, I pick a stylus that matches the new case, and put the old one in the handy case (sliding the stylus right back into the wrapper that the new one came out of first!). Don't miss this deal!

    2013-03-05: First of all, I have purchased several times from this seller, "The Friendly Swede," and they are one of my favorite sellers.To be honest, I cannot hold on to my styluses. I am forever losing them around the house because if I am not on my smartphone, my Kindle Paperwhite my Kindle Fire 2, I am probably on my Kindle Fire Tablet and every one of these uses a stylus (yes I DO know about using your fingers, but I feel I have more accuracy using a stylus. Eventually they sometimes find their way back to me (if no one else swipes them first!I had been buying one or two stylus here and there, but I eventually was down to my last one. This is a really nice collection of 18 different color stylus and they are as colorful as the pictures. They have a nice solid feel, unlike so many that I have purchased. Believe me, some just feel "cheap"but these feel more substancial and the rubber on the ones that I have used, works well. Best of all I have paid more for 2 or 3 stylus than I paid for all EIGHTEEN of these. As an added bonus, Included are detachable "Tether Strings/Lanyards," which attach one end to a small hole at the very top of the stylus and on the other end is a plug that you can plug into the earphone jack (it is not permanent) and you can remove it from the jack whenever you need it. Also included is a Microfiber cloth to keep your touch screen clean and they arrive packaged in a zip closed pouch to keep them all together. I have sure that if you have any problem and contact "The Friendly Swede (love that name), they will give you 100% satisfaction.I will be in hospital next week for knee replacement surgery followed by a longer stay in a orthopedic inpatient rehab for a few weeks, so with this package I will have all the stylus I need and the tethers might keep the stylus off of the floor.I would recommend this set. The price is great AND if you have Amazon Prime you get FREE 2 day shipping!

    2012-08-15: Nothing phenomenal but the price! My pup chewed up 3 $15 stylus' so far. I went on a search and started to wonder why I paid $15 for one when I found these. Now that I have them - here's the dirt:Let's see - they're short. This means it barely fits in my hand and you should really hold the stylus upright because the metal around the edge of the tip will scratch or won't allow the movement to occur.Another - they're short. So the clip on one end jams into the hand at times. And that clip - I'm not sure about other devices but anyone with a kindle fire, inside a "book" sleeve, knows that clip is worthless. There is no room for anything thinner than a piece of paper.The tips are soft and seem to work fine as long as I hold the pen as noted above.$15 ones are longer, stronger metal, they had a tie and "ball" ornament on the end so the clip wasn't an issue and I did prefer the tip on those....but the taste was phenomenal and the pup really enjoyed them!The pros of this one: They serve the purpose and - 0 yeah --- Taste doesn't matter to the pup so the price is phenomenal for 9 in a pack!

    2013-01-19: I decided to give these styli a try even though I thought the price was just a bit too good to be true AND because they're shipped under Amazon's Prime so I'd get them fast. Oh, and the many positive reviews helped too! I was a little worried about the rubber tip because the last rubber tipped styli I bought a long time ago stuttered rather than glided across the screen and were just irritating to use. When these 4 1/2 inch (& the itty bitty) styli arrived and I used one for the first time, I was really surprised at how well they work! They work JUST as well as some of the more (MUCH more) expensive styli I've purchased in the past. Unlike those other rubber tipped styli I bought a long time ago, these actually glide quite nicely on my " i " device screens and on screen covers as well. The tiny styli have a plastic plug so that you can plug it into your headphone jack so it's always handy. That'll work for some folks and won't work for others.The one admission I should make is that I really wanted to buy from another seller that sold the 4 1/2" styli for a WHOLE LOT LESS. The only problem was that they shipped from Hong Kong. So I ordered these "Prime" styli so I could get them quickly and also ordered 2 packs from Hong Kong. I needed to have a BUNCH of them because I lose little items like these quick, fast, and in a hurry!

    $B004JPD8ZG

    2012-12-08: The device is exactly what I was looking for. I was able to connect the devices and my phone charger that I needed to. the only issue is the static it creates to the FM radio. Seller extremely helpful and replaced device and would even allow a return. The replacement has the same issue.     Rating: 4

    2011-06-05: I got a replacement shipped to me and it works well. I obviously got a bad unit the first time.*UPDATE* This item worked for approximately one week! Only had a single Motorola cell phone charger (that I've been using in various outlets for two+ years with no issue) plugged in to the unit and the socket extender was plugged into a fused 12V "power plug" (NOT a cigarette lighter like on older vehicles) and out of the blue the thing just died. All of the lights went off and NOTHING. I attempted to plug it in to other receptacles (my vehicle has 3 stock) as well as other vehicles....NOTHING. Was a neat little product...for a week. Now I'm using one I paid half as much for at the dollar store! COME ON! :( Garbage. Also, the USB port on my was "ify" at best....when the device worked at all!This product arrived ahead of schedule, well-packaged, and ready to go! I have a number of accessories that I use frequently and this was an add-on to a previously purchased, lower quality socket extender...multiple smart phones, battery chargers, interior lighting, mp3 player, spotlight, heating blanket....Great addition to the road trip ride!PROS: Low profile socket with no lights fits snugly in every socket I have inserted it in360 degree rotation for ease of access to either switches or plugsAbility to easily turn off individual socketsIndividual LED (blue off/red on) indicator lights (and they ALL work, despite some reviews...no LED's are "shared")CONS: Mounting bracket is somewhat flimsy but works well if you aren't too rough on it3M mounting tape, though decent, is still barely adequate unless you're mounting it on glass or the worlds smoothest interior trimNot buying this one prior to the "cheaper" (yet more expensive) socket extender!!!All in all, great product...exactly as advertised...and I assure you, I've tested it to it's limit...and contrary to popular warnings, the low amp draw on the charging system will NOT drain your batter (my car sat for two weeks with both socket extenders connected and lit). If this kills your battery, you need a new battery!

    Rating: 4

    2014-03-10: I use this in my work van due to having a ton of devices to charge and only two 12V ports.It's a nice feature that you can turn each of the four 12V ports off individually, although I do not have a use for that. The rings light red when a switch is on and blue when a switch is off ( I though that would have been the opposite but no big deal).The USB port is only a 800mA port, so I would not recommend charging you phone with it, I use it to charge my bluetooth headset and have no issues what so ever.The sticky pad that comes with it is amazing! It was about 20 degrees out when I stuck this to the metal cabinet inside my van and have had NO issues with it falling off or anything.The biggest complaint I have with this is the power cord is not very long, another foot or so would have been alot better. The cord is a little under 2 feet.

    2011-07-31: I was looking for a 12 volt power strip with USB and and on and off switch. I was glad to find this one which has on and off for each item.     Rating: 4

    2012-07-02: This power splitter has a feature that most do not and it's a feature that's very useful for many vehicles whose 12v socket does not automatically turn off when the vehicle ignition is off: on/off switches for each of the sockets.So, for example, if you have a radar detector and a GPS that you want to turn on/off quickly when the car is on/off, you can use the on/off buttons on this device instead of slowly turning on/off the GPS and then slowly turning on/off the radar detector.It's worked perfectly thus far so no complaints.

    Rating: 5

    2011-10-30: I purchased this when my father-in-law's health was rapidly declining as it required my family to make many long, 14-hour cross country trips in a rather short period of time. That's a lot of driving, especially with a 6-year-old. My Kia Sedona only has two outlets, and that simply isn't enough when you've got a portable DVD player, several iPods, iPhone 4, Nexus, iPad and all their accessories that inevitably need charging on such a long trip. This 4-way extender was a life saver. We had previously been using a power converter that had 4 standard outlets but it was so noisy and the adapters couldn't all fit in it at the same time. The plug eventually broke into pieces and we needed a replacement before our next trip.I was wary given the low price of this extender, but it was one of the best purchases I've ever made on Amazon. It's completely quiet, of course, and significantly cheaper than the converter type extenders. The materials feel a little cheap but it has lasted several 28+ hour journeys with constant use and no issues whatsoever. My only complaints, and they are minor, are that the LED indicators that let you know if a port is on or off seem to have their colors backwards. I would automatically assume that RED means OFF and BLUE means ON. It's actually the opposite and that was a little puzzling at first since your only indication of whether or not a port is on is the LED. Also, I wish there was a less permanent way to mount it. I know with some modification I could make a velcro mount but I really don't want to be sticking any kind of adhesive on my interior. It would be nice if there was an adjustable clip that could be attached to a console or something. This probably won't be an issue for most people as I would imagine most of their traveling would be done in one vehicle, but with business trips and car rentals and such, it would be nice for a more user-friendly option for mounting in several vehicles. Without mounting, the unit has very little weight to it and doesn't stay put with several cords plugged in from different directions.Overall, though, I think it's a very good buy for the price. I spent a lot of time researching similar products to find a solution and I'm glad I chose this one. You will be hard pressed to find this many ports in a quality unit like this.

    Rating: 4

    2013-04-03: I've used other car sockets but this is a first for me. I've never seen one with buttons that light up! How fancy!It looks nice and it doesn't clutter my usb cables everywhere. I love it! I recommend it to anyone looking for a good car socket.

    Rating: 5

    2012-11-01: The 3m Tape mounts this piece like it should. VERY secure even in the summer heat. The ability to turn on/off the individual plugs is nice as is the USB port.     2013-12-11: Like a lot of things in life, phone cases are a compromise. Build it tank tough and it won't fit in your pocket, too weak then what is the point. I had a Samsung Infuse and when it died I moved on to the S4 (which I really love). My Infuse had a Ballistic case which offered a lot of protection, but so much it interfered with the functionality and ergonomics. This case is pretty close to striking the balance I want. First a little about me, I take care of stuff because I am cheap I guess, but I also take my stuff in some pretty bad places. This phone will be with me when I am cutting firewood or under the house fixing a leak in the water supply. My Infuse died when a Camelbak leaked on it in my backpack while mountain biking, so I need something a little more than a case to protect it while in the boardroom. This case is a little overkill for that but maybe just a tad shy for mountain biking. I wish the rubber bumpers were just a little thicker and more cushioned. The buttons work OK through the case, a little stiff but I like that. It allows access to the entire screen which is a plus, something the Ballistic + Infuse did not. I plan to keep it and throw it in a ziplock bag when it may be exposed to abuse. I got the white for my son and the yellow for me, both look great and very well made.

    Rating: 4

    2014-01-29: This case was so hard to remove from the phone, I returned it. If you have to struggle that much, you risk dropping or flexing the phone. It was horrible. I liked the look, and it was sleek, and seemed to be carefully designed. I'd say it offered moderate protection, maybe. If you put a case on the phone and don't take it off, you might be okay, but I change cases all the time for different looks, and change batteries sometimes too. Way too much trouble for me.

    2013-07-13: This is by far the best case I ever brought for a cell phone. Very slim an looks great. I love it.

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-28: super durable. i am super clumsy and always dropping things. This helps protect my galaxy s4 and doesnt make it SUPER bulky like other cases.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-10: I ordered two of these cases (Matte Black and Kayak Yellow) after seeing them at a local retailer. I was looking for something that was protective and with some grip as most other cases I have used on the phone have been very slippery. After having the case on my phone for a few days, these are my pros and cons:Pros:1. The case seems like it would protect the phone very well. I am careful with my phones, but accidents happen and I think this case will protect it well for my needs. The rubber bumpers on the corners are a nice touch.2. The case is slightly grippy, but not as much as I had hoped. The 'rubber' on the sides helps a lot and overall the case is much easier to hang on to than most others I've tried. There is a fine line between grippy enough and too grippy. Not enough and it is slippery - too much and you cannot get the phone in and out of your pocket easily. So far, this case seems like a good combination.3. The case has a high bezel around the front of the phone to protect the screen if it lands or is set on its face.4. The case fits my Galaxy S4 well and all of the ports are accessible.Cons:1. Could be a little grippier, but it's a fine line.2. The case makes the phone significantly bigger, especially in width and thickness.3. The phone in this case will not fit in my iOttie One-touch car mount. I will have to order the XL iOttie.Overall, this is a good case that fits my needs.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-18: the case is real sturdy I know it will protect my phone. And Regarding the other posts about it being hrd to put on or take off you just have to know how to do it lol. I have at least 50 or 60 cases for all different phones I bought in the past so I've become an expert.getting to the case its one of the better cases I've purchased in awhile and I highly recommend buying it if you want good protection for you expensive phone.

The case should be made with these slits in place.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-21: This is a design departure from the usual format of chargers that plug right into the outlet. While those have the benefit of small size and being fully self-contained, they totally take over the outlet! I can sort of live with that in the kitchen since the outlets are above the counter, but my office outlets are near the floor, making it a mess of cables and devices when using the charger.This design uses a cord to plug into the outlet so I can keep the charger on my desk and not have to deal with a mass of cords and devices on the floor. The case is nicely styled with rounded edges. I have the white version, and it looks nice on my desk - blends right in without shouting "I'm a charger!".It measures about 4.25 inches wide at the widest point and is about 3.75 inches deep. The power cord plug into the back. The end that plugs into the outlet is just a regular plug without any type of wall wart. That's a huge plus for me since my power strips don't have room for another block-sized transformer.The 4 USB ports are on the front. Two are 2A; two are 1A. The port labels are easy to read (black on white).The build quality appears to be pretty good. The ports are well anchored and didn't move at all when I stressed the cords. There’s a light that indicates the charger has power.I used it to charge a variety of devices. Totally uneventful, which is what I look for in a charger.The only downside is that the charger is not as portable as those that plug right into the outlet since you need to carry the power cord along with the charger. But, the ability to keep it on my desk more than makes up for that. This will be my stay at home charger.Well worth considering if you’re looking for a multi-port charger that can sit on your desk and not have to deal with a wall wart.[Sample provided for review]

    Rating: 5

    2014-05-16: The box is very lightweight, making it useful for travel; two of the ports deliver 2 A and two of them deliver 1 A, which is all I need for phone, tablet, an earpiece, and a guest phone.This might be obvious to many people, especially if you paid attention in grade 6 science class, but I had to figure it out with some research and reading: I had assumed that all USB power sources were the same. Not so. Until I bought this I had been charging my tablet with a power source that came bundled with a Bluetooth earpiece, and I couldn't figure out why it took 12 hours or more to charge the tablet. It turns out there are several different power capacity levels for USB chargers; the earpiece power source only provided 0.5 amps (0.5 A), but once I plugged my tablet into the 2 A port on this unit, it charges in a reasonable amount of time (a few hours). Unlike voltage, electric devices draw the amperage they need from the source, right, so it doesn't matter if you plug a tiny earpiece into a 2 A-rated socket, it'll just use as much as it needs. But if you plug in a device that could use more amps into a wimpy source, it can't get its maximum and will take longer to charge. Voltage through USB is not an issue because that, at least, seems to be standardized.The other thing I learned the hard way is that there are USB cables that are designed only to charge a device, and they cannot carry data. I would think these would be clearly marked as "for charging only," but they're not. So the USB cable you use to connect to your computer can charge the device, but the USB cable sold with charging equipment might or might not allow you to connect the device to your computer.The only tiny complaint I have about this device is that the blue LED that indicates it is plugged in is very *bright*. I positioned it under the side of my bed, and with the lights out the blue glow makes my bed look like a customized low-rider. I fixed this small issue by dimming the light by placing a sticky note over it.

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-26: While the 1st unit did not work on my Note 3 (full AMPS) which is why I order as I have the lower AMP ones. The vendor not only sent an email, they made everything right and follow thru was EXCELLENT. This 2nd one works as listed. so I am not sure if one of the cables I used was the issue or not as I do not recall which cable I uses, I thought it was the Amazon one I ordered, in amy case, 5 stars for Customer service always wins over product for me. IMHO, I rather have a sub-par, if i had to pick, item and Excellent support vs a so-so item and less than sterling support.

    Rating: 1

    2014-05-16: I just needed to be able to charge multiple devices at my nightstand. This works great for that purpose. Very pleased with the transaction.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-23: Last week, my mom and I did a road trip over three days, from WA to AZ. Over hundreds of miles of monotony, two things were a necessity to keep me entertained, and us not on each others' nerves while my mom was driving: my iPad, and a good enough car charger to keep it functioning.The iPad drains fairly quickly while using it actively and the screen brightness is turned up reading, playing games etc. I have a number of old car chargers that I have tried, that show "not charging," or only have one port. With the multitudinous devices that are a part of modern life, two ports are a must. I don't like having to sacrifice my iPad if it needs charging, just because my or someone else's phone is running low on juice.This charger stands out amongst the many offerings on the market, as it provides 4.2A for the two ports (2.1A per port). Many dual port car chargers only provide 2.1A shared, which may be enough for one tablet, or one possibly two smartphones. Tablets such as the iPad 1, 2 and 3 use 2.1A by themselves. Smartphones vary, but use around 1A. Add those current demands together, and you have a total that the Mpow can handle but many car chargers can't. With an under-powered car charger, devices would charge, but slowly due to the lack of current. They may even discharge, hence the "not charging" message that Apple users will be so familiar with, which would mean that the devices are charging at a snail's pace.I had my iPad 4 plugged in to this Mpow car charger, as well as an iPhone 5, and both charged with no "not charging" messages. I also tried my mom's iPad 2, plugged in while my iPad 4 was plugged in. Both charged simultaneously. The newer iPads, the 4 and Air, use 2.4A optimally; the Apple AC wall adapter is 12W. Power is current x voltage, so the stock wall charger is 12W at 2.4A and 5V. Newer iPad hardware, thus, should charge faster theoretically with a current of 2.4A vs. the maximum 2.1A provided by each port of this Mpow car charger. However, keeping all variables constant, and comparing charge times from the 12W wall adapter to this car charger, I have so far found the charge rate difference to be minimal. Bottom line, the Mpow car charger can charge two iPads at once, and does so at a similar rate to your wall adapter.The Mpow charger has a blue light to show it is plugged in properly and providing current. It isn't obnoxiously bright. It's also quite slim, in spite of the power it cranks it.The head that the USBs plug into is not bulky, and it doesn't stick out of the 12V connection a lot. When I took it with me to put in another vehicle, it easily slipped into my bag. I MUCH prefer car chargers without the built-in cables, giving me the choice of what I plug in. They also take up less room when put away in the glove box or compartment, and not in use.My one annoyance is that this charger could have a tighter fit in the 12V. It does come out too easily, if your cords are too short and you tug a cord taut. A few times, I grabbed the iPhone with the short stock Lightning cable (3 feet), and the entire car charger popped out. I solved this by adding the USB extensions I had, lengthening the cables. If you DON'T like having long cables plugged into your car charger, you may have to put up with your short cables causing this charger to pop out a lot when you pick up your devices. When pulling a cable out of the car charger connection, you'll also have to put a little pressure on the Mpow so it wouldn't come loose, too. I've had other car chargers pop loose, but this Mpow one does seem to have it happen more easily than other models I have used.

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-31: Excellent charger, provides the output that was promised. The charger is light, but seems to get the job done. On par with Anker charger.

    Rating: 5

    2014-07-03: When I received this as a review sample I thought it was a novelty and not a real charger because of the size: it measures a Lilliputian 2 inhes long (exclusive or the spring leaded contact point), and protrudes less than an inch when it's plugged into a socket.What I love, though, is it is fast. I tested it with a Galaxy Note 3 in the 1 Amp port and a Tab 3 10.1 tablet in the 2.4 Amp port and both charged as fast as the high speed charger I normally use in my car.I also tried charging with the devices switched in the ports, with the tablet in the 1 Amp and the phone in the 2.4 Amp. They both Charged simultaneously. I should note that when I test my phone I do so with music streaming and GPS turned on. Some chargers actually cannot keep up with the discharge rate during that test. This one did.The reason why I awarded this five stars is the integrated protection that will s*** down charging if it detects voltage issues (high or low), and when your device is fully charged. More and more chargers are showing up with those features, but not as small as this or in this price range. That I know about, anyway.

    Rating: 5

    2014-06-03: I'm using it for Galaxy S3 + Note 2 and it seems to charging pretty good simultaneously.Blue power indicator light is very dim and can't see it during the day. (but I don't mind as too bright during the night can be bad)I've used for a month and hopefully lasts longer.

    2014-03-20: Thought this was going to be good but it didn't work. Light is on but would not charge my phones, note 2, or S3. I later read another review who stated the light was on but would not charge also.

    Rating: 1

    2014-01-28: Arrived in a nicely packaged box with a front display showing the actual charger. Taking it out of the box revealed a very compact dual car charger, about 3.5" in length and almost 1" across usb port side. When I say compact, I mean it was a size of a regular single port charger, while they were actually able to squeeze two in there. Another good point about compact size is that it won't take too much room in cigarette outlet and won't interfere with anything next to it. Once plugged into the outlet, it has a nice soft blue light to indicate the power is on and also to guide the connection in the dark. I do have to note that usb connection itself is a bit on a tight side which is actually good to hold the cable without falling out. But at the same time pulling on the cable will actually remove the charger itself unless you hold it down with your hand.The most important test is if it can actually deliver 2 amps per port. A lot of the chargers claim they do, but it only works when one port is plugged in. In this case, I was able to confirm charging my Note 2 at max speed (the same reading I get from my original 2A Samsung wall charger), and I was able to do that while also charging Nexus 7 (HD, 2013 edition) which charges at 1.5A. Although I don't have two Note 2 to verify full 4.2A dual charging capacity, I have a feeling that won't be a problem.Overall, I found this dual usb car charger to have great performance, solid build, and delivering it's advertised charging capacity without a problem. Covered by 18-months warranty and currently on Amazon for $6.99 (down from original $9.99, need to use code MPOW01CA at checkout) - this is one fantastic value!

    Rating: 5
