    2014-03-02: The Mpow 6 Amp 4-port wall charger is a powerful wall charger that can charge up to 4 devices at once.Pros:-2 USB ports that have an output of 2 amps/ 5 volts-2 USB ports that have an output of 1 amp/ 5 volts-Power cable that runs from the wall outlet to the 4 port charger-Easy to read labeled USB ports-Excellent price-Can charge 2 iPads (iPad Air and iPad 2) and 2 smartphones (iPhone 5 and Galaxy S4 at full speed)Cons:-Annoying blue LED that could light up a dark room at night-Charger is rather large-Not UL listedThis is a great wall charger and I recommend it.I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest.

    Rating: 5

    2013-03-16: This case gives my daughters iPod Touch good protection and some texture for holding onto when she's using it. It consists of two pieces, a hard plastic interior case and and soft rubber outer case. It's very similar in design and feel to my own Defender iPhone case, which uses the same two piece design. There is a built in plastic screen protector on the interior hard case, so there's no need to use a separate one to prevent scratches. All the buttons are well defined on the rubber outer case, so volume, power and the home buttons are all still easily pressed. The thick rubber outer case helps protect against bumps and falls, and makes holding the iPod easier by giving it some texture. Very protective and not nearly as pricey as a Defender, this Griffin Survivor has been the best iPod cases we've had for my daughter's iPod touch. It works great!

    Rating: 5

    2013-07-12: I Love The Case! I usually change cases about every month but I believe I will keep this one for a while!

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-08: This is a great case! The only thing I don't like is having to hold open the flap for the camera because I take tons of pics but that just means it was more protected!

    Rating: 5

    2012-12-29: I drop my iphone constantly and thanks to this cover I have never had any issues. I protects it from the weather too. The only thing that got through was my sons drool (don't let your kid suck on your phone for five minutes, and that solves the problem). But this case fits the phone perfectly, and I love that it comes with a cover over the screen and the touch screen still works great.The only negative, and everyone says it, is the camera. I always turn my flash off and the pictures look pretty good. If I turn the flash on, it reflects off the cover and the picture is white and blurry. Yes, you also need two hands to take pictures (you need the extra hand to hold the rubber cover back, it does NOT stay uncovered on its own). Worst case scenario you rip the case off if you need to take a good picture with the flash, it's not too big a deal considering the protection you get with this case.By far more protective than any otter box, if you really care about your iphone and don't mind a bulky case, do it! I get compliments on mine all the time.(oh one more complaint, the rubber sticks to my hair while I'm on the phone and literally rips hair out of my head when I pull it away from my ear. it's frigging annoying, but again, still worth it).

    Rating: 5

    2012-06-18: Pros: Durable/tough, good quality & nice looking.Cons: Bulky(even more so than my otterbox), proximity sensor does not work with the white iPhone- the entire top part of the speaker/camera/prox sensor protector must be cut out. I used a razor blade and cut it right out & my front cam & prox sensor works perfectly now, however that does defeat the purpose of it being "rainproof". The camera flap is annoying to say the least. After only one day I cut it off and can't even tell there was one there, still looks just as good. The only big CON is the flash issue.... When using flash it makes photo whitish, distorted and blurry. I am thinking that maybe there is a fix, perhaps painting/coloring it to keep it from causing a glare? Either way, most of my cons were fixable... Then again I shouldn't have had to cut on my case to make it usable. So in a nutshell, I like the case but not as much as I thought I would. Oh, and I had the same problem with my otterbox and my proximity sensor so it is not a case defect, it's something to do with the WHITE iPhone.

    Rating: 5

    2012-07-18: I've been contemplating on getting this case for about a week or so. I usually use OB defenders. I was browsing around on Amazon, and came across this "warehouse deal" for the Survivor for $17 plus $5 and change for shipping & in the comments it said that it is in original packaging marked as 'used-like new condition.' Still the same 30 day return policy applied, so i fig'd why not? I rec'd the item within 2 days, ordered it Sunday & had it by Tues afternoon. The item was in the original packaging sealed - it doesnt even look like anyone had this item previously & returned it. (btw if you purch this case at full price its anywhere from $40-$50.)Anyway, this is a very rugged case - it feels better than the defenders IMO. I think its about the same size, maybe a teeny bit bigger but not by much at all. ALL ports on this case have a little door flap to close them off, and in addition to that - the built-in screen protector also covers not just the screen, but the ear piece that you hear through as well. So far i've taken a couple of calls & it doesnt interfere with the sound or proximity sensor on the 4S. All ports are easily accessible - the only one that is kinda bugging me right now is the flap that covers the camera. I've heard of alot of people just cut that one off, but i dont think i'll do that myself. It protects the lens of the camera & i dont use my camera excessively. As for the belt clip that comes with it - i never use them so i can't comment on that. I can say just looking at it, that it seems kinda flimsy - in this aspect i'd say OB does their belt clip for the defender better.Overall, right now i feel this case is better protection than the OB defender is & i really like it - especially the pink/white!! I would definately recommend this case to someone looking for great protection. Hopefully it holds up just as good as it looks :)

    2013-12-19: I usually stay away from battery cases for the simple fact that they add to much weight and thickness to your iPhone, and they will usually cost upwards of $80. This is what makes Anker's efforts pretty amazing! For $40 they were able to make a case that is relatively slim, packed with a huge 2400mAh battery, and being MFI approved. With a fully charged case I can usually get about one and a half charges out of it, which has already came in handy a couple of times. The overall feel and build quality of the case is really impressive, and the installation and removal is simple and straight forward.There are a couple things that I think Anker could fix to make this the ultimate iPhone 5 battery case. First one being that the back of the case is just to slippery, I constantly have to worry about the phone slipping out of my hand when in use. The second problem I found was that the quality of stand was lacking, every time I would wrap my hand around the phone I could feel the stand shifting around, which took away from that overall quality feel that the case has. Other than those two things, this case has impressed me, and I have no hesitation recommending it to anyone looking for a good looking, great performing battery case at an amazing price.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-06: I actually have two issues with this product :1. What I received did not match the product in the listing.2. It's almost impossible to use the speakerphone or play music while attached to the Anker.Let me make it absolutely clear : I love Anker products and I have purchased several of them from Amazon. That's the reason I ordered this over any other competing product in the marketplace. What I received will make me pause to think twice before I blindly order again in the future.I do not know if the fault lies at the feet of Amazon, or Anker. Truly, in all descriptions and even the video reviews there is a rudimentary stand on the back, but not so on the one I received. There is no stand at all. I don't know if Amazon lumped a bunch of old reviews in with a revised product, or if Anker revised the unit and just didn't think to update the page on Amazon. All I know is what I received DID NOT match what was represented. That, to me, is very close to bait 'n' switch.Even so, that did not stop the unit from doing what it purports to do - recharge the iPhone. In this one thing the Anker does exactly what it was purported to do. I do not think it made the iPhone too big, cumbersome or bulky. I am super impressed that you can sync AND charge with the included... what is this cable? USB mini? USB micro? Whatever they call it, my only beef with it is the fact it is way, way too short.Also, I found almost immediately that I missed my belt holster. That's a personal problem, but it would be nice if there were an option to buy a belt clip for the Anker. Just saying.The fatal flaw was the sound. I am sure the engineers and designers thought they had it nailed when they drilled holes in the case that appeared to line up with the holes in the iPhone. I am going to go out on a limb and say they didn't actually slap the final product on an actual iPhone and try to use it to play music, or make a speakerphone call. Nothing, but nothing I have run into will make your iPhone sound more cheap, crappy and tinny than attaching this Anker battery to it.Call it a hum, rattle, vibration... call it what you will, but the end result is it appears almost none of the sound energy is being directed out of the holes in the Anker case. Rather, it feels like the sound is trying to fire out of the bottom (power button side) of the Anker. You can even get the Anker to vibrate across your desk if you put the volume on high. The tinny, cheap sound was quite a shock. So if I am forced to choose between the natural sound of the iPhone, and the craptacular sound of an iPhone in an Anker... I end up wishing I had just purchased an external battery.So there is the let-down. Everything to this point I had purchased with the Anker name on it had oozed quality. Not so with the Anker battery case. Between the difference in product arriving at my door, and the really lousy sound, it forever shattered my expectations of Anker products. That's the bottom line.

    Rating: 3

The headphone jack really should've been made larger instead of just providing an adapter to make things fit. It's also not that big, definitely bulkier than a normal case but it's not so bad.

    2013-12-30: This is my 1st and only extended battery case I have used, tested, reviewed for the iPhone 5/s and my results were actually very pleasing. I have a few complaints, but nothing too significant that would warrant you to NOT buy the case.-----------CHARGING-----------Charges battery fast, gives roughly 50% more battery life. Great build quality and sleek looks match iPhone design. Very well made case overall. The first time I tested the Anker case, I was listening to music via the native Music App on the iPhone and my iPhone was at 60% charge. Roughly 20 minutes later, while still listening to music, it was at 84%. Roughly 45 minutes into my charging, while still listening to music, my iPhone 5 hit 100%. This was pretty impressive to me, especially since I always listen to music.The second time around, I was NOT listening to any music and I just let my phone charge. I started charging my iPhone 5 at 20%. 30 minutes into my charging, my iPhone was at 62%. 15 minutes later, at 88% charging, the Anker case needed to be re-charged. The results were actually very impressive to me as I did testing while listening to music and while not. I was pleased to say the least with the battery life, the amount of time it took to charge (especially while listening to music).----------FEATURES----------Case comes with 2 different colored bezels to secure the phone to the case, black and a transparent-ish/clear. Useful kickstand to keep the phone in landscape mode to watch movies, listen to music, etc. Included 3.5mm audio extension cable is a must if you use the case and want to listen to music, glad they included it. USB charging cable.---------------COLOR OPTIONS---------------While the case charges quickly, is sleek and overall a good design, the lack of color choices to match the white/silver/gold iPhone 5/s can be a bit discouraging to buyers.----------------SLICK/SLIPPERY----------------Also, the case is slick/slippery and can slide out of your hand fairly easily if you aren't paying attention, but then again, the iPhone 5/s can with or without a case, so to me, that is a mute point.-----------WARRANTY-----------For those of you with concerns on how long the battery will live, the case comes with an 18-month warranty to help alleviate that concern which is typically 6-months more generous than most warranties.-----------PROS/CONS-----------PROS- Slimmest Battery Case I've Owned- Adds roughly 50% extra battery life- Multiple shells included- Kickstand- Sleek- Great Build Quality- Works with iPhone 5 and 5s- Charges Quickly- Case Re-Charges Quickly- At $49.99 this is a great deal- 18 month warrantyCONS- Although "slim" still adds bulk- Need more color choices, at least a white version- Case is slick------------DISCLOSURE------------I was supplied a sample for test and evaluation, and I promised that my review is fair and honest with no bias.

    Rating: 4

It doesn't add a significant amount of weight or thickness to the phone.     2014-02-13: At this price point, you really can't beat this battery case. It's very efficient, works as advertised, and has a nice design. One of the coolest features is that it essentially converts your lightning port into micro-USB for charging; it is nice to not need to buy a bunch of $20 lightning cables and just get cheap micro-USB cables instead!I generally got about a charge and a half out of the battery before it needed recharging on my iPhone 5. Call quality was NOT impacted by the microphone being somewhat covered up, though audio was a little bit less clear, but it was somewhat louder as well due to it echoing somewhat in the case before being sent out the front.As other reviewers have said, the stand is flimsy, however mine never broke or came loose like others'. Just be gentle with it and it'll serve its purpose well.My only real complaint is the LEDs on the back - they are WAY too bright in my opinion. If I was charging it on my nightstand and the lights were not covered up, the whole room would be lit up, which was annoying. I have a small nightstand and having to make sure the lights were covered was a bit of a pain.But, again, at this price point, it's really an awesome case, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone in the market for this type of product.

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-09: I was supplied an Anker 2400mAh MFI Certified Extended Battery Case for iPhone 5s (Black) for test and evaluation, and I promise that my review is fair and honest.Let me say one thing that before even testing this Battery Case for Iphone 5s, I was sure to give 5 stars. It looked very promising and exceptional product like other Anker products.Lets start with packaging and all the positive points first.Battery Case came in nice and easy to open box. Along with battery case itself, there was micro usb cable for charging, 2 case frames, audio jack extender, and user manual.Once i took the battery case out of the box, it felt very solid build material. It feels little heavy but it is meant to be heavy as it is a battery case not a normal easy to bend plastic or rubber case.The back material and texture is very soft, rubber feel and non-slippery. It grips well in my hands so there is very small chance of dropping my phone.I felt it is very well designed overall. The Iphone 5s fits perfectly in their and once either of the case frames is placed, the phone does not move at all. So its a perfect fit and perfect cuttings for volume buttons, on/off button, and camera/flash.On the bottom there is a opening for your headphone jack. You can insert your iphone headphone directly in their, but I will recommend using audio jack extender. Mainly because it is hard to pull out iphone headphones if placed directly in and might even damage your headphones in that process. So audio jack extender is a really helpful tool.On right side of the case is a micro usb port for charging the case and phone itself. I think which is a plus point.On back side is a power on/off button with four LEDs. Holding on to power button for couple seconds turns on the battery case. The LEDs will tell you how much power does the battery case is currently holding.I tested this battery case with iphone 5s after battery case was completely charged (all 4 LEDs were on). At this point my iphone 5s battery was at 10%. Once I turned on the battery case, it immediately started to charge the phone. With only little use, the phone battery was charged 100% very quickly and one of the LEDs on battery case was still on. Then I charged my phone again at 70% and it charged my Iphone upto 91% before the battery case died. I was very impressed by its charging ability. You can say it charged my iphone 5s once completely with doubling its life.One thing I would really like to see this case in more colors with more color options for case frames. This will give more choices for other users.After testing I can say this is definitely a useful battery case. Especially for people who use their phone a lot and usually drain the battery very easily and want to extend the phone battery life by charging it without cables. This case definitely deserves 5 stars. Very Happy with the product as it is worth the cost.

    Rating: 5

    2014-03-20: I got this battery case because it was such a great price.It does the job of recharging your iPhone when needed like other battery cases.But there are few negatives about the case so I can't give a 4 or 5 stars.The back of this product is very slippery!     Rating: 3

    2013-12-11: The Anker 2400mAh MFI Certified Extended Battery Case for the iPhone 5/5s is what I was expecting when I received it in the mail several days ago. Slim, sleek, attractive and easy to use. With this being said allow me to dive into this review.The Anker 2400mAh MFI Certified Extended Battery Case for the iPhone 5/5s dimensions are tailored to fit perfectly to your iPhone 5 and 5s, while the weight of the battery case is comparable to others on the market I think it may actually be a bit lighter than many of their competitors' offerings.The 2400mAh (Milliamp hour is a measurement of a battery's performance capabilities) rating is more than enough to give your device a full charge from a completely drained battery on your iPhone. In testing this battery I let my phone's battery dwindle to a 10% charge before turning on the Anker 2400mAh MFI Certified Extended Battery Case for the iPhone 5/5s. It took about 1 hour 40 minutes to give my iPhone 5 a full charge. For a completely drained iPhone battery I would suspect it will take about 2 - 2.5 hours to reach a full charge. (I want to note that during the charge cycle of my iPhone 5 from the Anker battery case I had Bluetooth turned on and in use, as well as WiFi. Charging times will vary significantly based on your usage and which background services you have running on your phone at the time of charging.)The Anker 2400mAh battery case itself is recharged via micro USB (cable is provided) and took approximately 2 hours to reach a near-full charge when charging from a 5v (1500 mA) rated wall outlet. However being this is still relatively new I am aware that it will take a few charging and discharging cycles to fully utilize the battery's maximum potential. So if your battery doesn't charge fully on the first few charging cycles, it's not unusual or broken, it just means your Anker Battery Case is completely normal. The LED indicator lights on the back of the battery case always let you know just how much juice you have left in your Anker Battery so you're never guessing.Using the Anker 2400mAh battery case isn't as intuitive as I had hoped for, however this isn't a problem it just means that I had to review the ever-competent instructions which Anker provides with all of their various products requiring them. Installation of your iPhone 5/5s into the Anker external battery case after reviewing the instructions is a simple process after that. One benefit to this case is that Anker provides you with both a clear shell and a smoke grey shell to wrap around your phone after you slide it into the battery case. Choices are great, nice added bonus, thanks Anker.There are drawbacks to the Anker 2400mAh MFI Certified Extended Battery Case for the iPhone 5, 5s, but these are not fatal flaws! One is the charging port, it's nice that Anker provide a micro USB cable to charge the battery case, but having another cable is like...well, having another cable. Two: The headphone port is REALLY buried up in the new case, but Anker have provided an extension cable (the proper one!) that you can plug your headphones into and use as you normally would, the cable even has 3 separate poles (left channel, right channel, microphone) so you're able to use the Apple earbuds that came with your iPhone for music and communicating. Three: The lock button on top of the iPhone is difficult to access (if your hands are big) due to being recessed in this new battery case. The lock button access is the biggest issue I encountered with this phone case, it's not a deal breaker, but it would be nice if Anker could address this in their next generation model of battery cases for the iPhone and add a rubber bumper or something to make using the lock button a little easier.Ideally the Anker 2400mAh MFI Certified Extended Battery Case for the iPhone 5/5s is for anyone who has an iPhone 5/5s and is looking for an alternative to portable batteries with their charging cables hanging off the phone, or carrying around a wall adapter charger and cable with you which leaves you always searching for the nearest outlet to plug into. The Anker 2400mAh MFI Certified Extended Battery Case for the iPhone 5/5s takes away these annoyances and is a self-contained charging unit that fits on the phone and is ready at a moment's notice. It's incredibly useful and I'm certain I will utilize it for quite some time to come. I forgot to mention that the battery case has a kickstand on the back so you can watch videos, or use Facetime handsfree! Very cool feature!Overall my impression of the Anker 2400mAh MFI Certified Extended Battery Case for the iPhone 5/5s is very favorable. I would recommend it to my friends, colleagues or anyone looking for a battery case for the iPhone 5/5s. You can't go wrong with this device and it may be the difference between getting that last text message of the night, or not. With this battery case you'll get that last text and phone call, and hours of surfing the Internet that you normally wouldn't without it. That is unless you camp out near the power outlets while you're out on the town. ;-)Overall Score 4 out of 5 stars:1. Function: 5 stars2. Design: 4 stars (Buttons are hard to access with fat fingers)3. Ease of Use/Installation: 4 stars4. Durability: 5 stars5. Price: 5 stars*I was provided a free sample from the good folks at Anker for a fair, unbiased and honest review.

    Rating: 4

    2014-03-28: i love it so muchh!!!! totally worth the money.This provides a full charge and a half for my iPhone 5. It is slim, easy to put on the phone and looks great. There is no way you can beat the value of this product at this price. Super happy with my purchase. I would definitely purchase other products from Eyecandis.you will thank me if you try it,

    Rating: 5

    2013-12-12: I am a fanatic for Anker products for reasons including product reliability, great customer service, and excellence in design. The new 2400mAh extended Battery case for the iPhone 5/5s certainly added to my loyalty to Anker. Anker has been able to manafacture a case that not only looks great from the outside but is also useful for any power user. I know, atleast for me, that I am always on the go and rarely have an outlet available - this makes having an extended battery life crucial for daily operation. With the new case, I am guaranteed that last phone call or that urgent text message to my boss. The new case really captures the essence of why Anker excels in the mobile market.I'd like to talk about the downfalls, but I will first recognize everything that has been done well.---First, the material that has been used on the outside is very smooth, It allows one to grasp his/her phone firmly while being nice to the touch. The smoothness compliments the iPhone's simple and elegant look.---The 4 lights and button on the back are clear indications of how much battery remains in the case. With the ease of simply pressing the power button, one gets a snapshot of the increment (25-100%) remaining. Quick and easy.---The addition of being MFI certified really comes in handy. The case simplifies the need for carrying multiple cables into only one. Having the ability to have a generic USB cable makes life much easier rather than always having to remember to have the lightning one available.---Last, the case comes with 2 outer edges (black and clear). Although I have a gold iPhone 5s, I found that the black outer edge suits the case better with a a more uniform look. Personally, I feel that the white contrasts too much with the already dark black case.Like anything, there are certainly areas where Anker could improve this product. A couple are listed below:---Probably the biggest problem for me is reaching over to the standby button on the device itself. With the attachment of this case, the button on the 5s is not as flush as it should be. Clearly, this can be inconvenient when you are in a rush to lock the device but is not a major fallback.---The case only comes in one color (black) currently making it mandatory for silver/gold owners to adapt to a dual-tone design rather than a sleek unified look which Apple aims for.---Lastly, the kickstand on the back is not very durable. It is glued on the back and easily prone to coming off. When it does come off, the case loses its look and one of the functions that is built in.Overall, the benefits and advantages outweigh the minor drawbacks that one experiences while using the new Anker MFI certified rechargeable case. It is evident that Anker has worked very hard in designing this case to perfection. There certainly areas in which Anker can focus its attention when releasing the next generation model. For now, this is my daily companion.UPDATE (4/9/2014):Anker recently sent me their "updated" version of this case for evaluation, and man am I blown away. Compared to the original iPhone charging case which was a killer piece of equipment, this new and improved Anker MFI Apple Battery Case is simply amazing. The case has a brand new finish on the back that is smooth on the touch and makes the iPhone much easier to hold. Anker got rid of the kickstand on the case which I do not mind at all since I barely had any of use of that to begin with. Lastly, the case has instilled buttons for standby and volume making it more comfortable to press and operate.Overall, great new revision to the product. If you haven't already bought the case, I'd certainly recommend it over other brands!Disclaimer: Anker provided me with a free test sample of this product for my honest feedback and evaluation.

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-28: I've been using the Griffin Survivor Case for several months and my overall impressions are quite good. The case is very durable and easily withstands everyday (and not so everyday) drops and bumps. The touch screen is very responsive and is an improvement over the iPhone 4 case. It attaches to the outside of the silicone cover. This makes it easy to remove and clean. The removable clip is more durable and has a better over all design then the previous model. On the downside, the case does make it hard to hear the speaker. The silicone cover does a nice job of absorbing shock, but it also tends to stick to your pants pocket when removing it. Also, aftermarket headphone plugs may not fit into the narrow access port designed in the plastic case.I use my iPhone 5 frequently in rugged situations in the wilderness. Despite a few shortcomings, this case more than meets my needs.Pros:1. touch screen is very responsive and easy to remove and clean2. case can take a beating3. case is relatively water resistant and keeps out most dirt and dustCons:1. case make the speaker a bit hard to hear2. silicone cover makes it hard to pull out of your pants pocket3. headphone jack requires a narrow shaft on the plug

    Rating: 5

    2012-12-11: This is a seriously protective case for the iPhone 5! Though, I would never put it to the test like Griffin does!The case consists of 4 parts:1. A plastic shell for the bottom and sides of the phone. This has holes for all ports, speaker, etc.2. A thick rubber cover that locks over the plastic shell and provides tight fitting covers for all ports, camera, etc. This covers the bottom, sides, and provides a raised ridge of rubber above the screen.3. A plasic screen cover that locks securely onto the rubber shell. This does include a screen protector.4. A clip on rotating belt clip. The clip pops open and locks in a position to provide a stable "landscape" stand to watch videos, etc. The belt clip also locks in the closed position if you wish to keep the jaws from opening and getting caught on your pocket when sliding it in, should you not want to clip it.This case is very substantial, once on the phone you cannot see the clean lines of your iPhone 5 any longer, but you know that the $800+ investment is quite protected from damage and the elements. I wouldn't call it water-proof, but I would say that it protects against small amounts of spillage and major dust.The only con I have found is the plastic screen protector is raised above the screen and it takes a bit to get used to what is needed for touch controls with it on, especially if you are used to using the phone without a cover or a screen protector. But once I got used to it, it hasn't been a problem.So far, no one has complained they can't hear me with this on, and I have had no problems hearing callers when using the phone in regular mode and with the speakerphone.I highly recommend this case to protect the investment in the iPhone 5. They don't call it the survivor for nothing!

    Rating: 5

    2013-05-10: Great phone, one of the best, if not the best I ever used! In the past, I owned BIG SCREEN PHONES as Galaxy Note (with 5.3" screen, too heavy and too big) and wanted something smaller that I could hold in one hand comfortably. Since I am a true techie, I researched this phone for all specs as soon as it was released on several websites. Since this phone has EXCEEDED all of my expectations, here is my very detailed review of this very special and fun to use Mini S3 phone. My goal in this review is to help in your buying decision one way or the other regarding this phone.Update 8/24/13 - Just received today, the newest firmware/OS for the 4.1.2 OTA (on my phone directly) as it was updated from Samsung and this is very new at this date of Monday, August 5, 2013 and arrived in my phone's Notification area today. After the upgrade completed, I noticed at once that this phone is lightning fast and the touchscreen is very, very fast and responsive! This is the THIRD update that I received since I purchased this phone in April 2013. Each update is not that large, however, it enhances the performance of this phone. Very encouraged as if the updates keep coming regularly, perhaps4.2.2 will be coming to the S3 Mini. And from my research, it is possible that the S3 Mini may receive the 4.2 OS but it will be a while longer...Till then, I shall keep on trying to update and keep you informed...PROS:- SIZE AND WEIGHT: Perfect size for me as it fits easily into my jeans pocket or smallest purse. And I purchased a leather vertical case that clips to my waistband so I take it with me to the gym to listen to my music or radio when I work out.- STANDARD SIZED SIM CARD: The S3 Mini has a standard Sim card slot (unlike the full sized S3 that has a micro Sim slot). Good to know as I did not have to cut my Sim card, I just placed it into the S3 Mini and I was good to go, and I did not have to set up the APN settings for Internet and MMS as the setup did this for me automatically). This is good to know if you want to use your regular Sim card and not have to deal with settings yourself. What a great feature.- Phone call clarity etc. - No matter what my location using this phone for phone calls the clarity of calls is loud and clear whether on the phone's speaker, headset etc. I even had to turn down the volume quite a lot as the calls come in so well.- WiFi/3G (Internet): Connects to any WiFi I have tried very quickly and easily and the signal strength is excellent even when I am far from my router. And when not near a WiFi hotspot, I use AT&T; for data and easily get 3G and found the data to be very fast, almost as fast as my home WiFi is. (For browser, I installed Opera Mini free from Playstore and found it to be a very easy to use and fast browser).- Overall speed, performance, smoothness, picture quality of the screen--very fast and peppy. And I found a way to SAVE on both memory and on battery. What I did was to go into Apps/ Manage Apps and DISABLED the apps I don't use. Without rooting the phone, you cannot uninstall pre-installed factory apps, but you can disable them. Disabling the ones you don't use makes the phone run faster and frees more memory! Since I am a techie, I know which ones to disable and which ones not to disable, so if in doubt, please ask me in the comments and I will be glad to assist you in this.- BATTERY LIFE: This phone has given me the BEST battery life of ANY smartphone or that I ever owned. And I use 100% brightness. For me, even at 100 brightness, if I use WiFi or Data just when I need it and then turn it off, I get all day into the night on one single charge! (I charge nightly and the phone is at 100% ready to go the next morning).- EXTERNAL SLOT FOR MICRO SD CARD - This helped to sell me on this phone as I can add my personal music, photos, videos and more to this phone!And I placed a 32g in mine for music, files etc. *Keep in mind where External SD cards are concerned: They are JUST for your personal files: music, videos, photos, and other files. When you install apps from Playstore or other sources, they store either in INTERNAL Memory Card or sometimes in the phone area (most store in the INTERNAL SD AREA). This is the law of the land where Android is concerned and ALL newer Android devices (including Samsung) work this way when storing your downloaded apps are concerned.- INTERNAL STORAGE SPACE:This phone is advertised at 8GB of Internal space. The 8GB is the space BEFORE the drive was formatted, OS installed and then factory apps installed. So what I had on the phone BEFORE I installed any apps it had 4.75GB left. This is how it is on any flash drive, SD card, Hard Drive as formatting alone takes up space.Also, since 3.0 Android and above, you cannot save any apps to your personal SD card. Instead the apps are installed one way or the other to the INTERNAL SPACE. However, the good thing is that your personal files as photos, music, videos, and more can be installed to your EXTERNAL SD Card so you do have that space for yourself.**I have a few apps I downloaded from the Playstore, but no games so I still have about 4.08 GB left on my phone for more apps later should I wish to install them.- Reading/Creating/Editing Word, Excel, Text Files and much more on this tablet: I downloaded a FREE APP called Kingsoft Office which I use for Office files (it reads, edits and creates Office files). And it also reads PDF eBooks so there is no need to download a separate PDF Reader app. *This is a MUST have if you have to read PDF or Word Docs etc, my docs are crisp and clear using this app.- CAMERA - The 5MP camera concerned me that is UNTIL I took both indoor and outdoor pictures and even video. Well, I was pleasantly surprised. When I printed out some close up and other shots, I was really happy with the detailing in the pictures. And it compared to the picture quality I had with my Samsung Galaxy Note with 8MP camera, so what a happy surprise! Turns out to be a pretty good camera.- Bluetooth Speed and Performance - The Bluetooth paired quickly with several devices and copied files at a great rate of speed.CONS:- Adobe Flash is not supported in this phone or ANY ANDROID DEVICE after 4.0 OS. The only way to get flash is to get a archived flash and use a high end browser such as Puffin or Maxthon Browser. So downloading the older archived flash gives the ability to view SOME internet videos, but this is better than no flash at all. Keep in mind this is a problem with ALL brands of Android devices with 4.0 OS and higher it is just after 4.0 Android came out, the NEW and best flash is NOT supported for Android devices. It is what it is...- Very small instruction "manual" provided with the tablet, however, I went to the Samsung site and downloaded the full manual and saved it in PDF on my laptop for reading anytime I need it. If you want the link for the manual, let you know in the comments and I will give it to you.- This phone will NOT accept an OTG (On the go) USB plug for flash drives, mice, etc. This was not a problem for me, I just plug in the USB Cable to copy files to the phone. So no big deal.-- International Phone so NO US WARRANTY. Not a problem for me because I have learned over time that if a device is going to fail, it usually does it within the first 30 days. This phone has been great--no problems at all!-- No NFC except on the model with the N on the model number. I do not use NFC so I have no problem with that.Bottom line: Would I buy this phone all over again? Yes I certainly would. Will this phone be the best for you? Yes, if you do not expect every bell and whistle feature from the BIG S3, want just the most important features, want a smaller and more lightweight phone that will do all the basic things of a Smartphone, then I totally recommend this phone!Hope this review has assisted you and thank you for reading it. Please feel free to ask me any questions in the comment area and I will answer all questions in a very timely manner.

    2014-03-13: Is this phone unlocked? Well it is but there are steps to take if you use Straight Talk otherwise you can't access mobile data.Straight Talk use AT&T; and T-Mobile carriers and you get to pick which when you buy get your sim card. If you travel I strongly suggest you get an AT&T; sim for your phone as T-Mobile is more often found in large metros such as SF, NY, etc..To change your VPN settings for Straight Talk visit http://smartphonematters.com/help/help-setting-up-straight-talk-data-and-mms-on-the-blu-tank-4-5-running-android-4-1/ to create a Straight Talk mobile network and set the values.It's a great little phone (at least from my experience since it arrived a few days ago) and for the price who could complain given the OS, apps and HUGE internal memory. The latter is a big problem with other phones as the internal memory is where most apps reside and that memory fills rapidly.Buy one. I don't regret it.

I bought this phone from Worldwide Distributors (very good) and the phone (Android 4.1.2) arrived earlier than the target delivery date. The phone has a French language manual (European model). Being familiar with Android phones and tablets, it was easier for me to browse through the settings and change the language setting in English (US). I have disabled the apps that I don't use and battery life is very satisfactory. I like the 4 inch screen and it's perfect for my hand. I bought the CIMO black case cover and the color blended perfectly with the pebble blue. The CIMO cover really surprised me and it fits perfectly on the phone.I would highly recommend this Samsung Galaxy SIII mini to those people who will use it primarily as a phone. In my case, I use the tablet/s for my internet browsing or other tasks related to it. Enjoy shopping at Amazon!

    2013-10-01: I purchased a phone that was advertised as new from Pacific Cellular and received a used phone. The phone arrived without a seal on the box, battery was not in a sealed wrapper and took too long to charge and discharged early. You could see that the phone had been previously handled, with fingerprints all over the back and front cover. Thank goodness for amazon, as their staff were very helpful in getting a full refund. I recommend avoiding The seller and choosing one whose products are "fulfilled by amazon". I did wind up reordering the same phone from Top10cell, fulfilled by amazon and the phone arrived within 3 business days. The phone arrived with 2 seals on the box, which clearly states to not accept if broken or missing. Inside, the blacking and contents were as they should be, battery in its sealed case and NO fingerprints all over the phone! The phone itself is very nice, this far it has been working quite well and seems to have a boatload of features for the price. So, in summary, thumbs up for the phone, an excellent buy, thumbs way up for seller Top10cell and amazon...thumbs way down for Pacific Cellular distributor, out of Idaho.

    2013-01-27: I've had this phone in hand for more than a week, with T-Mobile service for about a day now. It's fine so far.The phone is a lovely, sleek thing. I've handled its bigger brother, the Galaxy SIII, but that phone is just too big for me. I like the form and size of this one much better. I've been using an HTC Evo 4G phone for more than two years; this Galaxy S3 Mini is about the same size.This is a good phone with plenty of computing horsepower for me. The screen is beautiful and very responsive. In side-by-side comparison to my trusty old HTC Evo phone, this one blows the other one away. And the Galaxy S3 Mini has a slightly smaller screen! I'd wondered if I'd regret it for that reason but I absolutely do not. I don't even realize that the screen is smaller than my old phone, when I'm using this phone.One downside: I don't like the camera. It's laggy.By the way, my phone arrived with packaging in French, and set up with the French language on the phone. The seller included a plug adapter so the Euro style plug on the charger can be used here in the USA. It took a few seconds to get into the phone settings and choose US English as the phone language.PLEASE, people, don't complain if you get a "foreign" phone when you buy this phone unlocked. Because Samsung doesn't package this phone for sale for the US market. (Search for an article on Cnet called "Apple drops patent claim against Samsung Galaxy S3 Mini" from December 2012 for the background.) I found a user manual in English by going to Samsung's UK website (it won't be on Samsung's US website because Samsung doesn't sell or support this phone in the US). If you must have an unlocked phone tailored for US users right out of the box? Try buying an unlocked iPhone direct from Apple, or a Nexus 4 phone from Google (if the Nexus 4 is back in stock).

  • B0044IK8VU

    $B0044IK8VU

    2011-05-08: I bought this item after reading all reviews on Amazon.com. I am completely satisfied with the product and its delivery. New buyers just have to note that it takes a good amoune of care (and patience) to install this screen cover. If you hurry or bypass any of the steps mentioned in the instruction manual (that comes with the product case), then you are not gonna like what you get.So, take care, be patient and do exactly as mentioned in the instruction manual. If you want, you can also refer to the videos in Youtube that show you how to do the installation (I did the same). I was fortunate it came out without a single trapped dirt or bubble. Thats the beauty of a wet installation.One extra care may help (from my experience): Try installing in natural sunlight that diffuses through your windows (as against under a lamp). This way, you can catch and remove 99% of all dirt/lint from the phone.

    Rating: 5

    2014-04-11: I did not get a chance to use this product and have sold it already to someone else. I had sold my phone that uses it.

    Rating: 4

    2011-06-09: Pros:+No interference with touch screen+Less finger prints/streaks on screen+Protects entire screen including Home, Menu, Back, Search buttonsCons:-Soft screen protector-Any scratches, nicks, or finger nail marks are absorbed into screen and remainThis screen protector is a soft screen protector and is applied with a wet solution. It adheres to the screen nicely and causes no interference with the touch screen. The downside of being soft is that it absorbs scratches easily and they remain on the screen. Any scratches or nail marks that you can see on the protector are usually only visible at certain angles and are not really noticeable when you're using the phone in a normal fashion.The installation process is not difficult, you just have to make sure you read the directions a few times and follow them exactly. Also, when installing it is very nice that it does not stick to the screen right away; this allows the user to make sure it is on straight and can be corrected if not. Overall I'm happy that I have this screen protector considering Best Buy and AT&T;'s screen protectors are $15-$22. It does its job at protecting my screen, but it's not invisible which is why I gave it 4 stars.

    Rating: 4

    2011-05-25: I have owned this screen protector for about 3 weeks now and overall im not impressed at all, there are several fingernail marks left on the screen and they don't go away. I'm sticking with zagg invisible shield protectors from now on and i would not recommend buying this screen protector at all.

    2011-04-20: I bought this film not knowing that it's an involved process to apply to my phone. So i stuck it out and put it on. 24 hours after, i still had issues.     2013-05-20: thingDon't expect a lot of instructions on how to mount this thing. If you can't figure out what the middle piece is on the air vent mount, don't worry, you probably don't need it. Permanent dash mount when the surface is prepped with an alcohol swap sticks very easily and is going no where. My only complaint is that the carriage is small and difficult to squeeze my phone into. I probably could not do it with one hand. By small I mean the depth. My HTC One with a hybrid case was almost too thick for it. I switched to a hard case without the added rubber and it fits a little better now. The arm is very versatile and it could be placed in almost any position. Its not very long but thats why I like it.Edit- After having this product for a month I have concluded that the depth of the carriage is too short to properly grip my htc one with a case on it. The phone falls out whenever I try to go from portrait to landcape by twisting it. If I make it easier to twist, then it flops forward and the screen angles towards the floor. I need something perhaps a little sturdier with a ifferent design on how it grips the phone. I found this product not bad but disappointing.

    2013-12-17: I was impressed by Anker customer service. I posted a 3 star review on a 'kit' (2 batteries and charger for $20 on Amazon) as one battery was pretty bad but the other was good. Anker sent me a warranty battery (very nice of them). I was so impressed I ordered another single battery (this one) when I got the warranty battery in the mail. The warranty battery was great (and still is) but the single battery is terrible. Now that is has been a couple of weeks the single battery goes totally dead while the other battery is still over 50%. How can I test this? I have two IDENTICAL Galaxy S 4G (T959v) phones that are NOT being used at all. They have both been factory set and are on ONLY my WiFi.0 charge the pair up and then see how they last SITTING ON A SHELF UNUSED. The T959v might be a great phone, but the T-Mobile Firmware is terrible. I am hoping to root these phones but for now they are stock 2.36 T-Mobile. So the LOT# on the "good battery" is 05GP3F. BTW, I swapped phones to ensure the battery was the problem and not the phone, and the poor battery did just as bad in a totally different phone. Also of interest I bought a pair of Anker batteries for the phones I replaced the T959v phones with and while these phones are in use and DO NOT sit on the shelf, I try to compare them and the battery strength seems to be similar. NOT as good as it was. Not terrible, but it does not make it through the day or if it does it is down below 20%. If I am using the phone a fair amount (never playing music or videos) I will actually see the power drop. I use "Battery Solo" which I find is superb for android battery strength display.UPDATE 1-14-14 So I have done a complete reversal of this review (from 1 star to 5 stars). initially I found and wrote the above, as one of my first pair of batteries was a dud, so I assumed this one was too, but after really watching identical unused phones and doing the battery swap thing carefully (everything being labeled) I found one of the actual phones (both hard reset BTW) does eat up a battery markedly quicker. So Kudos to Anker, and I will buy from them whenever they have a compatible battery for a phone I need a battery for!The lot number on the "bad" battery is 05GP2E.

It fits, but only because the back cover of the S2 is flexible plastic, so I can still snap the edges shut. But you can feel it's thicker.     2012-11-27: I bought two Samsung Epic Touch 4G phones in late 2011 for my girlfriend and myself. After a year, both phones started to behave erratically with reboots, crashes and hangs. Of course, this is not a covered item in the warranty but I bought a replacement Samsung OEM battery and it did indeed help! I immediately attempted to place an order for another but Amazon stopped carrying the OEM battery!Enter the Anker replacement battery. The reviews for their external battery chargers are glowing so I decided to give it a shot. The only other item from Anker I own is a replacement power cord for a Sony laptop which was given to me. It works great, is lighter in weight than the OEM Sony charger and has not caused any problems. This battery fits perfectly in the Epic Touch 4G, charges at around the same rate, and seems to provide enough juice so the phone doesn't crash, hang, or otherwise act crazy. This battery is also a little more than half of what I paid for the OEM Samsung, so a great deal. If it acts up in a shorter period of time than a year, then I will revisit this review, but I expect this battery to last until we trade our phones in for better models... Maybe a Samsung Galaxy S5?This item seemed to come from "LaptopMate" but was shipped in the amazon box along with the other things I bought on the same order as the ordering process signifies.     2013-08-05: I've had this battery for about 2 weeks now, and so far, it is superior to the OEM battery.     Rating: 5

    2012-07-02: Bought this Anker 1800mAh battery for a Samsung Galaxy S GT-i9000. Bought it in September 2011 from Amazon marketplace third-party seller LaptopMate for eight bucks plus shipping & handling. And now, finally got around to writing this review in July 2012. And the battery is still okay. Bought this battery because it was 1800mAh and the phone's original battery was 1500mAh. Does this battery last longer? Well, the Samsung Galaxy S GT-i9000 was apparently never that great with battery life -- unless if you don't use it. If you use a Samsung Galaxy S GT-i9000 phone like most smartphone users would do, and particularly if you are a heavy user, then it's probably going to last maybe like five hours or so. If you DON'T use the phone at all, but keep it turned on to wait for incoming calls and texts like with a dumb feature phone, then this battery may last for a couple days or so -- and again that's if you don't use the phone at all. But if you use the phone like a normal smartphone user would, then expect to have to charge the phone/battery more often than you may want. If you want to try to extend the life of your battery, you can try using some apps like the "Load Monitor" app and the "Juice Defender" app. (The "Load Monitor" app may also help to prevent the Samsung Galaxy S GT-i9000 phone from randomly shutting down.) Also, if you put too many apps on your phone, that could use up the battery because some apps may stay running in background for one reason or another. This is why my phone currently doesn't have a ton of apps on it. Yes, that sounds dumb, but these android phones always seem to be quirky. Otherwise, it helps to plug in the phone when not using it in order to keep it juiced up, and you may also want to keep your old official OEM samsung battery on standby to swap into the phone if you are caught with this battery running out of power. Nonetheless, this Anker 1800mAh battery was worth getting because it was made by a quality manufacturer and where the 1800mAh was suppose to be better than the original samsung stock 1500mAh battery.

    Rating: 4

    2013-08-01: The battery in my Samsung Epic 4g s2 started acting up. Wouldn't hold a charge. Took the battery out and it was bulging. Google search pulled up this is a common issue. Way to go Samsung!!Bought this battery by Anker and it has been a few months no problems. Great battery and much better than the one that came with my phone!!

    Rating: 5

    2013-01-07: Great! Works for exactly what I needed. now I keep backups with me on hand , in the car, etc.if your battery doesnt last all day, (and trust me i know yours doesnt either) just get another battery,plus after 500 cycles, you original battery is toast anyhow.

I will not buy any other battery. This is the one for all my phones.

    2013-03-30: Battery lasts a long time, I think longer then my stock battery. The only issue I have and it's probably just my phone is that it freezes 3-4 times a day to the point where I have to take the battery out. It's probably my phone but it happens constantly since I got the battery.

    Rating: 4

    2013-06-07: My Galaxy S2 started to die with 70% battery and I noticed the original battery had swelled up. Needed to get a replacement ASAP so I ordered this on a Friday afternoon. Estimate said it was going to arrive on Monday, so I was pleasantly surprised when it showed up at my door Saturday. Nicely packaged, unlike most cheap batteries you would find, with instruction and warranty information.Now my phone is back to life, and I can't be happier.

    Rating: 5

    2014-01-13: My wife had an original battery in her cellphone and it wouldn't last but about 2 hours (in standby). She is amazed how she doesn't have to charge this every hour and can actually let it sit by the bedside overnight without charging it.

    Rating: 5

    2013-08-01: My epic 4g touch battery was swelling up and about to explode. Sprint wanted like $45 for a new one because the insurance only covers the battery for a year. Kinda sucks but what ever, this thing is top quality and lasts longer than the OEM battery. Plus it was like $8 so cant complain. Definitely buying anker again if I ever need a spare.

  • B00DEQ3A22

    2013-08-19: The Tactic adheres to the surface very secure. I even tried to get it to wiggle off by jerking it abruptly. Check out the video for the test.The wallet is a really cool feature to me. It adds more functionality than just a standard universal strap. I can see the Tactic useful for the business person who uses an iPad, Android tablet or smartphone on the job in the field or even in the office. It is ideal for anyone who needs security for holding the device for long periods of time.This strap would be a great accessory for the jogger/runner because the wallet can fit your ID and keys and the strap will stay in your hand even if your grip loosens a little. I doubt you would drop your device while jogging with Tactic. If you don't like to use an armband and prefer to hold the device, this will compliment your needs.

    2014-06-13: I installed the Tactic on a glossy TPU case for my Galaxy Note 2; it is basically permanent. I do not use this case everyday. Great for carrying phone while walking or shopping.     Rating: 2

  • B0068PZQT6

    $B0068PZQT6

    2011-11-23: After a few days of calling every ATT store in the Boston area I finally found a Titan in stock last night and picked it up. I was too impatient to wait and take advantage of the awesome penny deal on Amazon plus I was exchanging my Focus S for the Titan so I took to plunge. (The Focus S is an awesome phone too and I wrote a review last week on Amazon about it. I just wanted to try out the latest and greatest so I traded it in for the Titan)The Titan's screen is HUGE but the phone still fits nicely in to one had. HTC has designed this phone beautifully and almost the entire front of the device is filled by the screen. The bezel on the left and right side is almost nonexistent. This phone is gorgeous. The screen has a resolution of 480x800 which by today's standard is a bit low but you will be hard pressed to even realize this during everyday use. The Windows Phone OS looks fantastic on this screen and text is very easy to read. Videos and pics look outstanding and the super LCD really nails the correct colors accurately. You will love this screen.Under the hood the Titan is powered by a 1.5 GHz single core processor. I am not sure why other OS's require dual core processors because Windows Phone OS runs buttery smooth on this phone. No matter what I throw at this phone nothing slows it down. Microsoft has really done a wonderful job keeping this OS lightning fast.You get 16 GB of storage which for me is plenty. I have a ton of apps, games, music and videos on my phone and still have 9 GB free. Unfortunately there is no memory card slot so the 16 GB is all this phone will ever have. You do get access to 25 GB of free storage on Microsoft's SkyDrive which is integrated well in to the OS so you can always store your pics and docs in the cloud if you run low on storage.ATT markets this as a 4G phone but it isn't true 4G LTE but just the HSPA+ network which is still plenty fast. In Boston my average download speed is right around 4Mbps a second. Not too shabby at all. The call quality so far seems top notch but quite honestly I have only made a few. The signal strength in Boston isn't that great to begin with so at times I am running with only 2 bars of strength. It doesn't seem to impact calls or the internet so as long as things run well I do not care how many bars I have. It is something I will pay close attention to in the coming days and will update my review if things take a turn for the worse. So far things are fantastic though.The sound on this phone is great. It can get VERY loud when using headphones so be careful how far you crank up the volume. The external speaker is quite good for a phone but can get a little distorted when you max out the volume. The phone does not come with ear buds so you will need your own set. This really isn't an issue as most of the earbuds that come with phones are junk but I did find it odd that none were included.I don't want to talk about the OS too much as this is a phone review but for those who have not used Windows Phone yet you will be amazed at how awesome it is. This is the future of mobile now. Once you use this OS going back to iOS or Android is very hard and you will wonder to yourself how you ever got along without Windows Phone and it's brilliant Live Tiles and super smooth operation.While the app store is not nearly as large as Apples or Googles I have found that almost every app I used on my iPhone 4 has a counterpart on Windows Phone. You will also find the Windows Phone versions of your favorite apps look, feel and operate better than the ones on iOS. Wait to you open apps like USA Today or IMDB. They are truly magnificent. If you are a gamer and own an XBOX 360 then you really should be on Windows Phone as XBOX Live is integrated right in the OS and compatible XBOX Live games on Windows Phone include achievements so even on the go you can get those glorious little achievement notifications that some people have become addicted to!That is it for now. I have to get back to playing with my new phone! If you have any questions please feel free to leave comments on my review and I will try to answer them as soon as possible.UPDATE 11/24/2011 - I have had the Titan now for a couple of days and my opinion that this is a fantastic phone is just getting stronger. The battery life is outstanding. I took it off the charger yesterday and used it quite heavily the entire day and when I went to sleep at 11:30 PM I still have about 9 percent left. This phone will easily get you through an entire day.I have also now played with the camera and can say that the 8 megapixel camera takes great photos. Outside in daylight is where this camera really shines. I took some panoramic shot with the built in software and they came out quite awesome. The colors were very accurate. The video recorder works very well too and I got some great outdoor footage in glorious 720p. Taking pics inside the house at night with the flash on hurts the quality a bit but I still think the inside pics look a lot better than the ones I take on my iPhone 4. I think you will be quite happy with the camera's performance.UPDATE 11/25/2011 - Office is absolutely awesome on the Titan. While you don't get to see more of your documents on the screen compared to smaller phones due to the resolution what you do get are documents that are much easier to create and edit. I have noticed this especially while using Excel as each cell is much bigger and easier to manipulate. This phone just keeps getting better and better.UPDATE 12/03/2011 - 4G speeds. After researching 4G speeds on wpcentral.com it appears that AT&T; may be throttling their Windows Phones. In Boston where we have HSPA+ speeds I should be seeing twice the download speeds that I am currently getting. I still average around 4 Mbps which is fine for just about everything I have done so far but it sure would be nice to be up around 8. I am still leaving the review at 5 stars because the phone is still incredible but this is something you may want to consider if you are planning to switch over to AT&T;.

    Rating: 5

    2011-12-13: I was first in non-existent line on Day One for the Samsung Focus and later had a Dell Venue Pro. Windows Phone Mango is by far the sweetest, slickest and intuitive mobile OS out there, but this is the first real, lust-worthy Windows Phone that does it justice. Everything about it is absolutely gorgeous. It's easily pocketable, don't worry about it being too big. You don't even realize what a monster screen it has until the screen fires up and dazzles with incredible color and pitch blacks. The HTC Hub and Photo Enhancer are much more useful than the Samsung apps on the Focus. Top-notch camera, decent battery life (a day) and the loudest and clearest speakers on a mobile device since the Blackberry Bold 9000. The definitive flagship Windows Phone in the U.S. until Nokia drops their goodies in 2012.

    Rating: 5

    2012-01-02: I've been using the Titan for just over a month now and there's no way I'm going to back to my iPhone.Pros:This screen is big and beautiful.The overall size is just right for me, even with a Case-Mate Tough Case. I keep the phone in my front pocket and don't even notice it's there.The phone is fast. Games run without lag, apps launch quickly, the screens scroll smoothly, and the phone is very responsive to touch.The camera is incredible. The picture quality is superb, even in low light.Cons:My wireless signal bounces between EDGE and 4G a lot trying to find the stronger signal. This is more an AT&T; issue, although I didn't have this problem as frequently when I had my iPhone.The dual-LED flash is sometimes over-powering.

    Rating: 5

    2011-11-26: I bought the HTC Titan on "Black Friday" and I must say that I'm very happy with my purchase! Upgrading from a Samsung Focus, I decided to stay with the Windows Phone devices because they are fast, reliable, and fun to use. I've owned an iPhone 3G and a Samsung Captivate (Android 2.1) in the past, but I prefer the setup of Windows Phone 7.5 overall for my cellphone needs.To make this review easier to navigate, I'll break it down into some of the features I consider most important about this device...1) SIZE & SCREEN: Okay, the first thing I noticed about the HTC Titan is that it's one BIG PHONE! Sporting a 4.7" Super LCD screen, the Titan made my old Samsung Focus (4" Super AMOLED screen) look like a toy! Even though the Titan has a large screen, I still find it comfortable to hold, because the body is pretty thin. While waiting for a phone case and holster to arrive from Amazon, I've been carrying it comfortably in my jean and jacket pockets without any problems. You will hear plenty of folks complain about the Titan's lower screen resolution (480 x 800) compared to Android and iPhone devices, but I don't think it's a problem. Everything displays sharply and well-lit on the Titan and sometimes I casually display it in the presence of iPhone and Android users, just to get a reaction ("Hey, look at THAT!"). Anyway, its like having a 60" 720p HDTV (Titan) and comparing it to a 32" 1080p HDTV (iPhone/Android)... give me the BIGGER SCREEN everytime! Bottomline: the Titan has a large, beautiful screen which looks great compared to other phones. Ignore the haters!2) PROCESSOR SPEED: The snappier 1.5GHz Processor on the Titan compares favorably to other phones! For those who are considering high-end Android devices or an iPhone 4S just because they have dual-core processors, rest assured that the HTC Titan is no slouch when it comes to speed. Overall, I noticed no slowdown while using my device to run apps, games, or videos. Windows Phone 7.5 doesn't currently support dual-core processors, but there really isn't a need at this point.3) 16GB MEMORY: Okay, this area is really a shortcoming, in my opinion. Why did HTC only install 16GBs on this beast? Even my old Samsung Focus was expanded to 40GB of memory space! Microsoft needs to really raise the bar in this area, in order to stay competitive. If we are supposed to load our phones with content, why not give us the extra storage space to do it?! Bottomline: HTC needs to expand the storage space to at least 32GB.4) WINDOWS PHONE 7.5 (MANGO): The Windows Phone operating system is a complete joy to use. Using a home-screen comprised of tiles, you can start your favorite apps pretty rapidly with this device. Multi-tasking is similar to the iPhone in everyday use. Just press and hold the "arrow key" on the phone and you will see screenshots of previously used apps or functions displayed like a row of playing cards. Tap the "card" of your choice and you'll be back in that program in a flash! Windows Phone 7.5 also offers great features like Facebook, Twitter, Linkedin, Microsoft Office, Xbox LIVE, and Bing integration. Want voice recognition software? Just push and hold your "Windows key" and you can issue a large number of commands to your phone (i.e. "Call Lisa", "Local Weather", "Open Office", etc). Microsoft Office integration is greatly improved on Windows Phone. You can access numerous Office files (Word, Excel, OneNote, and Powerpoint) by storing them on your phone or syncing with an outside source like Office 365, Skydrive, or Windows LIVE! Speaking of Windows LIVE, you can import your contact list and appointments in a flash with this operating system.5) TURN-BY-TURN NAVIGATION/GPS: I had a chance to use the turn-by-turn navigation on this device and its pretty good! You can pair your device to your car's Bluetooth connection (if equipped) and hear the commands over your radio speakers. Miss your turn? Tap anywhere on the map and you'll receive updated directions!6) 4G SPEED: Hey, this Windows Phone has 4G speeds using HSPA+ networks! Try that, iPhone lovers!7) WINDOWS MARKETPLACE: Not something specific to the Titan, but it definitely bears mentioning. As of this writing, the Windows Marketplace has over 40,000 apps available for download. Sure, its not near the numbers available on the iPhone or Android devices, but its still a significant number. You will find popular apps in the marketplace, like Weather Channel, Amazon, Kindle, Netflix, Google Search, and a ton of other useful apps. Most apps offer a "trial mode", so you can try them out before purchasing. AT&T; will let you buy them using a credit card or by adding it to your phone bill. Look up "Windows Marketplace" online and check out the selection for yourself!8) HTC APPLICATIONS: The Titan also has some great apps available for FREE from the manufacturer! I downloaded a Skype-like application (Tango), YouTube viewer, LED flashlight app, weather hub, and calculator.9) 8MP CAMERA/720p CAMCORDER: The Titan has an awesome 8MP camera with auto-focus and multiple settings. Additionally, it has twin LED flash and a camcorder capable of 720p resolution! AWESOME!!Well, I could go on and on about this device, but I'll bring it to a close. If you want to try something different (Windows Phone 7.5) and don't mind having one of the BIGGEST phone screens around, check out the HTC Titan! Its a great phone and I give it my highest recommendation!UPDATE: If you are interested in using Skype on this device, it isn't currently available for Windows Phone. However, Microsoft acquired Skype this year for $8.5 billion, so we should see a Windows Phone version soon. In the meantime, the Titan has a 1.3MP front-facing camera and supports a program called Tango. This program is similar to Skype in functionality and is supported on the PC, iPhone, Android devices, and Windows Phone.UPDATE (10/28/12): Just wanted to mention that Skype is now available for Windows Phone. Additionally, these Windows Phone 7.5 devices are expected to receive an upgrade to Windows 7.8 in the very near future. Although this phone will not be upgradeable to Windows Phone 8, it will still enjoy some of the same features which are not hardware dependent. I would still recommend this phone to anyone, because it is still awesome! The 4.7" screen still trumps the iPhone 5... HOOAH!!

    Rating: 5

    2012-02-26: Searh for "Terrible Call Quality" in google and first link will show up...device has basic call quality issue, bluetooth implementation sucks, bad internmet access and several places where other phones are able to get signals Titan is not seeing signals, and this is when it claims to be 4G phone....Iphone 3gs was giving me much better and smooth experience in those areas....If you can sustain with these issue phone is superb, top screen, Mango is just cool os, very sleek looking and good camera....I am using it from day 1 and got several complains about other person had issue hearing me....Update: 03112012Hotspot is another issue if you are using hotspot for over an hour and then try to make a call, it wont call at all (phone is getting hot)if you started hotspot surfing internet on laptop, then try making a call and laptop internet gets disconnected, why?

    Rating: 3

    2012-08-14: I am as huge of a WP fan as you will find. I am a great cheerleader for the OS. It is the best of both worlds: You can customize, remove, and adjust your homescreen, shortcuts, and app selection as you want. It is a fantastic user experience- seamless, smooth, and a fun time. I love the Office tools, the calander is one of the most useful there is, it incorporates your email and social sites so amazingly well, and is a great media/internet experience.That is why the Titan is such a let down. Call quality is as poor as you can imagine. There is echoes, garbled reception, and callers on the other end almost can not understand the speech at all. We have had 4 Titans and this has been true of all of them. 2 of them did not load sites correctly, one had a screen that stopped working, and another would not allow email updates.We purchased the device in November of 2011 so this is a long term problem. I can not recommend it. We got the HTC Titan 2, and the call quality was much better, though still not a strength. We have had no problems with it. Please avoid the Titan for your own sanity. If you are in love with the 4.7" screen and like HTC, the T2 is a much better option.

    Rating: 1

    2011-12-20: I won one of these in a contest, not that it matters as I would have happily paid for it and was up to that point planning on doing so. This is not my first Windows Phone, but it is my favorite so far. The screen is amazing, the software is so fast and responsive, and the interface and hubs have made everything I need so easy and fast to get to. I don't know how I lived with out these hubs pulling in all my stuff, organizing it, and putting it right at my fingertips. I was not a facebook person before but the integration with this system is so easy and rich that it sucked me in. If you want the BEST of BOTH Android (hardware/phone selection) and iPhone (stability/simplicity/music experience) PLUS Microsoft Office Mobile AND Xbox Live this is the one for you!

    2014-01-23: What I will say is that this product is of better quality than the dip-flip case by HTC! However, just as with the dip flip case, wear is a issue. Firstly, the inner contrasting gray is a bad idea because it picks up dirt very quickly. Before you know it you are left with a very nasty looking inner case. The leather like material hold up pretty good. However, after only a months use it begins to flake away on the inner edges of the case. Between the dirt and flaking leather you end up with a case that doesn't present your device very well. As for protection I feel like the case does a pretty good job of that... Also the ports for the speakers are a good addition on a flip case.

    2013-11-22: This has become my favorite case for my Samsung Galaxy Mega 6.3. It is very form-fitting and slim, so it does not add unnecessary bulk to this already sizable phone). The leather is nicely stitched and put together ... it looks professional, and you'd be proud to have it next to you on a conference table. One caveat the very top and bottom are not protected (the corners are protected, but top and bottom are exposed), so if dropped in the right place, damage would occur. Moreover, I have had the phone drop from only about a foot or so, and the phone fell out of the case (no damage, but note that the case does not hold the phone too firmly). The cut-outs for volume, power, mic, speaker and camera are excellent. When talking on the phone, just close the case (rather than folding it back) and speak with it closed, as their are cut-outs for the ear piece and mic -- this is much more convenient than folding the cover behind the phone.
